description:
This is my first time today when I ordered food for home delivery.
The service was really fast and food was delivered before delivery time.
I was not sure of the dish 'Kashmiri Chicken' so wanted to taste and order it and it was really yummy and texture of spinach and chicken was really good. 
It was really nice of them that they gave me an extra dessert (kheer) and my taste buds loved it.
I will be ordering more often from here to try other dishes
author: Chanda B.

description:
Service? What service?

Went there for dinner by myself and I wish I hadn't. After I got seated, I waited almost 15mins for someone to come take an order. Their staff was standing around lounging and the restaurant wasn't busy at all, only 5-6 tables had people so the place was pretty empty. I soon realized that 15mins wasn't too bad. Since their tables are so close to each other, I could clearly hear people on the tables next to me. When I got there, couple sitting at the table to my right had already finished their food and had empty dishes. After I ordered my food and got it delivered to me, the couple on my right were STILL waiting for their empty dishes to be cleared and brought their check! Meanwhile, the server completely forgot that the lady sitting to the left of me had ordered dinner and he brought her the check (which she obviously had not asked for) for the one appetizer she had! I mean, how oblivious could they be to what was happening when the place is almost empty?

As for the food, I ordered butter chicken with plain naan. Butter chicken was meh at best and was super salty. The naan was under cooked. If I wasn't starving, I would have left without eating. 

There's no shortage of Indian restaurants in SF so not sure why anyone should pick this place. Don't make the mistake I made, go anywhere else but here.

Edit - Yelp just notified me that this place has a poor health score (68/100). "Following a recent inspection, this facility received a food safety rating that is in the bottom 5% locally, and is categorized by inspectors as "poor"." Wish I could give them less than a 1 star!
author: Mayank A.

description:
What an awful experience from North India Restaurant tonight (11/6). I ordered delivery through Yelp with an estimated delivery of 40-50 minutes. My order was confirmed at 7:38p and the estimated delivery time was 8:29p. The food did not arrive until closer to 9p, when it did arrive it was cold. The delivery also did not include any utensils. 

The actual food was not only cold as stated before, but was lacking flavors that make Indian food a true standout. The chicken tikka masala was bland, and the chicken was dry. The chicken vindaloo was not spicy, the chicken was bland, and the spices were not what I've come to expect and enjoy from vindaloo. The garlic naan tasted like the frozen kind you purchase from the grocery store, as did the samosas. 

I would definitely not come here again the next time I'm in the area and the service received by the restaurant and grub hub makes me question if I will ever use Yelp for delivery again also. 

With the many other options available for Indian food, I suggest trying somewhere else.
author: danyle w.

description:
We went after the Giants game and there were probably two other tables dining there. It was pretty slow, we got the fish pakora, Tandoori salmon, pulau rice, and naan. We were pleased to find out the fish used in the pakora was salmon. Unfortunately, it did not meet our expectations. It tasted like they was refried from a previously fried batch from earlier. The batter soaked up excess oil, it was soggy, super salty, and had an odd taste to it. The tandoori salmon entree came out on a sizzling plate which looked appetizing. It was not tooo bad... 

The green chutney and tamarind sauce was the best part of the meal. Customer service was ok too, they filled our drinks pretty often.

I'm a little disappointed I did not CHECK-IN prior to dining in or we would have seen the poor food safety score notice. (Thanks, yelp for putting these notices up!!) I usually always try to checkin to check reccomendations for good entrees but we had such a good buffet lunch here a few years ago, I didn't bother. Ggrrr! Two stars because they have room for improvement and maybe be great again like how I remember..AND hopefully get their health score uP, please!!!
author: Chanel H.

description:
This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in SF. The food is flavorful, ambiance is cozy, and it's usually easy to get a table so I find it reliable when I'm in search of warm Indian food :). 

I've come here both for lunch buffet and come countless times for a la carte dinner and takeaway. The lunch buffet is excellent. There is solid variety for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike! It's a great spot for a team lunch. But, I'd definitely recommend a la carte over the buffet. 

Below are my favorite dishes for when I order for dine in or takeaway:

Chicken Korma - this one is outstanding! It is so incredibly flavorful and zesty. It's different from your usual chicken tikka masala due to the almond base, but in an incredible way. I'd highly recommend trying it to stray away from the usual popular orders. 

Dal Saag - An excellent healthy dish for the vegetarians that is much lighter than a paneer makhani or tikka masala. 

Chicken Tikka Masala - A timeless classic that is done well at North India

Mushroom Matar - This is a fantastically spiced dish of peas and mushrooms and again much lighter than the creamy tikka masala or makhani sauces. 

Overall, I love the food here! Deducting one star for service which can be slow at times, but I hope it is something that improves :).
author: Sabina S.

description:
I came to North India two times (once for lunch and another time for dinner). I am not extremely well-versed in Indian cuisine, so both times I ordered the standard chicken tikka masala. My boyfriend got the Sunday lunch buffet when we went together; he also loved it and thought the quality of food was very high, despite it being a buffet. I think the Sunday buffet price was $14-15, but I don't remember the exact price, and chicken tikka masala was $13, with garlic naan and rice an extra $2-3. As it's located smack-dab in the Financial District, prices are not cheap but the food is completely worth it. 

North India's chicken tikka masala is one of the best dishes I've ever had, probably in my entire life (or maybe I just haven't had enough Indian food yet!) It is slightly spicy, buttery, and mouthwatering - managing to achieve that wonderful elusive blend of savory and tanginess, without going overboard. The sauce is not too oily and greasy, and the chicken is juicy and hearty. In addition, the sauce pairs wonderfully with the basmati rice! The garlic naan is incredible, and addicting - a perfect complement to the chicken tikka masala. Portion sizes are massive, and absolutely enough for two meals.

The restaurant itself is very pleasant, and service is efficient and attentive. I will be sure to be back whenever I visit San Francisco!
author: Claire L.

description:
3 stars for food, -1 star for service, +2 stars for always being there for me. 

I've been to North India Restaurant a few times now, and no doubt the food is tasty. The waiters are not well trained but really exert well-intended effort to go about serving you. 

In my late night Yelp searches, North India tends to be the highest rated restaurant that's open late night that is either on my way home or delivers to my home. So, thank you North India, for satisfying my hangry belly when no one else can. 

Sorry to do this, but this is a bit out of love. The footprint in my take home bag really shouldn't have been there. Or someone should have noticed that there was a footprint on it before giving it to a customer. Maybe its because it's a family-run joint?
author: Sheewon B.

description: Shitty delivery service. It is almost 30 mins past their promised delivery time and, 20 mins since their claimed "any second now" when I called them!!
author: Abdul K.

description: Great affordable place for a lunch buffet. They always have tons of options for vegetarians and non vegetarians alike, although it is hard to find seating there so expect to wait a few minutes when you get there (you might also get your table stolen so be prepared for that). They usually have some kind of pakora which is always crispy (but not too oily) and tasty, some kind of paneer curry which is always good (my personal favorite is the palak paneer) and endless jeera rice and naan. Last time I went there I liked the dahl dish a lot too, although it could've used a bit more salt. They always have ice cream for dessert and the buffet line never gets too insanely long. Great place to take a group of people for lunch because you have tons of options.
author: Sampath D.

description:
Delicious food and great service ! We ordered the Thali and really enjoyed it. 
We really liked this place and will definitely come back.
author: Victoria F.

description: So I just saw the poor health score and now I'm really mad I wasted a lunch here.  I was on yelp to report how terrible the service was.  Do not go here if you're pressed for time.  It's super disorganized and I had to approach stuff multiple times for things like menus, how we order, who takes our order etc.  They took so long to even take our order by the time we were done, my husband had to go and I had to hang back to pay the bill.  Oh and when you order and you're asked about rice and naan, don't be fooled.  It doesn't come with the meal.  We were totally uphold on rice (gave us two orders so it was way too much) and two orders of naan.  I had no idea a) they were not included in the entree and b) had I know it would be a separate charge, one order for the both of us would have been sufficient.  Left a bad taste in my mouth. Never going back.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Great dinner option in the Financial District!

Our group of 3 ordered a mango lassi, regular naan, fruit and nut naan, bengan bartha (eggplant), samosas, salad, chicken tikka masala, and gulab balls for dessert. It was all delicious, high quality and very filling (so much so that we had leftovers) One side of rice was enough as well. I would recommend everything we had!
author: Roya B.

description: Today I had to work late, and this place is open till 11pm! I came and ordered the lamb biryani, naan, chicken korma, papadam, coconut ice cream, and rice pudding. Everything was good as usual. My favorite spot is in the corner because I get to sit on the couch. Surprisingly, even when it's late, they always have customers.
author: Andrea T.

description: Great saag paneer!  Excellent service.  Will definitely return to this convenient financial district spot.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
Went there for lunch on a Sunday. Place was busy, but they still had a couple empty tables when we arrived, so we were seated right away.

Seemed like everyone there was eating from the buffet (no one gave us menus), so we followed suit.

We got there around 2pm, and the buffet options seemed limited/low. Food refilled slowly (e.g. they put out a few pieces of naan at a time), and a lot of the curries just had sauce and not much in it. Food is labeled, but there aren't any descriptors.

Food was decent though, but if ordering a la carte is an option, I might do that instead next time. Buffet is reasonably priced ($14 or something), but because of the slow refill, having a set meal seems optimal if you don't want to be there forever.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Ok I like this place now:) the food is always consistently good and recently I went there and had some of the best chicken vindaloo!!
They go above and beyond for their customer!
author: Chris T.

description: The food and service here were both excellent! I had the chicken tikka masala, and asked them to make it spicy, which was delicious! Enjoy!
author: Aneela C.

description: The service, atmosphere, and especially food the is just amazing ! Would definitely come here again
author: Kayla K.

description:
1st Indian Restaurant I've been to and there's not much to complain about. I came because I'd the 50% off Yelp deal and I'm glad I checked the place out. The food is decent, good flavor and great spicing of the lamb korma. A nice and fluffy naan for $2 is nice too. I got there at 5pm on a Friday and it was empty, so I had the place to myself and the waiters helped me do pretty much everything, from pouring my water that was at my table to packing my food to go. 

The place has a bit of debris on the floor, but if you look past that the place looks fine enough. 

This is a nice place to get your Indian fix in quiet. A bit pricey, but in the financial district, it's relatively average priced at $11-$18 per entree. They do have a $14 lunch buffet which sounds enticing. 

PS: The restaurant owner is fairly yelp conscious and gave me rice pudding for this review, but it was simply to write it. 

PSS: The rice pudding was nice, considering it was my 1st. Literally rice and light sweet cream.
author: Daryl N.

description: Great quiet place for great Indian food. Food tasted great. Entrées are a great size And full of flavor. Try the Indian rice over the white rice and the garlic bread is to die for. The price is great and could feed multiple people with 50 bucks. There was no line and no wait time. We walked in and was seated quickly.  Try the appetizer was really delicious.
author: Miguel A.

description: The staff was amazing one of the best experience I have ever had in San Francisco. The food was quality and everyone was so attentive and friendly.
author: Adonai T.

description:
North India has grown on me over the last 2 years. My first meal here was a bit of a disaster, thankfully I came back, and it is now one of my favorites.

I love their Mushroom Saag and Chicken Korma.

The Chilean Sea Bass Marsala was disappointing. A high fat content fish like this should be sautéed, not stewed, or its totally wasted and indiscernible from a much cheaper fish. I am presuming that it really is Chilean Sea Bass.

This is a nicer than average Indian restaurant South of Market with nice decor and attentive service.
author: David T.

description: Not a fan. Ordered mild but still too spicy. Sag paneer doesn't taste right. Took over an hour to get here. They did not bring me utensils.
author: Jessica P.

description: Great food, definitely recommend it. Staff is also very friendly. Would recommend the garlic naan.
author: Arshdeep S.

description:
Had dinner at North India Restaurant on 9/7/2018.

Chicken tikka masala was pretty tasty with lots of chicken. Flavor was good, though it was a bit salty. Garlic naan was too dry and below average.

Fish tandoori was too salty for us. Fish had lots of meat and juicy and nice mix of grilled veggies, but saltiness almost numbed my mouth.

Sweet lassi was nicely priced ($3) and good. We had pineapple ice cream and gulab jamun for dessert, both were good.

Food was about average but service was really good and they treated us well. One weird thing is Yelp removed my previous short review - leaving another one this time.
author: Hyun Goo K.

description: My friend and I ordered Yelp delivery (Mattar Paneer, Chicken Vindaloo, rice, and garlic naan) from this restaurant yesterday and we were quite surprised when it arrived. Both curries were very soup-like and not thick like we expected (see first image). I called the restaurant and they were really nice to us. They offered to send us two more curries that were thick. About 30 minutes later, a second delivery arrived with the two curries, rice, garlic naan, and a rice pudding (which was delicious!). Not only were the new curries delicious, they came exactly as we requested (see second image). This restaurant's customer service really turned our experience around. We would both order from here again!
author: Kelly R.

description:
I'm totally satisfied with the food and service!
Try the chicken butter or the chicken Masala! I would come back again!
author: Habibi H.

description:
Such an amazing place in the financial district. We went there around midnight on a Saturday night and they remained opened until we finished eating.

The food is beyond delicious and the staff is so nice. This is absolutely our new go to place.
author: Sevda G.

description:
Make sure you check no. Of items on buffet. In our case, there were 3 vegetarian options and 3 non vegetarian. Quality was absolutely terrible. We were handed the check just as we sat down for the buffet, so, fantastic service! ( please note sarcasm). Ladies bathroom was clogged and really dirty. Husband said men's bathroom was disgusting too.
Cannot say I'll be back. Ever!
author: Ashwini S.

description: Tried Chicken Makhani here and i would say it was really good. One of the best i have eaten in SF till now :) would be back to try some more dishes.
author: Sharad B.

description: Nice decor and above average food. They could use a more creative name in my opinion. Did not see the poor food safety score till after I dined there....gross.
author: Sunil R.

description: The food is great but really poor customer service. The restaurant was not even busy and took them 10 minutes to acknowledge our existence. They took our order in a hurry. The food runner had very poor manners. I also asked for yogurt sauce and never got it. If you want to try their food order to go.
author: Cassandra Q.

description:
Went to NIR with intention to have buffet lunch. First impression was the white paper on white clothed tables was a bit fancy for buffet. Nice touch. Silverware and glassware clean. Very presentable store and decor.
What they got right- plenty of meat and veggie dishes for both vegetarians and otherwise. Food was flavorful and spicy. Good value and great flavors.
What they could improve- if you are going to have a buffet, the platters should be kept stocked. I went up twice for cauliflower dish and both times just digging in scraps. Location is tricky, parking difficult (not their fault but want to be sure other visitors go with a bit extra time). 
Overall, I give the place 4-4.5 for food and flavors. I would say this is the best Indian curry buffet I've had in a while. Worth a Visit. 5* is reserved for the very best. This place is very close to best Indian buffet, if not the best.
author: John B.

description: I had lunch buffet here and it was solid. Not the best ever, but definitely better than most. Service was adequate but not spectacular. Very nice setting. I'll go back for dinner someday.
author: Curt B.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in SF. All the dishes are consistently tasty. Great vegetarian options - we particularly love the bengan bhartha and the dal.
author: Michael S.

description: The owner was very nice it is a nice restaurant and very clean good food in San Francisco
author: Abby T.

description: DONT EAT HERE! The food was just "OK" ( BUT ) the cleanliness of this restaurant is REALLY something to question.... I walked back to go to the bathroom and saw the kitchen floor?!?!? See my picture... crap thrown everywhere. Apparently they don't have a designated place to put the dirty linens ... or I hope those weren't the ones the were putting on the tables!????Then made my way to the bathroom, the nasty rings in the toilets etc. told me AGAIN, they don't clean anything... Then I tried to wash my hands and both soap dispensers were bone dry.  How do the employees wash their hands?!?!?  DONT DO IT!
author: Gina C.

description:
Really great Indian food in the Financial District! Gulab Jamun was really fresh and tasty. Chai was also spiced very nicely, don't forget to ask for sugar!

Good service, always kept our water full and were very friendly. Will definitely stop by to try the lunch buffet!
author: Amir K.

description: My colleagues have said "this is my favorite Indian restaurant in the city" so I had to try it... verdict is: GUILTY - of being delicious! Yum. Started with the Mango Lassi, definitely recommend! Then the samosas, double yum! & the chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo which was stellar. The whole ambiance of the establishment and the customer service made the experience extraordinary. Hands down would agree with my colleagues on the joint. See you next time, North India!
author: Amanda V.

description: I ate here last night. Service was slow and here was no one inside! Also they forgot parts of our order. Anyways, I got food poisoning from the food here. I was up all night in the bathroom. I think something was cooked raw. I was literally crawling around to get from my bed and toilet. Never had this level of pain before. Be careful eating here.
author: John D.

description:
Came on a Saturday at 5:30 pm, there wasnt any wait which was nice. The group of us ordered chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi, saag paneer, garlic naan and vegetable samosas. Rice has to be ordered separately (ordered 2 for 3 entrees, it was more than enough, although the server tried to pressure us into ordering 3 rice sides.)  All of the food was pretty good, although the rice tasted slightly strange- like it had been washed in dishwater. The garlic naan was a bit dry, but still complimented the entrees well. As a plus, the aloo gobi was even good as a leftover 2 days later. 

I used the yelp check in to get 50% off the second entree, and the server asked me to rate them 5 stars on yelp in exchange for some ice cream. I'm not too keen on bribing for 5 star reviews, but he brought the ice cream anyways.... the mango was on point. 

But yeah, overall an honest 4 stars without the bribery.
author: Noel P.

description:
On the one hand, it's the cheapest lunch around this part of town ($6), and the line typically isn't very long. On the other hand, it tastes like the cheapest lunch around too. Not much interesting seasoning, very bland. Especially the garlic naan, if you pay extra for that.

The lunch buffet is way overpriced for what you get (~$17), at that price the bland food just isn't worth it.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Don't go by the 4 star reviews. Food is taste less and not worth your money.
Don't eat here. They also have poor health safety scores (as of July 2018)
author: Arpit J.

description:
This review is for delivery via Eat24!

We ordered...
1) Chicken Pakora: Deep fried boneless chicken with herbs and spices ($8.50) - This was pretty plain and we had to dip them in the Chicken Tikka Masala sauce. Also they were not crispy; perhaps better to be had at the restaurant?!

2) Chicken Tikka Masala: Barbecued boneless white meat sauteed with herbs, spices and tomatoes ($12.95) - This was tasty but nothing stood out. However, I do want to give credit to the chicken being very tender and juicy. 

3) Rice ($2.00)/ Naan ($2.95): Standard items, I suppose 

So I had no idea this restaurant has a low health score. If I had known, I probably wouldn't have ordered from this place. With that being said, everything tasted fine and the delivery was quick and pleasant.
author: Alice L.

description:
This Indian restaurant replaced Tara Thai restaurant years ago.  I finally tried it because it was open on New Year's Day.  We ordered Seekh kebab, chicken murgh, and Punjabi fried rice -- all requested to be very mild.  We got the all 3 of Goldilock's 3 bears:  the Seekh kebab was pretty spicy, the chicken was mild, and the Punjabi fried rice was bland.  But we were very grateful that something was open on New Year's Day.  

However, I was put off by the cleanliness factor.  The knives on our table and the ones next to us were dirty, as well as the large plates that were brought by the waiter.  Plus, it is cringeworthy when a waiter's sleeve brushes the top of a drinking straw in a cup of water.  We were also given a half-full jug of water from another table with greasy fingerprints.  One waiter was semi-apologetic, and another was altogether confused by our chagrin.  I got the sense that this is a family business, which I totally love supporting, but I recommend taking more care with hygiene and presentation.
author: Miran C.

description:
Pretty solid food here. The curry is tasty, hot, and yummy. The lunch buffet is awesome and has a ton of options.

I really like the lunch boxes that they sell. I usualy get the chicken and vegetable lunch box (which also comes with rice), which costs me only $7. The lineup for lunch is short and moves quickly, so it's a great cheap grab and go place. Definitely would recommend for lunch.
author: Desmond C.

description: The food are very very nice. We really enjoy the lamb curry and the Kheer. Not sure if it is authentic Indian food, but definitely tastes good and the price is very affordable. Love it.
author: Xiaohui L.

description:
A friend of mine was visiting SF on a Sunday and wanted Indian food.  Thank GOD this place was open in the middle of the day on a Sunday in SOMA when almost everything else within a 3 block radius was closed.  

There was 1-2 other parties in the restaurant while we were there, but otherwise we basically had the restaurant to ourselves.  The seating is cozy, but classy.

We ordered lamb vindaloo, hydrabadi chicken, 2 garlic naan, and chicken biryani.  The flavors of everything was AMAZING.  The spices were well balanced, well bloomed, and just an overall party in my mouth.  The naan was thinner than I'm used to, which gave it a great crispiness.  I sopped up all the sauce with that naan.  

The staff was very attentive: replacing our water, clearing plates efficiently, and asking if we needed an additional order of naan.  

I would definitely come back.  The best Indian food I've had at a restaurant.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The service is worse than bad. The waiter was pushy. He tricked us into an extra charge for rice and naan  that we never ordered. Straight up fraudulant. But the worst part was the absolute hostility with which they treated our party. Couple that with an AWFUL FOOD SATEFY SCORE OF 68/100 (lowest 5th percentile) and it's clear this restaurant should be avoided.
author: Jason M.

description: Food, service, music everything was awesome!! Definitely recommend it. We had garlic naan, paneer makhani and dal makhani.
author: Parth P.

description:
Me and my family came here for a quick Sunday dinner last week. The customer service was bad from the moment we entered the restaurant...and it just gets worst. We were seated down and not served with anything (no menu, no water) for 10 minutes. Once we ordered the food the wait was 1 hour 10 minutes before our food was served. During the wait we have prompted them regarding our food but they did not seem to care. Our order arrived but was missing an item which we informed them right away so they can bring it out. We finished our meal and never got the item. Also, Our daughter was siting on a high chair and the waiter was holding knifes and folks walk pass at very close proximity to her head. Waiters didn't care, had no smile. 

We are never coming here again. You definitely shouldn't come here if you want expect standard service!
author: Alice Sillon M.

description: This is a hidden gem. Their samosas were really good. They have good daal makhani and great ambience for the price you pay.
author: Sonal B.

description: My God quite possibly the most water downed Indian food ever. One of the dishes tasted like tomato soup with a dab of curry and chicken. Definitely do not eat here. Either this place is paying someone to write fake reviews or people in SF don't know what Indian food is.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Edit//
Just wanted to clarify and expound on why I gave this nice, quiet restaurant 4 stars out of 5-- tikka masala tends to be my go-to food at Indian places and as much as I loved the sauce and spices in their recipe, I found the chicken to be more on the dry side. As always, it would be nice to have more pieces of chicken as well!

- - - - -
Service and food were great! We got the chicken tikka masala, curry eggplant (or eggplant in a stewed, thick yellow sauce that had a nice kick to it in flavor!), kabuli (fruit and nuts) naan, and an onion naan. The food came out piping hot and the naan warm, the taste was very comforting and not overly spicy as some Indian dishes are.

We also ordered a nice full glass of mango lassi that was thick and sweet, tastes like they did use real fruit and quality yogurt to blend the drink!

The only reason I am only giving 4 stars instead of 5 because there were stains on the water glasses and the plates and utensils were a little oily to touch. (I'm a bit of a germaphobe and a neat freak).

Overall I liked the intimate ambiance of the place and how it was relatively quiet enough to talk in hushed voices and still hear your company talking. Thanks for the great dining experience, will be back to satiate my Indian cuisine cravings!
author: Victoria W.

description: The staff was very hospitable, the sauces were great, and the place was very accommodating for groups albeit kinda loud. The food was pretty good, that being said the health rating did scare me. The gulab jabun could have been warmer. I would gladly go again, hopefully the health score will improve, but it didn't seem to hinder my experience.
author: Robbie P.

description:
This place is disgrace to Indian Cuisine. Airplane food tastes better than this.

Tried their buffet lunch twice. The Tandoori chicken was cold. The butter chicken was too milky. The chicken was chewy and seemed stale, probably from the left over chicken tandoori. The naan bread was cold and bland. The fish pakoras had more of batter than fish, which was also cold.

Coming to the service - They made us sit close to window under bright sunlight while there were other empty tables around. When we requested to sit at other table, the server impolitely refused. The servers seriously need some training in hospitality. The server got our checks while we were in the middle of our lunch. (both times) It was very rude - we felt like we were being asked to leave.

Will never visit this place again.

Edit: The recent report from Food Inspectors also show the poor quality of food.
author: Amit P.

description: Food was mediocre at best. Requested that the food be made spicy and the waiter chose to not make it spicy because he "didn't believe me." Which is ridiculous to me, the food should be made as requested by the customer. Overall service was bad, won't ever be going back.
author: Karen T.

description:
Food and services are not good at all.I was disappointed visiting this restaurant. Highly overrated. No one was concerned we were there neither the owner nor the server. 
Buffet is super disappointing.
author: Arvind T.

description: Horribly mean attitude to MealPal customer. When I showed up and let them know I am picking up a MealPal order, the staff just instantly walked away and said to me "outside". No complain about the food. I hate to give a 1-star, however this was overall a bad experience.
author: Yanzhong L.

description: Such great Indian food. Was there for the buffett and couldn't have been more satisfied. Sunnit  had impeachable hospitality and rajit was of great assistance as well. I'm sure that's not the correct spelling but they definitely made the lunch along with the food. Thank you!
author: Diego S.

description: I felt very awkward because I haven't been to this restaurant and I had wrote a review a couple days back and the owner reached out to me now and completely apologized and willfully said he will give me a refund! They were very nice people when I walked in! Very welcoming! They were just busy! But I can definitely say they did try their best! Thank you!!
author: Jasmin S.

description:
I went here for a lunch buffet, on a Friday.
The place was packed and I had big expectations. I noticed the buffet counter was a bit messy and the servers weren't paying attention either. 

The food was average, it tasted fine but could have been much better. They took a long time to serve rotis/naan breads which was disappointing. They had Indian beer, so do try kingfisher beer if you decide to check out this place.

Overall, decent food but with a bit more care from the management, the place would be a lot better.
author: Saarthak C.

description: Good portions. Clean environment. Decent prices for the location. Was offered complimentary dessert when I showed the 50% discount offer. Got the chicken tikka masala and aloo gobhi. Naan and rice were separate charges.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Ordered from here after looking at the 4 star reviews. I don't seem to understand why is this place so highly rated. 
Tomato based curry was clearly made out of canned tomato purée. Vegetable curry was watery with no taste. Appetizers were undercooked.
There are so many better Indian places in the city which are even cheaper than North India Restuarant and taste so muc. Please don't order from here.

The restaurant did make an effort to contact me regarding the review and offered a refund for my order and till I don't revisit this place, my review stands.
author: Divya G.

description:
Ordered the chicken tiki masala, garlic naan, lamb saag, mango lassi, and vegeyable pakora to go. Everything was so good and flavorful. 

Tiki masala was creamy and tangy. Garlic naan was crispy amd flavorful. The vegetable pakora had great seasoning; however, eat these right away. Don't save them becuase their fried batter will soften. The mango lassi tasted like liquid mango!

Holy crap I definitely have to come back for their lunch buffet!
author: Cynthia M.

description: Food was delicious and very good. Staff was great and friendly, provided good service and gave us complementary desserts. Would definitely come back. One of the best Indian food restaurants in the city!
author: Cecile ..

description:
A restaurant with great potential.

Unfortunately, my visit here was a very bad experience and I hope that feedback can make the restaurant better.

There was a lack of customer service:
1. The waiter walked past without checking if everything was good on the table.
2. Went too long from we arrived until we got drinks.
3. Dirty glass is not ok.
4. Talker and cutlery were thrown on the table and not laid out properly.
5. Long wait.
6. Small taste of food.
7. The waiters did not care about the guests.
author: Joakim P.

description: Best Indian food I've had since moving to the bay! Really loved the food, the service, the owner, and the Indian pop music. We will definitely be back!
author: Kelley K.

description:
We walked from our hotel and were quickly seated. Servers were polite, although a little slow. We didn't feel rushed or pushed out the door, so that was a refreshing change from other restaurants. 

Half chicken, naan, beer, and potato cauliflower dish were good. Spice level had too much heat on the potato dish. Server courteously volunteered to have it remade. 

Good place for authentic food.
author: r s.

description:
This place more than holds its own amongst the eclectic array of cuisines in the city. Its long since been a favorite when ordering delivery or take out but, with my parents in town for the first time and on Father's Day to boot, it was their first Authentic Indian food experience & they hit the nail on the head yet again 

The service was on point, they checked in on us just the right amount of times, they were pleasant, polite, attentive, and helpful. 

The place has a low key, intimate atmosphere, warm and comfortable.  Locations dope, parking was easy. Not a bad thing to say.

We ordered quite a spread in order to sample the breadth of their offering, and not one thing disappointed.  You'll want to double or triple your naan order, or maybe it's just me. 

But yeah. Go here.  10/10
author: Josh S.

description:
Good food. Taste is just perfect. I had ordered a plate of samosa, aloo paratha and paneer mutter. However, the Paneer mutter was not that great. The gravy was not at all rich and creamy but was very watery. The taste was okay but the dish could have been definitely better done.
Overall, this place is worth checking out.
author: Gopal I.

description:
Tried the lunch buffet. Awesome food. Authentic taste. Highly recommend.
Value for money
author: V J.

description: Very bad decision. Weekends , going to a restaurant in financial district is a foolish thing. Young Steward is very rude.I asked him to change the glasses and water. Lack of hygiene and respect to its customers. You can see the pictures. He gave a look.
author: Vishali N.

description: Great food and very nice service. We enjoyed our family dinner here, my son loved the shrimp and we liked the malai kofta and paneer. Try the goat cheese naan, very soft.
author: Foodie F.

description:
Not at all a good "North Indian" restaurant. I don't know how they managed to get theses many good reviews. Me and my boyfriend had the buffet here. The food quality and taste both were pretty bad. The people working there seem to be hating what they do and were not at all friendly. 
I don't think we are going to come back.
author: Nikhita K.

description:
Buffet style indian food with high quality rice,meat, samosas and more.
the biryani was nice and soft, butter chicken was rich and creamy; best of all, it didn't make me feel bloated like other indian buffets do
author: Sammie B.

description:
So... we went there because they're open pretty late and we had come from the Embarcadero cinema to find not a lot open on a Sunday evening. 
I'll make this short and sweet. The kitchen has got its act together way more than the waitstaff. So the food is good but the service is inattentive. It's kind of weird to see this, it's more commonly the other way around. I gave specific instructions for my dish and they did it right. But you may find yourself begging for your water glass to be refilled. 
The ambience is also kind of quirky. They have the lighting down right, but their choice of music was not appropriate for an Indian restaurant. 
Hey guys, if I want to hear hip-hop I'll go to a sake bar.
author: Steven P.

description:
Awesome food , 
I was visiting from Chicago and the food tasted so rich in taste , definitely Indian hospitality at its best with quick and prompt service.
author: Gautam K.

description: My friend and i chose the buffet option.  The food was delicious, we went for thirds! They have a lot of vegetarian options. The staff is also very nice!
author: Iamina R.

description: So just like any other Indian restaurant in SF, they want to fool customers into thinking that chicken karahi, chicken qorma, chicken handi, boneless chicken is equal to chicken tikka masala. It happens to me in almost every Indian restaurant I visit in SF. We ordered fried fish in starters that was not at all crispy secondly it was salmon that tastes worse when fried. Biryani and service was good that's why 3 stars. Won't visit it again as it's expensive and super low quality.
author: Qasim Z.

description:
Please train Sunday staff just received my order hardly any chicken curry watered 
down to thin soup like broth cubes of cheese were not cut also only 3 pieces in dish I love this place but this is terrible cooking on Sunday
author: Alandria S.

description:
My coworkers and I just ventured out to the "back door" of North India for a carry out meal. 

You go up to the door in the alley, tell the man what you want and he serves up a box from the 4 large pots right in front of him. I believe take out is cash-only as I did not see a credit card reader nearby. 

MENU
The carry-out options are: chicken $6, veggies $5, chicken +veggies $7, and lamb $9?

Naan is $2/garlic $4

QUALITY: The chicken flavor was good with just the right amount of heat. However, I had to keep spitting out chicken bones and cardamom seeds throughout the entire meal. I was also a little disappointed with the eggplants & potato vegetable side as it was barely lukewarm and VERY salty.

QUANTITY: the portion size is pretty generous for the value.

SIDE NOTE: I got shorted .50 cents in change which I was told was tax but my co-worker got exact change without tax subtracted which made me wonder whether or not tax is included in these prices. 

TAKEAWAY: This is a decent inexpensive meal option in the fidi but I'm not in any rush to add this into my usual rotation.
author: Nina M.

description: Buffet starts at 11am and costs $14. Indian people were actually waiting for their work lunch as regulars. Good selection of vegetarian and meet options. The dishes were flavorful and spicier than the average mediocre Indian food places in the US. I didn't let the hygiene rating affect my decision and I'm glad I didn't, clearly they weren't closed down for it.
author: William M.

description: Came in late (after 9) hungry.  They were open and the food was terrific.  So far it's my favorite Indian restaurant in SF.  It has a good vibe and large windows with lots of tables so there wasn't a wait.  Even after 9 they were doing steady business.  The food was great - mango lassi was delicious and the chicken tikka Masala was delicious.
author: Jericho C.

description:
Food is very good but they have the TV on with very load voice, which makes very difficult to have conversation with others. 

This what you expect in sports bar not in Resturant. 

Overall good food and good service.
author: Bob S.

description: Authentic Punjabi Food--Naan, Tandoori chicken were excellent one of the best i have had in America. It was a busy night, with less staff, but They handled our order well, food came in time and to order... Keep up the flavors of india... Cheers..
author: Sachin S.

description: Excellent Punjabi food.. and excellent hospitality .. delicious coconut ice cream.. and you cannot beat the location
author: Jasdeep K.

description: Delicious food. We loved the lamb vindaloo which was the prefect spice level. Aloo paratha was our favorite bread that we ordered. Good location.
author: Nic O.

description: The best restaurant ever. Service is amazing so helpful and kind. The kingfisher beer was really great.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Tasty, authentic Indian cuisine. 
Wonderful hospitality/service
Elegant yet comfortable ambience
We've been here for lunch and dinner
This is our favorite Indian restaurant in NorCal.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Delicious foods, good service, and lovely ambiance! Our server Sunny was very friendly and offered us complimentary desert! Will definitely be back!
author: Zara S.

description:
This is a great restaurant. They have managed to achieve this trio - delicious food, great service and good ambience. I tasted Veg. Samosa, Saag Paneer and Garlic Naan. They were great, but in my opinion the star of the meal were accompaniments. They served the food with delicious chutneys and cut onion with chillies. It took me back to India.

Their place is suited for large as well as small groups and is neat and clean. Will try it again when I am in the area.
author: Sanyogita R.

description:
This is a to-go kind of restaurant. The food is probably a 4 but the ambiance and the hygiene in the restaurant is a hard 1. 

Firstly, the staff is pretty unprofessional and not cleaned up at all as a staff should be. The lighting in the dining hall was off as well. The lights kept flickering and there was this strange noise. Once we ordered food we didn't have any service after that. No water refills or check ups. 

When the rice came to the table and I went to dish it out, there was some strange yellow substance on the bottom of the spoon like they just used it for another dish and then threw it in my rice platter. 

I think there are better options tbh.
author: Michael P.

description: North India is my go to place for a quick and cheap lunch - they sell lunch boxes from a door on the side street, I usually get the curry chicken and vegetables for $7 (comes with rice). The line is never too long and moves quickly, I usually get my food within 5 minutes of arrival.
author: Tak K.

description:
Amaze balls !!!! :P This place sure knows how to keep a foodie happy... Excellent service, Great food and super friendly staff. I went there on Thursday evening with some guests as they were craving for Tandoori Chicken and YELP got me to this restaurants. I made online reservations to be on the safe side. 
The place was not crowded, we were seated immediately and served papad with dhania and imli chutney (Crunchy wafer with cilantro and tamarind sauce).
After reviewing the menu, We order Tandoori Chicken, Lamb Seekh kabab, Bombay Chicken curry, Dal Makhni and Tandoori Roti.

Full Tandoori Chicken - Sooo good, perfectly seasoned and grilled. It came on a hot plate with onions, capsicum and lemon wedges on top. We finished the whole thing in like 10 minutes it was that good !!! :)

Lamb Seekh Kabab - This was surely star of the night, soft and buttery. It also came on a hot plate with onions, capsicum and lemon wedges. 

Bombay Chicken Curry - It was just like any regular chicken curry with onion and tomato base. If you like simple chicken curry then you would surely like it, steaming hot with soft chicken pieces. 

Dal Makhni - Another favorite, I love a good dal makhni and no many restaurants know how to make it. But North India nailed it !!! Creamy and buttery, just the way we Punjabis like it :)

Overall, amazing experience would surely go again !!! I am gonna give this place good 5 star because of the excellent service and being so kind to give us free desert (4 Gulab Jamuns )
author: Simran K.

description:
This is one of the best Indian restaurants in the FiDi and definitely a great spot for all occasions. Because I'm a weakling for all things spicy, I really loved their empathy in leaving some of the spice out of my curry. 

The food was great, Cooldeep was the coolest server, and it was all very much affordable.

We got a bottle of red wine, and it went perfectly with the garlic naan and many curries we tried.

Finally, the servers let my friend charge her phone which was super nice and not even necessary.

All in all, major points for super friendly servers and awesome Indian food!!!!!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Granted, my colleague and I had planned to grab dinner from the other Indian restaurant nearby - Tava- but learned that they had closed down/were being in the process of rebranding. 

I ordered a vegetable curry and my colleague the tiki masala. I indicated that I'd like to have my food spicy, assuming that most places will not make their food very spicy. Not so here: my mouth was happily on fire when I ate my take away back at the office. It was a tasty dinner and I'll come back for more. 

While we were waiting for our food, the waiter offered us a glass of wine. It was evening and so I happily accepted. The wine was super sweet, but I really appreciated the gesture.
author: Uli B.

description: The food was absolutely wonderful, from preparation to presentation, very pleasing. Reception and all service staff were very helpful and cordial. The food was amazing, and we enjoyed perfect wait service from Sunny, happy, baljit, Rajat.
author: Thrivikram D.

description: Rajat is the best!!! My chai didn't have sugar and they complimented us with gulab jamun and drinks! I love this place! Such great atmosphere
author: Missy M.

description: I went to this place because it was the only open restaurant near my office at 4th of July. The food was not bad but, It has serious hygiene issues. There were some remains on my plate when they brought it. So I had to ask for a new one. There were also couple pigeons walking around the kitchen area and the weird part is, no one seems like they should take them out. I usually write reviews to praise a place but this one was horrible, just don't go.
author: Ilker D.

description: Great food on a crowded night of Dreamforce. Got us in and out quickly and everything tasted very good. Ordered chicken tikka and vindaloo, dal, garlic naan and rice. Free samosas brought over to welcome us.
author: Ben A.

description: In town visiting SF for the weekend and found this place on yelp. Super glad we stopped in! Amazing food (chicken masala and chicken saagwala were soo good) and the service was great (Rajit was super nice)! Would definitely go again!
author: Sean F.

description: This place is great. I come here often and my go-to is the garlic naan with the Tikka Masala (which comes with cheese, chicken, lamb, or fish). Simple but delicious. They're also open late which is a nice plus.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Wifey wanted to get Indian food somewhere in town, and we Yelp'd this place (#1 on the list). Very easy to walk to if you're staying downtown. They're open till 11 so it's a great late night dinner option.

We got the lamb vindaloo with sides of naan and rice. And we also got samosas. Everything was so good that we ended up ordering everything twice and taking it home with us!

Definitely friendly to the wallet. All of the food was deelish and had great flavor + spice. The food curbed our insatiable appetite for Indian food
author: Nguyen D.

description:
Garlic naan, potato naan, and mango lassi were fantastic!!!
Overall, the food we got was delicious.
author: Pey C.

description: Like the best hidden gems, this place looks unassuming but the food is BOMB. I would never have thought to stop here -- it's usually half empty --but my coworker ordered takeout once and gave me my first taste. It's spoiled me for other Indian food -- I can't bring myself to eat the gross stuff anymore at Pakwan, the Indian joint closer to home. Their saag paneer in particular is special -- it has a light creaminess to the texture but still packs a flavor punch. I've eaten a lot of saag paneer in my days (used to live in Dubai) and this is my fav. I find the food here to be even better than Little Delhi, which is a much busier SF destination. I also recently tried their Indian beer, which is crisp and refreshing, a perfect Pilsner. I'll post some pix later!
author: Carmel D.

description: Great food and great service! I came here to get a quick bit to eat and ended up staying for a while. The food was absolutely phenomenal and the service was fantastic. I was treated very well especially as a solo traveler and it meant a lot. I would come back here in a heartbeat.
author: Christiana L.

description:
If you want to meet an Indian this is then place to go. It gets packed at 12 for the lunch rush. It looks like the strategy is to get as much food on your plate the first time around, because the line gets long. They also have a convenient take out window in the back which is such a great idea, you can grab a plate to .

For those that are worried about the wait or getting back to work, don't! They basically give you the check as you get there to help speed the exit. 

The good is pretty standard for a lunch buffet. I'm sure s a different dinner experience. I guess I need to come back for that.
author: Ronjini M.

description: We've walked past this place many times on the way home and always been envious of their patrons.  Tonight we stopped for dinner. Great ambiance and delicious food. We ordered lassies, chicken bryani, keema nan, and an aloo dish. So delicious. I would recommend the restaurant to my friends.
author: Moe T.

description: convenient for midday lunch. plenty of space if you need to have an office outing. buffet food was not best quality - mostly lukewarm, and if fried was usually soft by the time you ate it.
author: Marshall Y.

description: This place is awesome. It's right next to my work so I come here quite often. The food is authentic Indian food, the service is quick and friendly and the prices are quite reasonable for a sit-down in the area. And the food - oh my gerd, it's so delicious!
author: Tania S.

description:
Terrible food and delivery service took 85 mins to arrive. 
I ordered the chicken vindaloo and it's literally red colored Easter with barely any flavor. There's no thickness to it. It's disgusting. Unbelievable.
author: susie k.

description: So many bones. I had the Murgh makhani and found more than five bones in the chicken which made it quite challenging to eat. Also there were strange pieces of chicken, like cartilage and a joint with skin? Really did not enjoy this meal.
author: Catherine W.

description: Amazing! Great service and delicious food. Fine dining feel without the fine dining prices. Our waiter even gave us complimentary homemade coconut ice cream! If you're craving Indian food or want to try something new, come to North India Restaurant.
author: Catie C.

description:
Tasty Indian food with a lot of options. Staff  is friendly too. They have a pretty cool lunch buffet that's super popular. 

This time I tried the tandoori chicken, biryani, garlic naan and it was good
author: Haris I.

description: Decent Indian place with a lunch buffet near the Financial District. It's not the best Indian I've had, but it has those tasty spices I crave sometimes, and most importantly, it's close
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Great Buffet!

Fresh naan, many vegetarian dishes, tender lamb and chicken dishes, appetizers, and super rich gulab jamun to top it all off!

I'd say this buffet knocked me out in the best way after a gigantic meal for Sunday brunch. 

Totally recommend.

You can't beat the price either. Service was good, too!
author: Priti K.

description: I tried their buffet for a weekend lunch and left disappointed. The served items felt stale and even naans tasted rather sour. I guess the price is pretty good ($15) but I would not return.
author: Gaurav K.

description:
Not impressed.
2 dishes for $32 for delivery, I expect quality. No rice & the spinach panner was not flavorful- just a lot of onion. Chicken tikka sauce was good, but the portions were small & rubbery chicken. I can't believe you have to request rice!!! My driver went back. Thanks Eat24. I'll keep searching for a good Indian restaurant.

Post review, my order was credited & redelivered which is nice customer service.
author: Syrah A.

description: Amazing food and owner is great. One of my favorite places for dinner in the city . Definitely get the paneer tikka masala and the saag paneer
author: Shrey G.

description: Not a great experience in the weekends. Service quality is poor. Most of the items in the menu aren't available. Instead they recommend us what to eat. Your best bet is a weekday early afternoon buffet. Disappointment otherwise.
author: Prashanth C.

description:
Nothing memorable about the lunch buffet but it was about what I wanted. For $13.99 it's way more reasonable than some of the fancy ones. 

Flavors were nice but not out of this world. It also wasn't too heavy or oily. 

Good selection, especially veggie options!

Veggie pakora
Fish pakora
Salad
Rice
Dal
A carrot and pea veggie curry like dish
Saag
Aloo mattar
Chicken makhani
Lamb curry 
Tandoori chicken
Nan
Raita
The green and brown sauces
Kheer

I wish the food were hotter. Everything was sort of lukewarm even though it was in those big hot pots. I wanted to ask them to heat up my food. 

Mango lassi was good but again not memorable. I enjoyed it enough. 

Super friendly service and nice decor. 

If you want high end Indian buffet this probably isn't it. But if you want a solid good reasonably priced lunch, this place is great.
author: Traci H.

description:
The Indian food cravings are so real, sometimes. I was such in desperate need of rogan josh that I decided to forgo cooking dinner one night and order in. DoorDash had quite a few options for Indian food, but I'm glad my roommate guided me in the right direction for good Indian food, because apparently he's made some mistakes in the past.

Typically, ordering online yields lower quality food than visiting the actual restaurant, so if that's the case here, I really need to visit the physical location of North India Restaurant! I had rogan josh with garlic naan, both of which were phenomenal choices. The flavor was perfect. The order was still hot (thanks to DoorDash) and I had enough leftover food for lunch the next day.

I selected "medium" as the spice level for the rogan josh, and I'm sooo glad I wasn't feeling ambitious because "medium" was plenty of fire. Both the curry and the naan were a few more dollars than I would usually like to pay for Indian food (especially after all the delivery charges) but it was worth it. They were generously flavorful.

I suppose everything about my experience with North India Restaurant was unusual. I don't usually order food online. I prefer going into the actual restaurant. I also don't usually write Yelp reviews for food unless I've experienced the service and the environment of the restaurant. But the food compelled me to do so! Looking forward to my next Indian food craving already, since I know exactly where I'm going to satisfy that craving.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Delicious food, friendly and great customer service. That's all u need for a success! Got a seafood combo curry, some rice and goat cheese naan and it was incredibly delicious. I am working close by and pretty much regular here. This place never disappointed me. Highly recommend!
author: Iam J.

description: Love this place! The people were so nice and we got our food in timely manner! The Aesthetic is a classy white table with red rose setting with a city view. I recommend the chicken masala and Kashmiri Chicken
author: Simone T.

description: Authentic northern Indian fare at a reasonable price. They have a great lunch buffet for around $15 on weekdays. The buffet has about six different dishes with basmati rice, naan and dip. It gets quite busy at lunch so you want to arrive a few minutes before noon. Also, great mango lassis and prompt service.
author: Jeromy C.

description: This place is GROSS! These reviews are misleading! All there dishes do not come with rice or bread. This place is costly for no reason. The service is terrible. The servers and management do not know what they are doing. Our server tried to convince us that he served us chicken tikka masala (what we ordered) when in reality they served us butter chicken. I suppose they use the same gravy for both in which case, thats NOT chicken tikka masala. Lastly, I used the YELP offer for this place and our server demanding I write him a good review on yelp to receive the promotion, which was very inappropriate. You are better off spending your money at Amber (its a bit more expensive but WORTH it in comparison) I wish went there instead of this digesting place.
author: S. S.

description: This place is outstanding! 1. The food is amazing! 2. The people are nice 3. The service is excellent! My fav Indian restaurant is San Fran!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Above average North Indian food for most things you order.
Open until late. Good ambiance. The menu has a lot of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options.
author: Priyank D.

description: Very poor customer service. One of my two entrees were not brought to the table until I had to go ask myself 10 minutes after the rest of the food was served. Throughout the lunch, not once our host came to the table to ask if everything is ok. We had to ask for water, for the check, and then again for the check. Also, their portions were incredibly small. Would not recommend.
author: Sydney X.

description: Very slow service and they don't know how to run the restaurant business. Food taste is not at all good..not sure how they got such a reviews on yelp..may be chef os changed now..
author: Pankil S.

description:
All those flavors!

I was aching for the taste of all those exotic spices that one can only find in Indian cuisine. So I searched on yelp and, lucky for me, I found North India Restaurant near me.

I decided to try the buffet and man was I happy with my choice! As you may see from the photo I tried a bit of everything, twice! Every item was tasty! I got my kick of spices and left a happy customer. The only problem I had to deal with afterwards was fighting the overwhelming desire for a siesta! Fortunately a double espresso did the trick and here I am writing this with a big smile on my face.
author: Afshin A.

description:
Lovely and friendly place to have a birthday party of our friends mother!
Delicious food and nice stuff. Will come again
author: Sunshine H.

description: North India is a great place for lunch in the city! If you're in a rush, you can stop by and grab a to-go box. If you have some time, their buffet is reasonably priced and has a lot of options. I'd definitely recommend checking this place out. Unfortunately, their seating area is not huge, so large groups of 20+ might have a hard time with seating, but great for smaller groups.
author: Wyatt S.

description: The service is HORRIBLE!!  We sat here for 2 hours, never got a water refill, ask if we wanted anything else, how is your food?  Nothing!!  Had to summon someone at least 5 times just to get drinks, and order anything additional.  Paying our bill?  Had to finally get up and let them know!  Food was great, but will never come back and actually eat inside- worst service ever!
author: Julia H.

description: This restaurant is very good. We are not very accustomed to the rice here. So the boss sent us some delicious cakes and sauces. Very delicious. The fire is just right.
author: 思迪

description: The food was average. The service was very very slow. They have one guy servicing the entire floor, over 10 tables. This caused many mistakes in our order and the orders of other ppl. I would consider going back for the buffet only.
author: Jugga J.

description:
Four stars only for the lunch buffet. 

I reluctantly go every few weekends when my bf drags me along. I'm then satisfied once I see the curries and my fave veggie pakoras. (The fish ones are a little weird)

Generally a good selection, with delicious naan and chutnies. I tend to like the butter chicken and saag, which I think are there every time.
author: Ke D.

description: A friend and I came here after a super long day of hiking, ready to enjoy some great Indian food. We definitely chose the right place. The food was delicious (Saag Paneer specifically was great), the service excellent, and it was priced very reasonably for the portions. Would definitely recommend to friends in the future.
author: Arjit J.

description: I'm not one for the heat of Indian cuisine, but my wife loves it so we stopped by after a nice walk from the movies. It was pretty empty since it was right after lunch, but the service was great and food was amazing! Even I went back for more and pushed through the spice. We got the veggie curry and it needed no meat...the flavor was literally on fire. Five stars!
author: Scott S.

description: I got this recommendation from an indian friend, who said it is the best in the city, and as an indian food lover, I can confirm his words! REALLY GOOD food and service was great too!
author: Micheli B.

description:
High quality, authentic, delicious Indian food in downtown. 

The portions are plenty for one person. 

I always get the vegetarian curry. I recommend the cauliflower and potato curry. Even though it doesn't have any meat, it really fills you up. It's well seasoned and spiced. 

The atmosphere is really good for a date too. It's looks like a very fancy restaurant without the 3 dollar signs. It's also very spacious so you get your own space. The waiters and waitresses are extremely polite and attentive to your needs so your glass is never half empty.
author: Laurie O.

description: great Indian food, chicken Tikka Masala was cooked to perfection so was vegetarian dishes, excellent service. I highly recommend to try it.
author: Rajinder K.

description: What a great meal! Ordered the samosas, lamb vindaloo, naan bread, and some rice. Everything was fantastic. We ended the meal w Gulab Jamun... what a dessert! Elephant ear balls swimming in sweet, buttery, coconut goodness. A must order!  Service is great, and the location is ideal. Will come back!
author: Ed M.

description: Four star? No way. I had chicken pakora that was actually very good, but the tamarind chutney was way too thin and not very flavorful. Then I had the chicken tikka masala. No flavor. Service not great. Kheer was so-so. Not a good meal.
author: Andrew D.

description: Lovely staff, great food, nice ambiance, definitely will come back
author: Nikki S.

description: Slow service, other people placed their order before us. Took more than 10 minutes to even order food or drinks. We had to walk up to the cashier because the waiter was never around for us to ask for our check. When we asked for to-go boxes, we again waited. Food was decent.
author: Nestor R.

description: We ordered the chicken tikka masala and lamb biryani, both of which were excellent! The portion size was also quite enough (we actually took half of each home), and the service was good. Finished it off with an order of gulab jamun, which was just sweet enough. Definitely will be back!
author: Harrison W.

description: I've been here a few times and always really enjoy it. It's a simple and easy choice to get delicious Indian food with whatever size group you're with. The staff are always really friendly too!
author: Robyn N.

description: Bland and forgettable. 18 people ordered, zero were happy. Also the restaurant refused to label anything so it was a nightmare trying to sort the food. Dry chicken and gritty paneer. Skip it.
author: Daniel E.

description: Amazing food!!! You should try!!! I've tried many Indian food restaurant and by far this one is the best!
author: Rim A.

description: Open on Easter! That is a plus right there. Still waiting on food but the service alone deserves 4 stars prompt, attentive, friendly... Etc etc
author: Peter T.

description: I have never visited North India but have ordered delivery multiple times (approximately 10 orders over multiple months). I initially had a great experience with the food quality and had no major complaints so kept ordering. I did experience multiple delays with delivery which at the time felt understandable due to traffic, weather etc. On a few occasions, I had to do a weird dance with the delivery persons who asked for a cash tip though I had already tipped online. But the reason this is a 2 star rating not a 3 star (or more) rating is because of a particular incident I had ordering here a few weeks ago. I placed an order for a different dish than my usual - the seafood biryani dish. I received my food and was shocked to discover that the seafood was very clearly spoilt. I had paid for and been given what smelled and unfortunately for me tasted like spoilt seafood. I called Yelp/Grubhub and was informed that the restaurant refused to give me a refund and instead offered to redeliver the meal for free. I did not want to receive another similar horrible meal (do they have good seafood stashed somewhere and why didn't they give me that in the first place??). I ended up getting a $10 credit and deleting this place from my reorder list.
author: Ese U.

description: The food is good, but there're not enough v, so it takes 30 minutes to have the dishes ready.
author: Steven L.

description: This place is amazing!! The garlic naan, butter chicken, chicken tikka masala, pretty much everything here, is delicious. The staff here is so nice, patient, and caring! Also get the Kingfisher beer!
author: Mayury C.

description: The Murgh Makhani was fabulous... and with the naan - a most enjoyable meal. Thank you for the good service
author: Mark S.

description:
Food fine but overall disappointing Indian buffet experience. 

1) you have to line up even before you are seated to get in line for food. You are still wearing your jackets and holding your bag if your have one. 

2) the line is like a cafeteria line. So move fast bc ppl behind you also want their food. 

3) after you get your food then someone at the end tells you where to sit. The tables are so close together that I bumped someone's arm with my butt as I squeezed to get to my seat. My flat Asian butt doesn't stick out much so it wasn't the size of the butt that was the problem if that's what you're wondering. 

4) the restaurant is arranged so that if you want to get seconds you have to line up again. Going all the way around the restaurant. The area around the buffet is so crowded that it's really a pain to go back. So really people are piling their plates high and food running into each other and naan getting wet in your sauce etc. I guess only a problem during the lunch rush which is when we were there. 

Price is good $14 per person but really the whole enjoyment of Indian buffet is getting multiple small portions and then going back for favorites. Again the food is fine. A big spicy including the nice shaved brussel sprouts and chickpea salad. As well as this carrot dish that wasn't labeled. I think they are popular and tried to maximize the seating at the cost of comfort and fret space. If I lived here i wouldn't go back but would find somewhere else. 

Also bones was playing on the tv above the tiny bar which was out of place and somehow off putting. Maybe by then I was just over it and everything was irritating me.
author: Jannet L.

description: We are in here for buffet. Zuccini curry ,Chicken Makhani was really good and spicy as well, something we never had in any restaurant.
author: Sahas N.

description: One of my favorite Indian restaurants. The food is always great, and there is a nice vibe inside.
author: John S.

description: The food is delicious but more importantly the hospitality is heartwarming! Felt like home (:
author: Shraddha J.

description:
If there was a way to make a 4.5 rating, that's what I would give it. 

-0.5 because they were out of half the beers on their menu... Lame! 

Service and ambiance were good. 

The food, OMG delicious!!!!  Some of the best tasting sauces I've had in the Bay Area. No, I'm no Indian food expert, but I was full and satisfied and happy and loved my leftovers. The two-person deal at the end of the menu is amazing! 

Came here on a weekend for lunch and it was quiet, which was just what we wanted after the craziness of downtown. 

For folks with kids:  good space for a toddler to roam,  plenty of space for a stroller, chairs comfy enough for breastfeeding, no changing table though.
author: Acid B.

description:
What a varied and delightful spread during the lunch buffet here at North India Restaurant. 

It's a busy spot for lunch during the week but we had a lovely and leisurely lunch one Saturday. It wasn't crowded then and you had time to ponder your choices while at the buffet line without feeling bum-rushed. They have a nice balance of meat and veggie dishes so great if you have vegetarian friends. Really enjoyed the fish pakoras, chicken tikka masala, and the rogan josh. Coupled with some fluffy basmati rice and veggie accompaniments like saag paneer, you've got a very satisfying plate of food. And feel free to go back for more.  

$13.99 lunch buffet is worth it for the variety and service was attentive. The caveat again being weekend lunch where it was great but it probably is more chaotic during the week where quality control might be tougher. I'll be back another weekend soon enough.
author: Jon L.

description: Authentic Indian Food. Amazing Lamb Biriyani. Eating food from here will take you to heaven.
author: Madhu C.

description:
Being indian and In my opinion I would not eat here. Rice was cooked properly, garlic naan with just tons of butter and no garlic, samosa overly spicy. Paneer was decent. 

Staff is nice and friendly.
author: Ank S.

description: Disclaimer: I moved recently from South Bay where the quality of Indian food is pretty high. I  ordered biryani from this place. It definitely doesn't taste like one. It may be called a puloa at best. There was no raita or onions in the side either.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Just had lunch here and really enjoyed it, all the dishes were fresh, good selection and my favorite goat curry was very tasty.  the chai was good as well although they do charge you for it.  All is a good value at $15 in downtown SF.  Keep up the good work.
author: Kent P.

description: Go-to spot for lunch!! Awesome service, delicious food...My co-worker just tried a mango lassi for the first time. Well, I order at least one mango lassi every time I eat here - so worth the calories. Ahhhh
author: Ava A.

description: I suspect that the high ratings come perhaps from the lunch buffet, when the alternative options are pricier in this downtown SF area. The boy and I came for an early dinner one Saturday evening, enticed by the solid review stats--although, I maintain (more than ever, after eating here) that yelp rating stats are not so reliable for authentic Asian cuisine. Every table comes with the bright green chutney and the sweet tangy brown sauce. We ordered samosas, a new-to-me dish of small stir-fried paneer pieces, and the classic daal, with of course a variety of naan and good ol' carbs to make it a proper meal. My samosa was average but the boy complained that his was not heated all the way, but in fact cold in the center. So, not only are the samosas not fresh, but they failed to even heat them thoroughly so that they could at least appear fresh. The other food was similarly average at best; I've definitely had better Indian elsewhere. The most redeeming aspect of North India Restaurant is possibly that the curries come in large portions. Furthermore, most of the staff maintain the average level of customer service friendliness, but our main waiter never smiled, made eye contact, or really talked to us at all throughout the meal, as he went back and forth delivering dishes, which was a bit uncomfortable. And now, there is a Poor Food Safety Score alert here on their page...I'm not sure why this restaurant has such a solid rating in general--I certainly hope there are better Indian options around for SF employees!
author: Amy G.

description:
I enjoy coming here for lunch. You always get seated and the servers are very attentive. They are quick to clean up your empty plate and fill up your water without having to ask. 

I had a business meeting with a partner and the atmosphere was perfect. 
The food is pretty good for $13.00 all you can eat Indian food.
Great service and food! A must when you want a quick lunch meeting.
author: Rommel Q.

description: This is our first time here. The first young waiter we had was a little rude and distracted.  After I asked him twice to answer my wife's question,  a more mature waiter came to our aid and helped us out. My wife ordered the Fish Marsala and was very happy. I ordered the Lamb Kabob Tandory style. It was very good. The food was plentiful and the wine was reasonably priced.  I would recommend the North India.
author: Scotty B.

description:
impromptu yet long awaited indian movie night at my house meant i just as impromptuly ordered out for mexican (to keep things diverse). except all those mzafzas were closing = indian it is!

delivered piping hot 20ish mins before app's estimated time *and* wearing a punisher hoodie. legit y'all.

ordered whatever seemed nastiest. for $40+ after tip portions could've been a tad bigger and / or prices a bit lower. yes that's taking into account blablabla natural blabla local ingredients yadayada.

(^_^) Hydrabadi Chicken $14 (http://bit.ly/2gVT30p)
most pleasing among what i had
"mild" is still a lil kicked up be ready

(-_^) Lamb Pasanda $14 (http://bit.ly/2higP9R)
bunch of the meat was tough #twss

(-_-) Bombay Pakora $9 (http://bit.ly/2hippoK)
very crunchy coating; meat dry & tough
nostalgic french onion taste

wouldn't mind trying the in-person buffet tho.

the movie? didn't finish it - should've heeded the abysmal netflix rating lol. but the food i made disappear in minutes. and ate other stuff afterward.
author: Dan B.

description:
It's fine.    White linen, well-lit, large glass street facing windows, uncramped tables.

The food is unspectacular, ie its middle of the road Indian. For example, I asked for Delhi-spiced Lb vindaloo, not american-mild, the waiter acknowledged and said it back to me-- and we got american mild.   Yes it's tasty for that.

The sauces are not particularly unique, the flavors present but undistinguished.  Sauces might be tinned.   If you've never had better, or best, you'd not know the difference.  And That, is the Real shame.    Fresh, careful and proudly created dishes, not the buffet college type, is a gustatory and olfactory revelation. 

I had hoped for more, but then I know what it 'can' be.   Search for it, its worth it. Gotta be somewhere in SF...
author: Ziv H.

description:
Extremely poor service. Requested a table towel and the waiter said only paper towels.there were plenty laying around on nearby tables.  Buffet spread is average, but tolerable. 

If you can " STAY AWAY"
author: Roger D.

description: Excellent food! The tandoori salmon was excellent. Chicken vindaloo was tasty, but not very hot. Onion naan was good.
author: J G.

description: Food so wonderful!  And awesome service, at deist they were slow then the head honcho came out and all hands were on deck to make our short stay with them a VIP  experience. We had the Indian dinner for two and it was exquisite.
author: Kristen N.

description:
If you enjoy rude service or an uncomfortable environment, come here.

First time in San Francisco, our group decided to try some Indian food. We were seated by an unfriendly host who did not say hello. From the moment we walked in the vibe was unwelcoming. 

Paneer pakora: 3/5. The batter was a bit thin for my taste. 

Chicken korma: 3.5/5. Creamy sauce seasoned with lots of flavor. The chicken was okay. 

Daal: 4/5. Lots of flavor. Not too spicy. 

Garlic naan: 4/5. Could use more garlic, overall delicious when compared to the garlic naan I've tried at other establishments.

Mango lassi: 4/5. Tasty mango smoothie 

Chicken tikka masala: 3.5/5. A spicier version of chicken korma. 

We asked for the boxes and the bill. 15 minutes later, still no boxes or bill. Got up and reminded them we need the bill, only to be responded with "yah yah yah"... and still had to wait an additional 10 minutes. Excruciatingly slow service and there wasn't even that many people there. The food was okay, nothing memorable. I will not return because of the service. Come here if you have time to kill and don't mind rude servers.
author: Tina J.

description: The luncheon buffet is excellent. Lot of vegetarian options. The sauces seem very authentic (more so than many other Indian restaurants I've been to). The spices used were perfectly matched to the veggies. The naan and rice were also delicious. Service very good, and the seats extremely comfortable. Highly recommended.
author: Steven G.

description:
Today we received one of the best gesture from the owner himself. From having one of the worst day at their restaurant few months back we stopped there again and the food we ordered today was amazing and the service was like never before. 

Big  to you Nirmal and team. Really appreciate that.
author: Teerth P.

description: My friend just got a promotion and we decided to come here to celebrate! This place was everything we wanted for Indian food. The lamb pasando and the lassi were my favorite! I highly recommend it!
author: Angela C.

description:
Very welcoming. Food was great. Service was good as well. Like the place a lot but just was not in love with the place. Definitely recommend for a nice dinner with friends or significant other.
