Only downside are tables are kind of cramped. We ordered 2 items and a Naan and had no room for dishes. Also kind of awkward that they had condiments pre set on the table but did not offer anything to eat with them.

Chicken Tandoori was excellent- not dry at all. Vibrant in color as well. Coconut prawns were nice. Enjoyed the broth with the Naan bread. I think they should consider offering complimentary naan.
author: Nick N.

description:
My girlfriend and I visited SF last night to check out some of the art installations around Yerba Buena Gardens and see the Christmas tree in Union Square. We hadn't had Indian food in a while, so we decided to try out North India Restaurant.

While Market Street was teeming with throngs of holiday shoppers, the area a couple blocks east was much quieter. North India Restaurant was mostly empty when we arrived, so we were seated by the window. The interior of the restaurant was warm and inviting. Bhangra music played lightly in the background and the booths along the window had soft, comfortable cushions. It was a nice respite from the clamor of Market Street.

I suppose that this restaurant gets most of its customers at lunch time when it has a buffet. In the evenings, they offer an amazing Yelp deal for half off of a second entree. We were happy to take them up on this offer, and we ordered chicken tikka masala, Bombay chicken, and vegetable pakora as an appetizer. 

The pakora was crisp and had a hint of spice to it. The cilantro mint chutney complemented the pakora well, and my girlfriend appreciated that they put the tamarind in a separate ramekin from the cilantro chutney (she is not a fan of the tamarind). 

Shortly after we finished our appetizer, our main dishes arrived. The chicken tikka masala was rich, creamy, and sufficiently spicy (we specified that spice level to be 'hot'), everything that one would want in this dish. The sauce for the Bombay chicken was very similar to the tikka masala sauce but without the heavy cream. The piquant sauces tasted great with the crisp, buttery naan. The chicken was tender and juicy as well. 

On top of the food being excellent, the service was really great too. What some people in other reviews may call "rudeness" was really just alacrity. Our waiter took our orders quickly (and didn't need to write them down), and our food was brought out to us promptly. 

Amazingly, with the Yelp deal our meal cost just over $30. You can't do any better than that in the City downtown. We will definitely be back.
author: Ravi S.

description: I've been here several times; the food is fine, but the service we had when we went with our 1-year-old was above and beyond.  They opened up the restaurant 15 minutes early for us, and then brought us out a bunch of extra food for our son.  I was impressed!
author: David M.

description: Excellent customer service, possibly the best I have ever had for any food delivery.   Will definitely try again and am thrilled that this is related to India Garden and Clay Garden which have always been my favorite go to Indian restaurants.
author: Kristine K.

description: I ordered "Murgh Makhani" for food delivery with my roommate from Eat 24 and found a super gross used bandage in the dish!!! It terrified me and my roommate!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We thought it's chicken skin but it's not!!!!!!!! Feeling super sick!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Will never ever try anything from this restaurant....OMG... If there's an option, I will give no star for the review
author: Iris H.

description: Delicious Indian cuisine. Prompt service. Relaxing atmosphere in downtown San Francisco.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
Okay, 
I have ordered from here on several occasions, and me and my Co-Worker both agreed that for what we paid we didn't get the quantity that should have been provided. Overall, we have stopped ordering from here because of the low quantities of the food orders. $7 for 6 pieces of Calamari? Not my kind of restaurant.
author: Atum Ra M.

description:
Well this was an interesting experience. My partner and I decided to come here not specifically for the food (even though I would label us as foodies) but for the ambiance as well- since finding an authentic Indian restaurant with tablecloths is not the easiest thing to come by.
Upon entry I was very pleased with my surroundings and would say that this is a good place to have a long dinner if you desire.
We asked to look at the wine list and were surprised to not see any very light reds on the list since Indian is quite heavy but we settled on a Pinot and it was fine.
The food itself also was fine. I am vegetarian and ordered the Bengan Bartha, Paneer Jalfrezi, Goat cheese naan and Garlic naan for dinner.  The food did not necessarily stand out to me but it wasn't bad either. I had tried the Goat cheese naan out of curiosity and wouldn't get it again- I suppose I was expecting a more goat cheese flavor but it tasted pretty much like normal naan to me. The garlic naan was good.
The service was attentive in the beginning and then as the restaurant grew more crowded it was less so. I believe they were under staffed though so I know he was doing his best. 
At the end of the meal I had only eaten about 1/3 of my food because I had ordered a lot and also because I had a headache and so was planning on enjoying the bulk of my meal the next day when I felt better. I asked to get my food to go from someone who was not our waiter but who had started clearing our dishes and he said yes and took my food away- and then I never saw it again. 
We had paid our bill and finally asked our original server if my food was coming out soon and after a discussion with a lot of pointing in our direction with the man who cleared our dishes he came back to say that there had been some miss communication about my food and they hadn't saved it, but they were making my food again to take away. We didn't really want to wait for another meal to be made obviously, but I had had so much food left it seemed silly not to, so we waited and they came out with a to go bag after a few minutes and we were on our way.
I wish I had checked the bag before leaving because when we got home I realized it was a bag full of regular naan and one thing of Butter Chicken which obviously as a vegetarian I can't eat. So I kind of feel like I paid for a meal I didn't eat, but I am not really sure what to do about that one now.
I don't know if I will be returning to North India, but I wouldn't say don't go if you want to give it a try.
author: Holden C.

description: First time trying Indian food! This place was great! I would recommend! The service was wonderful, my water glass was alway full :) everything was clean and good came out fast and was delicious!!! My friend & I ordered and recommend the chicken tika kabob and chicken masala... it was delicious! :)
author: Marissa G.

description: Great customer service from the start! Ate at this restaurant with my girlfriend on Christmas Eve. They provided us with excellent customer service, and were very accommodating to us. The restaurant was clean, tables were tidy and clean, and the silver and plates as well. They took our order right away in a professional manner and answered our specific questions. The food was very delicious. We ordered it very spicy, and they delivered. Food had a big kick to it, but did not lose its flavor. Overall, good experience, tasty food, friendly staff, and clean restaurant. Will definitely come back to try out the lunch buffet!
author: Tushar G.

description: We started with a plate of samosas, which had a weird smell to them. We then ordered two entrees - one was paneer and the other was chicken. The paneer seemed cold and the curry too watery to be eaten with naan/kulcha. The naans weren't warm and could have been prepared better. The waiters were inattentive too. In a nutshell, the restaurant did not meet our expectations.
author: Sai Deepak B.

description: If I could give any less than one star I would. Not sure why this place is rated 4 stars. I had an awful experience at this place during my visit. The service was poor and quality of food was really bad.
author: Syed Q.

description: Great place with a cozy atmosphere. The food is delicious. Very attentive and polite service. One of the best Indian restaurants I've been to.
author: Nik A.

description: The food is great and the service is phenomenal. This is right by my school and if I feel like spending a little more than I would at a fast food place I'm happy to come here
author: Brittany W.

description: Excellent food and excellent service! The waiters are very courteous and accommodated our special requests like no spice etc The manager was checking with all at the tables if they were satisfied and if he could do anything to make their experience better! Highly recommend coming here if you are this side of town. Garlic naan, paneer makhani was amazing!!
author: Jaya S.

description: We are visiting SF and had the opportunity to eat at this restaurant -- we loved it! The chicken korma was delicious with rice and garlic naan  they were all super sweet and gave us some coconut ice cream that was to die for  totally would recommend to a friend!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Butter chicken is a must try ,  love the naan, had my favorable mango lassy.  Except the food. The restaurant setting and service is very good too.
author: Ying D.

description: Was open on Sunday, Rajat was very hospitable and gave me a free beer while I waited. The Papadaum great.
author: Will M.

description:
Having tried all of the downtown Indian restaurants, I can comfortably say that if you are looking for authentic Indian vegetarian dishes then look no more. 

This is as close as it gets to a homecooked meal from India. I love how the serving size and spices are just perfect. At other places, you have to tell medium or hot for spicy level and still, it won't be as per expectations. Here without saying anything they just bring curries which are so good, that you end up licking your fingers. 

It is 4-5$ more than restaurants at O'Farrell street, but it's really worth it.

I haven't been here for lunch buffet yet but heard good things about it.
author: Shubham S.

description: This place has the worst food and customer service. The only reason people will go is probably the lack of indian places at a close proximity. Don't waste your money on what they call a lunch buffet. I was seated on a chair and table that was shaky and what felt like a place in between two tables with less than an inch space that faced a wall. Don't even get me stared on the food. The only reason I ate it was because I was super hungry. They advertise the buffet as $10 or something but they charged me $15, for a totally worthless lunch.
author: Nidhi S.

description: Yummy food. Excellent chicken tikka masala and Sikh kebab. Great service. Will be back.
author: Ankur P.

description: The best indian lunch buffet in FiDi and the food is reasonably priced. Great service.
author: Sarina H.

description: The quality of the food is very rich, it's flavorful. It's extremely filling when ordering entrees. Great customer service, my partner & I came in during a lunch rush and there weren't many seats available but the guy in front sat us in a small quaint corner booth.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Possibly my favorite place to order from when i comes to Indian. They start taking orders at like 10 AM which is fantastic if you are (a) still up from the night before, (b) still recovering from the night before or (c) just woke up late and need something comforting to pair with your 8-hours Netflix binge watch-a-thon on a rainy day.

Chicken Tikka A+
Bengan Bartha A+
Chana Masala A
Keema Naan (lamb stuffed naan) A+
CITY-WIDE DELIVERY 7 days a week for Lunch & Dinner and fast AF Eat24 response A++++

ask for extra sauces for the ride and the bread. both are very addictive.

and don't try ordering at 10:01 AM on Eat24...that's kinda my signature time slot. :-) please wait until 10:02 AM. (dhanyavaad and namaste)
author: Mike V.

description: Chipped scratched plates, tattered smelly menu, poor customer service, dripping serving bowl.
author: Zeba N.

description:
Romantic candlelit dinner with a rose and candle on the table, four friends dined on Indian food. 

The restaurant was pretty empty for a Saturday night and the waiter's attitude seemed like he was working a diner rather than a sophisticated Indian restaurant. 

I ordered a chicken tikka masala ($12.95) with rice ($3.00) and naan ($2.00) and also a mango lassi ($4.00). 

When the rice came out, it was in this small bowl that was really for two instead of four people. Why don't they serve four individual serving sizes of rice??? 

The chicken in the dish was dry and the sauce wasn't very creamy. The rice was good and dry to soak up the sauce. While the naan was great. The mango lassi was delicious but it really fills you up along with all those carbs you're already eating. 

They frequently asked me if I was done with my plate, which is attentive service but I got annoyed because I wasn't done. Just because the big ass plate you guys give is empty doesn't mean the chicken tikka masala bowl is. 

However, we stayed pretty long after we paid and they gave us complimentary milk tea. 

The bathroom was clean and the location was down a pretty quiet street. Service was okay but for the price point it was rather expensive.
author: Nancy H.

description: 3 stars for the food but 1 star for the service. The food was good but nothing worth going out of your way for. The service was extremely slow and impolite. The host took me to my table and pulled a chair out for me, then gave me a stern look when I didn't sit down right away--I didn't because the table hadn't been cleared yet and was trashed. After the awkward exchange I finally sat down and it was a full two minutes before someone came to clean the table while I had to sit there. The restaurant was less than half full and there were plenty of other tables. Then I finally got a menu but had to wait a full 10 minutes before anyone came to take my order. I was literally about to bail and searching for other nearby options on my phone when the server finally came by. The guy was very rude as well. Not getting my money ever again!
author: Michael D.

description: I would probably give this place 2.5 stars but the food wasn't that bad and the servers were polite. My biggest complaint about this restaurant is the cleanliness, which is the main reason for my star rating. There was a bird inside the restaurant because all of the doors and windows remained open. The dishes were dirty - my wine glass had stuff stuck on it that I peeled off, my plates had old food stuck on it, there was a stack of bowls you could use for yogurt and ice cream, I pulled out a bowl that was clearly never rinsed or washed. It still had lentils stuck all over it so I just set it aside. The other thing was that this restaurant has no air circulation. I know I came on a significantly warmer day in San Francisco, but there was no air conditioning and there were no fans. Food was aright but conditions could be improved.
author: Gauri B.

description: This place is fast. Great service and the food is delicious. The owner is very friendly and accommodating.
author: Mmmm M.

description:
I ordered take out through the online Yelp system. It was quick and easy and the food was ready when I came to pick up. Food is delicious and according to my colleagues from India, authentic as well.

When I ordered didn't realize the chicken tikka masala didn't include rice or naan. The owner is nice enough to give me one for free. Just a reminder to future take out orders to add a side of you would like rice included.
author: Alisha Y.

description: This restaurant is definitely an elegant and romantic place. We had early dinner and ordered two lamb biryani, one tandoori chicken and naan. The flavor was okay for us and it's big portion with reasonable prices.
author: Crystal Y.

description: I liked the Kashmiri Briyani here. The restaurant is good for fine dining. I ordered Togo and during my wait time they offered a complimentary tea.
author: Prabhakar K.

description:
North India is truly a fine establishment. The food was solid, the service was OK, and the atmosphere was pretty typical for Indian. Now I should start off by saying that I'm by no means an authority on "good" Indian but I liked what I had. 

I shared a coconut chicken dish and a coconut shrimp one with Morgan F. Clearly, I like coconut. It was V tasty with a good amount of spice. We got rice as well but we had to order it separately. We also ordered some cheese naan. It wasn't that great as far as great cheese naan I've had. 

The service was prompt and the waiter tried to make lots of jokes. It was "cute" but I don't think he knew his audience very well. We were hangry, not in the mood for it. At the end fo the meal, he asked us to write them a Google review on our phones. It came across as push and who asks for Google reviews? 

Overall an OK experience. A little pricey for what it is but nothing too bad.
author: Aaron B.

description:
This is the best Indian restaurant I've ever been to. Delicious mango chutney. And the naan was out of this world. Staff was very nice and readily available. 
I love the gulab jamun! Definitely recommend to everyone!!
author: Alaina B.

description:
The service could improve. Food was not bad and owner seems to be a good person. If they work a little bit on the service, to make you feel valued that would be the difference to get better ratings. The dal and chana were good.
EDIT: The owner offered complementary lunch after I posted review and requested to reconsider the rating. I changed my rating to 3* from 1.
author: Abinash S.

description: Food was good, but they are not honest on the billing. I went there due to a business trip so I kept all the receipt. When I got back I noticed they charged me more than what I wrote on the receipt. People be aware.
author: Ding M.

description: I'm British, so very discerning about my Indian food.  As a nation, it's our favourite food, so subsequently, we are very choosy, and have lots of comparisons to make.  North is simply wonderful.  The lunch buffet has everything you want: appetizers, tandoori chicken, daal, rice, chicken curry, goat curry, and superb vegetables.  Really, the Indians could teach the rest of the world how to cook potatoes, peas and carrots.  The service is swift, friendly and impeccable.  If you haven't experienced Indian food, come to North.  You will love the experience, and fall in love with the food.  If you are a connoisseur of Indian food, come to North.  You will be delighted.
author: Tania S.

description:
The best Indian resturant in SFO- Authentic food lovely location. 
Wow! What a great meal and the serving size was perfect.  The waiters  were  very attentive to our every need and very informative.  All in all customer service is excellent as is the food! Will definitely be coming back again to appease my Indian food craving!
We highly recommend North India Restaurant!  
Exotic and delicious food!!!
author: Jagdeep G.

description: Would recommend!  Friendly, great service. We had vegetable jalfrezi that was delicious, and tikka masala, always good. The kubuli here is phenomenal. The table next us ordered some tandoori that look intriguing, we will be ordering that next time. Seems like this place will be come a usual as we live a block away.
author: Sami S.

description:
food is great but BAD SERVICE and BAD ATTITUDE.
We waited for almost two hours!!!!! And the waiter's attitude is bad when we asked for the recommendation for the fish section, he gave us a weird look and said up to you.
author: Fairy S.

description: Sub par. Service not good. Waited ages to get order. Naan stiff and hard, like if heated back up. Charged for papadum when others really don't, and they give u two only. And  1/2 cooked so not crisp etc.  Just a Disappointing meal. Find another place. Lots in SF. I just choose wrong
author: Donie L.

description:
Nice place to party but drinks are still a bit expensive
Love the music though 
Barack Obama was also there
author: Amney M.

description:
We came here on a Sunday afternoon and had just missed the lunch buffet by five minutes. Our server said the lunch buffet from 11am-2:30pm is their most popular time and they usually have a line out the door. Since we came at 2:35pm on a Sunday, it was an off-time, and there were only a few other people in the restaurant.

The food was great. I highly recommend trying the assorted breads because the garlic and onion naan are really soft. Try dipping the naan in the coconut prawn sauce.

We ordered:
Assorted breads
Rice
Vegetable Jalfrezi
Mixed Seafood Curry
Prawn coconut

At the end, our server gave us strawberry ice cream on the house.

Overall a pleasant experience and great food. I will definitely have to come back for the lunch buffet.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
The service here is wonderful! They stay open late which is amazing if you live in the area where everything is always​ closed. I've eaten here as well as  ordered to go. The food is great and there's options for everyone meat eaters veggies​ eaters spicy no spicy. Be sure to order the chia is not like the stuff you get at Starbucks it's creamy and rich almost reminds me of hot coco. 

Very nice staff friendly and kind. I'd say it's a hidden jem in the busy fidi.
author: Summer T.

description:
I was craving Indian food and decided to check out North India's Lunch buffet ($11.99) on Friday, July 24th around 1:30pm. I thought about getting their lunch box, but I don't really like eating curry with rice and I wanted variety. I figured their buffet was the best solution. I didn't have a reservation and just walked in by myself. They were about 5 other tables already enjoying their lunch.

From the buffet, I sampled the following:
*Palak pakur
*Fish pakaura
*Tandoori chicken
*Malai kofta
*Rice pilav: saffron flavored basmati rice garnished with green peas
*Saag paneer
*Lamb curry: lamb curry with garlic, ginger & onion gravy sauce
*Chicken makhni: strips of tandoori chicken cooked in a mild creamy sauce
*Nan
*Mint Chutney

My first plate was a tiny sample of each of the above so I could determine what I really wanted to eat. I enjoyed the Fish pakaura, Tandoori chicken, Lamb curry, Chicken makhni, Nan and Mint Chutney so my second plate had a good serving of all of those. The tandoori chicken was moist and the chicken makhni had great flavor. I rarely get lamb curry as the roommate doesn't like lamb, so I enjoyed this. The naan was average, but I always need naan to soak up all the delicious curry!

I actually have an Indian buffet option closer to work, but it's more expensive and and super crowded. You spent half your lunch waiting in line. I was happy North India wasn't really crowded. Great buffet option for $12.
author: Elena N.

description: Love coming here for their super inexpensive lunch boxes. There is a little entrance on the right side of the restaurant during lunch time where you can pick up a to-go box for $5-$9 depending if you want 1 or 2 dishes and meat or vegetarian food. The line for the lunch boxes goes pretty quickly.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Great food and great chai tea! There are several dishes to choose from a la carte, but if you just cannot decide on one dish just go with the buffet. The buffet has a great assortment of dishes and they are all great.
author: Gisele M.

description:
Food took way too long and waiters just passed us by like we weren't even there. It wasn't even that busy! The place is nicely decorated but the food wasn't anything spectacular. I honestly think they forgot our order because once we (finally) waived down a waiter and told him out food was taking a while, the food came immediately. 

We got the lamb vindaloo and the chicken tikki masala. Both were ok and pretty filling. We ate it with the garlic naan. Honestly nothing special :( pretty disappointed.
author: Tiffany E.

description:
Food was good, not great.   A dish listed as having cashews had none - just some blanched almond slices on top.  we asked the waiter and he explained they were on top - not in the sauce hurridly, not really listening to what was being said.  After this, service was terrible, like ignore us, we're not here, terrible.

Sorry but no go anymore.
author: Ken F.

description:
+ Very friendly staff
+ Get 50% off second entry if you check in (waiter let us know)
+ Free ice cream
+ Of course, good indian food
author: Margaret R.

description: Nice ambience, good food if you like it spicy! Service is great, we even got free dessert. I recommend this place.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Awesome food and great service!  We had the kebab and chicken tikka masala, both were delicious!  We'll definitely be back!
author: Naish P.

description:
Came here with a friend for diner. Service was okay, busy but nice and polite.
However, the food was delicious, delicious, delicious! We had Lamb Korma with basmati rice. 
The dishes were mildly spiced has per our request. A lot of flavor and generous in size. 
I will come back and recommend this place.
author: Anthony H.

description:
One of the best place to eat Indian food in San Francisco,
Friendly and polite staff.

Best quality and quantity foods served
author: Hardik S.

description:
Excellent service. Food came to the table quickly at our request (we have theater tickets) Wonderful tastes, perfect spicing!
Very pleasant atmosphere!
We'll be back!
author: Janice G.

description: Ordered for pickup from these guys and the host on the phone was beyond accommodating! Need the order by a certain time ? Ok no problem. He even graciously added a dessert! Now that's customer service !
author: Leena A.

description: Great food, great service!! 5 stars!! Would definitely recommend to everyone! Loved the palak paneer and chicken tikka masala! Enjoy!!
author: Anand P.

description: Great customer service and awesome flavors!  I personally loved their chicken vindaloo, it was superb! Highly recommended.
author: Joyce V.

description:
Nicely kept place with excellent food choice 
For buffets. However food was not spicy which would disappoint someone looking for hot Indian authentic flavor or spicy food
author: Manoj S.

description:
I work nearby and went for a lunch buffet during a weekday. We had a group of 20 people and they were able to take our reservation one day in advance. Highly recommend it for group lunches!

The food is really delicious! And the price is not too bad. Lots of meat and vegetarian dishes as well as 2 desserts. 

It came out to be around $20/person. 

The only con is that going back to work after such a huge and heavy meal is a torture.
author: Hiral P.

description: Amazing customer service. Very friendly personal went above and beyond to satisfy my taste. Thank you!
author: Anasmokra S.

description: Just finished our dinner and we are blissfully stuffed!!! Our party of 8 was seated immediately and the tables were decorated with super cute and romantic roses. Mango lassi was to die for, we needed two more orders of garlic naan on top of our original 4, the homemade deserts were the perfect end! Will definitely come back!
author: Megan C.

description:
The lamb korma and chicken kashmiri dish were flavorful but the breads were sub par. 
I ordered the bread basket but all the breads in the basket were worse than the frozen breads available in indian stores. I would order again but just do rice and not the bread
author: Ameet B.

description: Came here for dinner and I will say that although Indian food is new to me and it's something that I don't eat regularly, it was quite enjoyable. It's something I'd try again!
author: Jeannette A.

description: Boyfriend and I were in the area and were actually headed to Steffs to watch the Warriors game. There weren't any open tables and boyfriend wanted to eat some food. We ran into North India and heard the game was broadcasted outside. Boyfriend wanted Indian food since he hadn't eaten so we walked in and boom the game was playing. We end up having the spicy chicken, naan, mango lassi, chai, and coconut ice cream. The owner was cool he watched the game with us and gave us complimentary dessert and chai teas. The check was pretty decent. Service was great and all the workers were superb. I'd come back to this place. Everything worked out.
author: April T.

description: I'm in love with this place. Get the Chicken Tika Masala, it's amazing. Garlic naan and the vegetable samosa and the multi ice cream.....wow!!! I've eaten here 6 times in the last 3 weeks.
author: Jeremy M.

description: Worst experience. Nothing to wipe, had to use the table cloth to wipe our fingers while eating. Asked for water twice but nothing. Worst was when we asked for some onions and lemon. We asked on 3 separate occasion from the guy about getting some lemon and onion and he kept saying "oh yeah, sure". Finally after confronting him about where the onions and lemons are, he says "sorry, onions are finished." WTF? It is an Indian restaurant. What the hell you mean onions are finished? What kind of statement is this? If you don't know how to operate a restaurant, close it, don't say shit like "onions are finished". What a joke.
author: Himanshu K.

description: My original review was pretty negative due to an order being late/cold, but they went out of their way to make it up to me afterwards, and I had a much better experience and better food the second time!
author: Atli T.

description: This restaurant is in a beautiful part of the city with a really nice view. The food and mango lassi was the best we've ever had. The Bombay chicken was amazing!
author: Joy M.

description: Lunch box menu is awesome! You get rice plus chicken or lamb or veggie, or some combo there. It's like $6-7, which you can't really beat downtown.
author: Kelly G.

description: Monica (our server) is basically a soulmate we had been waiting to meet (until we came to this restaurant). She is genuine, thoughtful, and absolutely hilarious. And we loved everything she recommended on the menu. Garlic naan, CTM (Chicken Tikka Masala), some golden paneer squares, and a cup of chai - what else do you need in life? The chef is awesome too - kind gentleman and amazing cook! I just came back from an extravagant trip in India and sorely missing the food. My friend told me this IS their favorite Indian restaurant in the entire city so we came here to cure my Indian food crazing. The rest is history.
author: Elsie S.

description: I have ordered twice from this restaurant and both times the meals were delicious. I ordered Medium spice and it seemed more mild so they must be adjusting for their consumer market. I have chicken tikka masala and lamb saag paneer saved to favorites  I don't even have to think about it. Delivery man was polite and friendly. 5 Stars!
author: JAMIE A.

description:
This restaurant DELIGHTED my taste buds. I love the ambiance and the food was fantastic. And the service was excellent. I love you North India!! Thank you so much for the amazing experience!

We got garlic naan, regular naan, saag alo, tikka masala, and vegetable biryani. All fantastic.
author: Jaime P.

description: If you like spice, AND COCKROACHES, this place is for you. Seriously, I found one little simmered roach in my lamb biranyi. Plus side - he comp'd our meal. The place is empty for a reason. Do yourself a favor and don't go here.
author: Christine M.

description: Very nice and fast service. The food was good, but had no "wow effect", that's why North Indian Restaurant gets only 4 out of 5 stars. The atmosphere was really nice with white dish cloth and flowers on the table.
author: Angela P.

description: Pretty good Indian food for someone who goes often. The reason that I took off two stars is because they told me that they didn't ask for a spice request so they defulted to medium. If you are not a spice lover make sure to get a mild. Medium dishes had a LOT of heat and were very hot. There was more heat than spice.
author: Kimi P.

description: Amazing lunch buffet! So delicious and always tables available. Friendly staff and lots of options for buffet
author: Rey B.

description:
I don't know how this restaurant can get a rating more than 1!!!
THE WORST SERVICE EVER! The plates were dirty. We asked them to change; the waiter took the plates and started cleaning them by a napkin! When he came, we asked him to CHANGE the plates. When he brought second plates, I saw the back of my plate was almost unwashed! I took my plate, went to kitchen, and said: hey this should be WASHED!!
One of the napkins on the table had a big dirty spot on it. I asked the waiter again to change; he took a napkin from next table and literally threw it to our table!
We asked for water first, and he brought us water after 15 mins when we asked again. 
The waiters were very unprofessional and rude. 
They were almost fighting in the kitchen with loud noise!!!
Anything that I saw for service was hard to believe. 
I would however rate the taste of the food 3. I ordered lamb pasanda and it was good. 

Update: I wrote my review while I was still in the restaurant. I gave my credit card to pay. The manager had seen my review and came to our table and apologized so many times and he asked me not to pay for my meal and if I could delete my review. I wouldn't accept that. Anyway he didn't charge me even though I didn't remove my review. I hope they'll improve their service so my review won't be effective after some time!!
author: Mohsen R.

description:
Great service. 
Quick pick-up. 
Friendly staff. 
I had the chicken biryani with raita. 
It's the best biryani I've had in SF!
author: Roshni K.

description:
Lovely food.
Lovely ambiance. 
Lovely staff.
Feels like home.
Everybody welcomes with a big smile.
service is great and quick.
Best is the buffet- only $15 for sooooo many dishes. 
Simply WOW.

SUPER Recommendation.

Try: 
CHICKEN BIRYANI
CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA
KEEMA NAAM
KULFI (Desert)

* * * * *
author: Ronil A.

description: I had the buffet here on a workday (15$) and was slightly disappointed. None of the food item was warm enough. The bhajiyas/pakoras were cold/not fresh, the saag had no paneer...they had plain saag, the saag tasted good though, butter chicken was decent, baingan aloo was okay - not that great, kheer did not taste bad but the milk and rice were distinct instead of integrated with flavor....It was a busy place though as lot of people come here during lunch time...Service was decent...
author: Tejashree M.

description: I've only come here for the lunch boxes, so that's what my review is based on. If you work in the area, for sure check out this place! There is a side line outside just for picking up their lunch boxes, and it is cheeaaapppp and a ton of food. I usually can't finish the whole box for lunch! You get to pick from a few options - chicken, lamb, and a couple of veggies. They have prices for the different combos, and you can ask for naan on the side (rice is included). It's quick, and they take credit cards. And the food is delicious.
author: Grace D.

description: It was a good thing I didn't open the full Yelp page before selecting this restaurant as I would not have even considered it after seeing the poor food safety score warning!  It seemed strange that there were a lot of sauces sitting on unoccupied tables which had probably been sitting around for hours that was a little concerning.  I had the murgh masala which was pretty nice as the sauce wasn't too sour and tried some beer from India.  I didn't have any ill effects afterwards but I don't plan to stop by in the future just in case.
author: Jenny L.

description: Recently was exposed to North India food at a workshop. Ate the chickpeas and spinach and some excellent nan!!!! Excellent food. I highly recommend it!!!!!
author: Dan L.

description:
Not amazed, pretty average Indian food.  

Came here with coworkers for the lunch buffet, which is a great deal for the price.  But seriously how much Indian food can you eat during lunch and still function at work??? If it was the weekend I would go ham, but  couldn't really get my moneys worth since I had to go back to work lol. 

At lunch time on a weekday it is soooooooo packed, and is pretty loud as well so it's hard to hear the people your'e with.  The tables are also sooo close together in some areas which I hate because I can hear everything the people are saying next to me and I'm sure they can hear everything I'm saying as well. [awkward turtle]

Would've been a much better experience after the lunch hour rush, or perhaps dinner.
author: Christina L.

description:
This review is for their Delivery only. We keep trying new places for Indian delivery, because there aren't any good ones in our neighborhood. 

Delivery = delivered in an hour, which was fine, as expected. 

Bhindi Masala = okra sauteed with onions and spices. The best dish. Perfect okra and onions. Ordered medium but barely registering as mild. $12.95.

Chicken tikka masala = creamy, slightly sweet and smoky. Ordered medium but barely registering as mild. $13.95.

Bombay chicken = hot chicken curry cooked in North Indian spices. NOWHERE near hot. It was not even mild, and bordering on being bland. $13.95

Naan = $2.95

Pulao = rice pilaf with green peas. I'd skipped the peas next time, tasted like frozen ones. $3.95

Mixed pickle = $1.95

Raita = $3.00

Overall, good food, but seriously lacking heat.

Prices = moderate. Dinner for two came out to $57.31, before tip and Eat24 $2.00 off coupon.
author: Fannie S.

description: My mom and I had dinner here after a long journey well past our official bedtime (you know how it is when you're tired and hangry!) but dining at North India turned out to be a great decision. The staff is charming and attentive. You wouldn't typically credit a simple bowl of basmati rice as a standout, but the generous portion along with the texture and aroma raises the bar for future expectations. Everything we ordered here was delicious- the samosas, lassi, and channa masala. We will be back!
author: Hilary S.

description:
Just excellent. Definitely my favorite Indian restaurant in the city--my coworkers and I work around the corner and come every month or so. Great buffet--I wish I could eat more in one sitting! The buffet always has a great selection of dishes that rotate, so there's always something new to look forward to. 

Tasty fish pakora with some nice heat, beautifully rich curries with complex flavors, and constantly fresh naan being churned out.
author: X-topher B.

description: Great food, authentic and high level of service. Placed an order and accidentally submitted the wrong order. They were nice enough to send us the correct item free of charge. And it's always a plus when the food is delicious. Definitely eating here again.
author: Yasar M.

description:
Very good authentic North Indian place. Was looking for a dinner on my business trip and went for Indian, no mistake. Ordered a classic trio lamb in deep spicy source, garlic Naan and steamed Rice. Everything was perfectly done, fast and delivered with a smile. They also serve a good IPA on a tap - a nice addition to very rich in flavor Indian dishes.

Totally recommend.
author: Ilya S.

description: Ordered the Bombay chicken and extra spicy. Was really good! The guy was so nice! Great service.
author: Susie W.

description: Delicious Indian buffet right downtown. Completely authentic, great service, and amazing food. Could not have asked for anything better! (I've been here a few times and it is consistently great).
author: Nicole T.

description:
Great food at great price in the city. Nice service. 
Main thing, the food is freshly made and tastes are nearly accurate. I really like the place for their food. Keep it up guys n get even better !!
author: A M.

description:
Huge menu, and great variety of choices. The food is also pretty good. One of the few Indian restaurants that have a decent ambience, and seating space. Unlikely the popup store / takeaway presence at most other places serving Indian.

The 3 star is for poor service. One day - possibly on one of their low business days - we were asked to "hurry" even when we were well ahead of closing time. Literally had to order right on entering. For a family style restaurant, that was disappoint. On another occasion, the staff had little interest in serving us, assuming they would not be tipped. Too bad, I did tip them, but that did not elicit any guilty reaction from them.

I would possibly do takeaway next time, but seating inside is questionable.
author: A K.

description:
They had a Yelp coupon that offered 50% off your second entree which enticed me to order delivery from them only to find out that it is only for dine-in orders.

Their entrees like Chana Masala and Aloo Mutter are like $12 when they are normally 7 or 9 bucks everywhere else.  Then when the food arrived, the portions were below average and the food tasted greasy and low quality - you may as well go to some other place that cuts corners and overcharges serving low quality Naan and Curry-esque food.  Unless you go to places like Dosa or Udupi Palace, most low-rent Indian restaurants - even restaurants like this that serve bad Indian food but charge as if it tasted good - typically have a poor restaurant safety grades.  I am not sure if this one does or not tho but I am just judging it by the taste.

The delivery guy was super nice tho.  So I'll give them an extra star just for his energy.  Also, if you are up late at night and the quality places are unavailable.... I guess this place can suffice.  

Don't entice us with ambiguous coupons just for dine-in orders please.
author: Khash C.

description: Great authentic Indian tasting cuisine with a British flair. Fast service and generous management!
author: Kes T.

description:
tl;dr, Great place for a quick business lunch.

Tried their lunch buffet today and it's a decent experience. The decor is comfortable and welcoming. The table layout is a bit tight but bearable.

The food is solid for buffet. I'm not from India so I can't say if it's authentic. But they look freshly prepared and the flavor is balanced. There are a also enough varieties to choose from. I didn't have enough space in my tummy to try every single dish so I'll probably go back at some point to finish my tasting objective. 

It's not cheap: $13 after tax, before tip. But this is pretty standard for SOMA,
author: Joseph L.

description: Called to make a reservation. Yelp says you close at 11pm and was told if I wanted to dine  at 10pm I had to dine fast. Seriously? No thank you! Plenty of restaurants that want business
author: Daniela J.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been here maybe 4-5 times for dinner, but we feel like royalty each time we visit. We'll start with the food: amazing! The curries are flavorful and spicy (as we always request), and the naan is always buttery and soft. The service is only an added bonus - Cooldeep/ Kuldeep (sp?) always takes care of us so that we leave full, and we couldn't be happier each time. 

I would recommend North India Restaurant to anyone who loves their Indian food, with the added bonus of quality service. Also, pro tip: take advantage of the check-in offer on Yelp and get 50% off your second dinner entree. :)
author: Liz C.

description:
Awesome service, very attentive staff. Food is amazing. I ordered chicken tikka masala and was great not too spicy how I like it. 
Also ordered garlic naan and was extremely good. 
I recommend dining in or delivery. 
Restaurant is at a good location and they are very clean.
author: Mr C.

description: Terrible service. Average food. Salmon tandoori was bland. The okra had too much turmeric. The servers didn't care. We had to wait for ages to just get a glass of water. Owner then told us that the kitchen would close and we would need to order immediately. But then people entered the restaurant more than 30 mins after we ordered. So obviously the owner was making stuff up to shut shop early.
author: Adi Y.

description: This is the place where you could eat authentic north Indian food. There food has spices so does indian food. Visit this place if you love to eat spicy food .
author: Swati M.

description: I was just 2 days in SF and wanted good Indian food.Good prices, huge portions, really tasty and spicy! I had the chicken biryani and goat cheese nan. Nice staff.
author: Goldy C.

description:
Ordered chicken korma to go and received cubed chicken in yellow gravy. Not sure how this was different than tikka masala (except the color). Chicken korma should be minced chicken meatballs and not just plain cubed chicken. I've also been here for lunch buffet at the end of the day and the naan was stale and tough. Desserts didn't deserve a first look and the mint icecream was just plain store bought and uninspired. 

The lunch box for $6 is a steal. Probably best bargain around the area. Go here for the lunch box if you are on a budget otherwise don't bother.
author: Yash R.

description:
Came here with a friend a couple weeks back and the thing about this joint that sticks out the most in my memory is the excellent service. Our waiter was personable and took the entire experience to another level. 

Portions are large and food is delicious! The ambience is a mixture of casual and semi-fancy (think cloth napkins and table covers).
author: Nicole A.

description: You order chicken biryani and you get fried rice with chicken pieces. Ridiculous. Never chicken biryani if you looking for real authentic biryani.
author: Fenil P.

description:
The lunch buffet here is pretty decent, with a good variety, but the downside is that the restaurant is a complete a sh*tshow during the lunch rush and very chaotic. 

They would ask people to stand in the long line for the buffet before the wait staff even find an open table for the diners. It's definitely more efficient, but it causes a lot of confusion when diners, with a heavy plate of food, try to navigate the dining room crammed with tables, trying to find an open spot. For $5 more, it's definitely worth it to go to Amber, but if you're low on time, this place will do fine. 

The buffet changes every day, but they generally have 2-3 veg dishes, 2-3 meat dishes, 2 appetizers, 2 desserts and 2 salads. The naan bread isn't great, though. Definitely pile the plate high with food because you don't want to waste another 10 minutes standing in line for round 2!
author: Alice W.

description:
One of the best saag paneer I have ever had.
Excellent garlic naan.
Music, ambience, decoration and atmosphere are just  outstanding.
Cherry on top was a complementary dessert gesture outside expectations and far, blown my mind away with such a authentic coconut icecream.
author: Gustavo T.

description:
Punjabi music blaring, cheap no nonsense buffet with all the classics (deal Malani, Saag, navratan korma) and kingfisher on tap = finally some solid north Indian comfort food in SF! Not quite Delhi but the closest thing I have found in this city.

Don't expect a high end experience but everything they do fits the required level of service. Pro tip: ask for some fresh garlic naan even when dining with the buffet.
author: Rishee J.

description: This place is home away from home. I had dined here 4 times in 2 weeks and still cannot have enough. You know when you have ghar ka khana. This place will remind you of your Mom. Deep respect for their hospitality. Waheguru Ji Ka Khalsa Waheguru Ji Ki Fateh
author: Krutika J.

description: Pretty good. My  boyfriend  took me here and we found it on Yelp.We enjoyed  the food and the nice environment. I  like the Indian ice cream here.It was so special.
author: 欣妍

description:
Liked the the Service and great hospitality... Mini Punjab, all staff seems to be from Punjab.
Good for North Indian cuisine in SF.
author: Akshay J.

description:
We came across this place while walking around FiDi....and a sudden craving for Indian appetizers coupled with the the very welcoming decor drew us in.
A big big shoutout to the masala chai....as authentic and flavorful as possible.
We had a bunch of appetizers and tea. 
Panner pakora- crunchy and well seasoned
Tandoori lamb - bursting with flavor....perfectly cooked
Tandoori shrimp- overcooked and little bit rubbery....disappointing:(
Tea- heavenly 
Also, worth mentioning.... the service left us with a lot to be desired....lots of wait....not very prompt
author: Souvik D.

description: It's ok Indian food if you're really craving it. But it's not very good, it's too oily and greasy.
author: Opal P.

description: The garlic naan is heavenly, and I felt touched by how kind the staff was. Three cheers for North India!
author: Maritza M.

description: Stopped by after our conference.  Great food and atmosphere. Loved the Tikka Masala and Biriani. Super friendly owner. Will be back next time we're at Moscone for a conference.  Thanks guys you rock!!
author: Stephane C.

description: Absolutley delicious! I had a bad experience with another Indian restaurant tonight and it made my tummy hurt really bad and made me realize the difference between good Indian and bad Indian. The chicken tikka was good the saag paneer was good the garlic naan was good and the vegetables Biryani rice was good :-) will return again.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I have been working/taking classes on Howard Street since September, and in that period I've probably gotten lunch from North India 15+ times. 

Put simply, at $7 a box it's the best value for your money in the area. Typically, I get Chicken Tikka and veggies (rice is also included). As others have pointed out, this isn't the best (North) Indian food in the world and is a bit watery, but again the value is hard to beat. 

(Another Indian restaurant across the street on 2nd closer to Market offers more or less the same $7 deal -- the food quality is pretty similar). 

If you're trying to cut a couple dollars here and there on lunch spending without resorting to fast food, North India is a great option. 

I haven't actually eaten in or tried dinner, so I can't comment.
author: Zachary T.

description:
I enjoy the ambiance here but I found the service and food to be mediocre. We waited about 15 min to get our order in even though it was an empty restaurant at 6pm on a Wednesday evening. We then waited 50 min for food to come out because the kitchen somehow did not get our order. When the food eventually came out, it was extremely salty. We ordered a chicken tikka masala and chicken vindaloo. My boyfriend also found his dish unsavory. 

We won't be coming back here again even with their yelp discount. I recommend going to Little Delhi instead - we've always been happy with their food, service, and price.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Food and service were both exceptional. My favorite is the mango ice cream. Really fair prices had a great time. Good ambience
author: Kumar S.

description:
The best Indian food in San Francisco. It reminds me the wonderful period I traveled in India. 

Everything we ordered was very tasty, I love the Malai Kofta
author: Priya G.

description:
Ordered at 7:30pm, delivery estimate was for 8:30-8:40. Food arrived at 8:00pm! Way faster than I expected!
Ordered:
aloo sag: yummy
chicken tikka masala: very yummy, good flavors, good quality meat
dal: good, but not amazing

Pros: good food, good quality, and fast service. 
Cons: a little pricey, especially for the vegetarian options that are usually a couple dollars cheaper at other places.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Absolutely the best Indian restaurant we've ever been to. Our server, Cooldeep, was the nicest server we've ever had!! We were looking through the drinks menu and couldn't decide, so he came by with two beers on the house. Amazing. And I'm being honest when I say that the garlic naan and chicken tikka masala was one of the best we've had.
This place is definitely our go-to Indian restaurant.!!
author: Brian P.

description:
I liked the first time I was in this place...but the next time I was here I was really irritated by a waiter who is mostly dressed in a red zipper.

He potrays arrogant behavior towards me everyyime I go there.... specially today when I entered this restaurant which was actually empty at that time. he approached me and told me to sit at a certain table which was attached to a big wall with the chair facing the pillar..!! I wanted to sit somewhere with a view of outside hence i asked the waiter I want to sit at the place next to what he has suggested where the view was not blocked by a wall...he arrogantly replied that table is booked....I said okay how about table next to that he said the whole line of tables next to that are booked.....on that I asked him which place can I sit than instead of this place which he was suggesting.....on that he showed me a place which was right in front of the main door...!! I said no I don't like this....to that he suggested me another place which was almost inside the restroom.....I felt offended by the way he acted I asked him angrily is the whole hotel with 50 tables booked...?? To that he said yes everything else is booked....!!!! I just left the place on that reply....



I hate this guy whoever it is...he is always there in red zipper!!!!!...kudos to this guy u have a one star because of him....I have no other issues with anything else with this place... except for him every other waiter I have met there are very polite and helpful
author: Kaushal M.

description: I had a good experience in this place. The service was amazing. One of the best places to eat Indian food. You have to come to this place
author: Abdulrahman A.

description:
North India has good food but it could be better.
The Palak (saag) paneer did not have enough paneer. 
The naan and onion kulchas are good but at $4.50 a piece, quite expensive.
The delivery did not contain and plates, spoons, or napkins.
author: A P.

description: Ordered delivery. It arrived 1 hr and 47 minutes later. I contacted Eat24 for a refund.
author: Mi M.

description: Food was delicious. I've had Indian plenty of times in many cities and this place is on the top of the list.
author: Rula S.

description:
Went here prior to a performance downtown-their prices are great for a downtown place and the amount of food you get and the great ambiance. 

It was a bit quiet, and the house seemed to be in a great mood :) they sent us a free beer and also icecream at the end of dinner.

Sadly this dinner was not for romantic reasons, but I would not hesitate to bring a date here.
author: David T.

description: Love their food & atmosphere. Norman was really kind and nice. Definitely coming back here again!
author: Omar A.

description: Awesome food, awesome service, very welcoming even late!!! We arrived the 15 min before they closed and they welcomed us so nicely with smiles even if they all probably were tired after a long day ! A must stop in soma!
author: Emna G.

description: Great restaurant with reasonably priced food and good service! Nice ambiance too. I would recommend
author: Valerie H.

description:
Tried the buffet. Ambience is good and the people there are very courteous too. Liked butter chicken specially. The staff is pretty responsive, they immediately replaced a bit colder naans within less than a minute.

A must visit if u want to try desi khaana...
author: Pranay B.

description: We had a delicious buffet, and the service was amazing. We were brought hot fresh naan (plain and garlic naan) to the table. They brought mango ice cream for my daughters as a special treat, along with yummy cha tea for all. We look forward to dining here again the next time we are in SF!
author: Purnima V.

description: Dining area was clean and the staff was pretty friendly, however, the food was bland and mediocre. It was almost like they were serving Trader Joes Indian food pouches for the buffet and saving the legit/delicious food for the dinner hour. Wasn't impressed and certainly glad it was a meal I got to expense.
author: Brandon J.

description: Maybe 3.5  It's decent Indian food but the Chicken Tikka Masala isn't that buttery and the naan was a little hard.  The chai is very average and not that spicy.  Buffet is relatively cheap compared to other places.  Pretty empty for Sunday lunch.
author: Alison D.

description: Rajat was a great host and manages the place well! Excellent service and very friendly. Had a chill time talking to him and getting to know the area. For food i ordered was the keema matar and tikka masala and both were mouth watering as well as tasty.. would come back when im craving Indian food and in the area!
author: David T.

description:
Awesome food...!! Really liked it...!!
Best food that we had in sfo..!!

Channa masala is the best...!!
author: Neeraj S.

description:
I came here for lunch on a Friday and this place was packed. I have to say the buffet quality and selection was really good and everything was extremely fresh.

The standout dish for me was the saag paneer, reason being it was perfectly done and not watered down. I am amazed how often places mess this up. I will definitely be back!

So far this is one of most expansive and fresh lunch buffets I have found as many places in SF either don't have a buffet or it's of quality. I'm glad to find a place that bucks this tend
author: Corey H.

description: Went later at night. Food was great in presentation and quality. Service was great aswell. Atmosphere was also great and inviting.
author: Sam V.

description: Without a doubt the food is great. I'll chalk up the mixup concerning the spice level to language barrier. Maybe we were not clear enough about mild. I like hot food but one dish was crazy hot. What I'm deducting 2 stars for in what otherwise would be a 5 Star review is he manner in which the pumped up the bill with rice and nan.  We wanted a little rice and bread for everyone. What they did was give us a full order of both for each party. That alone was more then we could possibly consume added about $20 to the bill. If you go, beware of this scheme.
author: Peter P.

description: Amazing fresh tasting food. Great generous and kind service. All around good experience!
author: Sonia M.

description: Great flavors, a little empty like twice that I've been here. Very friendly staff and I would probably come back here. Great Chutney with papadam
author: Alexandra T.

description: The service is excellent and food was delicious. Serving size of any dish is is good for two. Nice ambiance.
author: Ramesh K.

description:
One of the better Indian restaurants I have tried. 

Saag paneer and Kashmiri chicken were both very good - very flavorful and spices done right. Their portions are satisfactory. The naan was soft, but done well. The raita was also good, and served a decent portion unlike many other restaurants. I hope they are able to keep up the quality of their food!

If you're craving some Indian food, check this place out!
author: Gul G.

description: Eat here twice a week, the freshest most authentic Indian food in the city-- I am obsessed.
author: Natasha C.

description: This place has a nice ambiance and they're very friendly here. The food is good as well
author: James C.

description:
I was at an event in SF and my companion and I walked into this restaurant because it sounded good. 
Firstly, I did actually like the food. It was delicious. But this has probably been one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had when it comes to service. 
We were seated at a small table and one of the gentlemen working there came over and literally tossed our silverware at the table. I had to block it from ricocheting at me. This same person reached over the divider wall between us and the kitchen and simply dropped our plates onto the table. This same man then later pushed me out of the way while I was walking to the disgustingly filthy bathroom. 
Once out food came to the table, which was brought out by an older man who seemed fairly nice. No problems here but we didn't have any napkins so we hailed, with much effort, another man to ask for some. When he finally came back around he simply dumped a fistful of napkins on top of our food as he walked by. I was absolutely appalled by this.
We were also presented our check before we received all of the items we ordered and certainly before I had intended to stop ordering (desert, anyone?) but decided to just get the hell out of there. I had lost my appetite the moment paper napkins were turned into food toppings.
author: Valerie A.

description: Great service! We did takeout and received complimentary chai tea while we waited for our order. Food tasted fresh-I always order sag paneer and a chicken dish. The rice has to be ordered separately, so it's a bit more expensive but overall a good option for Indian food in the soma area.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I used to come here a bunch in 2014 when I would want Indian food. This was the first time I've tried it since then. And at least this time, it was decidedly "okay."

I ordered a to-go box (you get it from the side of the building just FYI), with lamb and a veggie dish, and a naan. The naan itself was subpar, it seemed to be a little burnt but this would be the first time that has happened to me. The lamb curry was good, and the larger chunks of carrots in my subji were not as tender as I would hope (but was still good). They provide a large amount of rice, so you should definitely get a dish with a sauce to help eat it! Especially if you plan on getting a naan as well.

3.5 stars, and would come back here again. Hopefully next time for a buffet.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
Came here for a lunch buffet on a crowded afternoon. It was somewhat chaotic but efficiently managed. And the food was delicious! The spread included:

Vegetable and fish pakora
Rice and naan
Tandoori chicken
Saag paneer (though with way more saag than paneer)
Goat curry
Eggplant 
Vegetable korma

Definitely would come back in the future if I'm starving and it's lunchtime in SoMa.
author: Sophie C.

description:
This is one of my go-tos for carry out when I land in San Francisco (conveniently located in close proximity to Park Central Hotel). Calling in the order is easy peasy and if you prefer to not hop on the phone, there's always ordering through the Yelp app. 

Over my last few visits I've had the Saag Paneer, chicken tikka masala and papadam. All have been delicious but not mind-blowing. Pretty standard in terms of Indian carry out eats. A few aspects of the business leave me with a "meh" taste in my mouth:

1.) Weird vibes- ya know, no greeting/slow to acknowledge my presence even when the food is sitting right there

2.) On the pricier side ($18 for sag paneer rice and papadam 

3.) I find it odd that you have to order rice separately from all of the meals (I've always experienced them as hand in hand dishes)
author: Brittany S.

description:
North India has a really affordable lunch menu ($6.50 in downtown SF!) with some delicious options. I always get the butter chicken, which is super creamy and rich, and is perfect poured over rice. 

The staff is also super friendly!  I usually walk down with my dog, and they'll often treat her with a piece of naan to welcome her back.
author: Mahlon D.

description: Excellent customer service. Couldn't have been more nice and accommodating. I've been here only twice and they were by far one of the best restaurants to enjoy in the financial district.
author: Stephen C.

description: Great food. Awesome service. Clean facilities. Very friendly staff. The food came our quick and delicious. I got the chicken tandoori, naan and the egg plant dish. All highly recommended.
author: Haitham A.

description:
Excellent lunch buffet with good options. There are plenty of deep-fried things, including fish and veggies (separately, for you vegetarians out there), and there's the standard chicken tikka masala and lamb curry items, naan bread, and rice. Saag panner as well. Some other veggie items. The flavors are robust and it's a good lunch place. They also can accommodate large groups, as much as 12-15 people; I've had team lunches here and it's been pretty good, though I recommend getting here before the lunch rush. 

One issue I have is the placement of the buffet items. The line can be ponderously slow if you get there after 12pm, and I feel like there are ways to place the items so people can get what they want and leave quickly. Or at least put in a place where people can come down either side of the buffet spread. 

Bathrooms: Haven't tried these ones, mainly because I'm usually very quickly in and out.
author: Jimmy H.

description: The food here was amazing and at reasonable prices !!! Please get the Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan!! Don't be basic and get regular Naan !!!
author: Vilien G.

description: Great ambience and hospitality! Norman was the best! Perfect spot in soma for Indian food...can't wait to come back.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Solid lunch option that always pleases.
Their back alley take out is solid, but the line can get crazy.
author: Jr P.

description:
I get their take out lunch almost twice in a week, and it's pretty cheap actually. Including taxes I pay $6.5 for two veggies and rice. 
That's a value for money and taste isn't bad at all, pretty authentic
author: Ashish B.

description:
This restaurant went beyond all of my expectations. The service was great and the setting was perfect. The vegetable samosas were some of the best I have ever had. 

-1 because I ordered spicy chicken tikka masala, and it was not spicy at all.
author: Kyle W.

description: This probably is one of my favorite indian restaurants in the city. The ambiance is very good and food is super tasty. Towards the end of your meal be ready for a surprise ice-cream.
author: Vishak Nag A.

description:
This is now my all time fav place to eat.
kuldip ji is such a jem, his customer service is excellent and he made me and my friend feel at home!!
Please try cauliflower and lentils they are mouth watering and also chili naan....
Yummmmm
Highly recommend
author: Nivedita L.

description:
Tried this place out for dinner and it's amazing! I now have my order down to a science. 

For an appetizer, order the Samosas. They are a bit spicy and SO delicious.

I order the Chicken Tikka Masala with more Masala for my Garlic Naan. The Punjabi Fried Rice is a really good compliment. 

Cooldeep provides prompt service and smiles. He's a very down-to-earth person that recognizes his customers. 

I highly recommend North India. Living right around the corner, I will be here a ton.
author: Andrew H.

description: Wonderful food, service, and ambiance! will definitely be back. I loved the chicken tikka masala and the garlic naan was great.
author: Jeanette S.

description: Most amazing service I couldn't have been treated better. And the food is awesome to definitely try the coconut pineapple homemade ice cream. Chicken tikka masala is amazing. Saag Paneer to die for.
author: Jan R.

description: Classic indian cuisine with classic flavors, not too spicy. Eggplant tasty and lamb tendor. Garlic naan was some of the best i ve ever had. Decor immersive. Portions on the small side. Would recommend!
author: Enokh M.

description: Dinner which we had in the restaurant seemed to consist of warmed up leftovers from lunch buffet. Naan was not fresh made. Rice was clearly hours old. Dishes were tired overall. Not good.
author: Joseph M.

description: Good buffet and great service! I got a free mango lassi on the house! Good place for lunch. No waiting!
author: Sachiko K.

description: Love this place! I came here to celebrate my promotion and had a great time. I'm Indian and I think the food is really flavorful. Would recommend Kashmiri biryani. The flavors are good. Also like the ambience and service :)
author: Ash N.

description:
A little torn writing this review... since I did enjoy the food. 

Chicken Tikki Masala... I feel like they were cutting me short with the chicken chunks. Sauce was nice, thick, and creamy. But hey.. more chicken!! 

Beghan Bartha -- Now this is my favorite. Eggplant had a good toasty flavor to it. Eggplant is a veggie that's tricky to cook. And North India did it perfectly. 

We came here for dinner on Thursday at 6:30, which I guess is a hot time for North India, it got super busy around 7:30pm. So busy where I felt like I was crammed next to folks. Servers were bumping dishes on my head. I don't think I was taking up that much room, but the servers weren't courteous in their hustling. A server bumped a dish on my head twice, booty bumped my back, and was a tad too close when placing some else's order on their table. 

We ordered a to-go item 3/4 in to our meal, and that took so long by the time we finished the meal and waited for our take-out item. We were hungry again. The service was not up to par. The waiter gave us ice cream "on the house" but honestly. It was a slab of strawberry ice cream that felt like had freezer burn. At least give us something a little more authentic to the South Asian culture like coconut. My friend and I didn't even touch it since we were ready to go. Maybe I'll come back for the buffet, but knowing me. SF is not my favorite. I rather be on the better side of the bay.
author: Phuong V.

description: Great service, delicious food! Would definitely come here again. We came here for a bachelorette party and their reservations were very flexible.
author: Ashley Q.

description: Love this place! Always great food (go for the chicken tika masala and garlic naan) great beers and super friendly staff.
author: Søren T.

description:
This is one of the very few Indian restaurants where vegetarian food is actually decent. Yes the Chicken tikka masala is delish just as any other place. But what sets this apart is the vegetarian food. 

We there for lunch buffet with the team and it was tasty. Their Naan is also pretty good!!

Their service could use some improvement. Ambience is nice and I won't hesitate to bring guests/family over here. 

It's also in the heart of SF very close to fidi and Soma. (And close to my work)

Tip: they have a side alley door during lunch hours on weekends for a very quick Togo box. Usually $5-$8 only! 

If their service improves I have no problems upgrading this to a 5/5 review.
author: Arjan N.

description: Craving Indian food, so stopped by. Awesome food.  Great service and tandoori platters!  Naan was fresh and food was authentic.  Eat the lamb Rogan josh and whole tandoori chicken!  Any meat dish is fantastic.
author: A S.

description: Very good food. Paneer makhani was delicious, and the naans were freshly made! As for sides, loved the papadums and the mango lassi perfectly helped complete the meal!
author: Nish M.

description:
Best chicken tikka and an an amazing staff! Cooldeep is the best.

The okra is also great. Atmosphere is upscale but not unwelcoming. All around s a great spot!
author: Emily N.

description: Really awesome food, atmosphere and and even better host! I'd definitely come again next time I'm in town!
author: Aleks A.

description: Tried Indian food for the first time today and I'm so glad I came to this place! Food was delicious! Service was great! I highly recommend the chicken tikka masala! It was yummy!
author: Janice M.

description: This is a great Indian restaurant in SOMA! The saag paneer was quite tasty, and there are lots of vegetarian options on the menu. Quiet enough to carry on a conversation but not too quiet.
author: Christine V.

description: Would not have come here if I had known about their poor health dept score. As it was, not impressed by our dinner. If a restaurant is going to charge $2 for papadums, they should give you more than 2 of them (and have onion chutney to enjoy with them)! The paneer korma was quite bland and the spinach paratha over-baked. We won't be back.
author: Amy D.

description: we had bhindi massla, the bhindi was fresh not frozen, we then had saag aloo and naan, naan was crispy and buttery everything was perfect great service did not feel rushed - we really enjoyed the restaurant meal and liked it that we were not rushed  like other restaurants in this area tend to do
author: Pi M.

description: Delicious food, classic North Indian flavors. Good service is a little slow, but they make up for it by staying open late!
author: Athyuttam R.

description:
this spot was pretty legit. had been waiting to try it for a while now - it's super duper close to both my old and new offices. i still need to go back for the lunch buffet (seems like a SWEET DEAL) 

came with my parents on saturday evening - not much stuff is open in this area, so there were actually more people than i expected dining here! we got - garlic naan, cheese naan, chicken tikka masala, tandoori fish, and saag paneer - everything medium spicy since my parents dont enjoy spice. everything was delicious with cold beers! rice is extra charge, but they give you free pappadum with dip to start. 

service was a bit spotty, especially when we were ready to get outta there and pay. but otherwise good experience. i'd order takeout and delivery from here too!
author: Christina L.

description: I have never seen such a worst restaurant in the US. Last Saturday me and my family had buffet lunch at this place and I regret to be there for lunch. The whole family was sick and especially my son didn't sleep the whole night and he vomited all the food and it took a day for him to settle down. Guys, first there were no much varieties for buffet and at 12.30 pm the restaurant was empty as if it was 3.00, I got doubt there itself and since we are in I had and I wish I never been there. Horrible experience! I doubt some of the food might be spoiled and was not fresh.
author: Sarat Babu K.

description: The service started out poor. No one attended to us for what felt like an eternity with a one year old. Food was really average. The service improved after a while- and then once they knew we would yelp, they were super sweet and gave us a free coconut ice cream for the baby on the way out. Very thoughtful. I was concerned reading about the low safety scores from the food safety inspection. I read that AFTER we ate. That worried me quite a bit since our 1 year old just killed the tiki masala and garlic naan.
author: Sheree B.

description: Great place for standard Indian fare and excellent service. We had Chicken tikka masala, paneer palak, papadum, garlic naan, and mixed pickle. Garlic naan was a bit chewy but everything else was on point! House red was really tasty and music selection definitely set the mood. Will visit again next time I'm in the area.
author: Lori S.

description: I've been here a handful of time, twice for dinner and once for the lunch buffet. Their food is simply delicious and the price is reasonable. Highly recommend!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Staff handled hungry lunch rush well. 
Buffet was regularly replenished with tasty options. 
Table settings and ambiance pleasant despite crowd. 
Great lunch!
author: Janice G.

description:
My review is for the takeaway lunch box.

The door for the lunch boxes is on Minna. I got 2 veg dishes (out of 3 options) over rice plus naan. It was more than enough food but I ate it all because it was delicious! The boxes are made on demand (as is getting the naan from the kitchen), so the wait was a little long but totally worth it for the taste and very reasonable price. They take cards, which is nice. I expect to be a regular.
author: Cristina S.

description: Just ordered off Eat24. I got the Boti Kabob...lamb cooked in the tandoor. It's delish!! Cooked perfectly, moist, and wonderfully seasoned! I also got the goat cheese nan. It's yummy on its own but even better with the lamb and tamarind sauce!!
author: Kristin P.

description: I ordered online from the restaurant. They mixed up my order and delivered me seafood biryani instead of Kashmiri biryani. I realized the mixup after tasting the biryani. The restaurant did offer to replace my biryani but I had expected the restaurant to be more than just being sorry. The gulab jamun was one of the worst I have ever had. Biryani tasted more like veg fried rice.
author: Faltoo L.

description: Look, buffets -  I know buffets, I've been to a lot of buffets. I've been to some of the best buffets in the world... Batika India Bistro, world class food. Believe me, North India is phenomenal, truly phenomenal. People say it's a big league buffet. For dessert they had vanilla ice cream and apple sauce. I've always been a big supporter of apple sauce. My grandmother... she makes the best apple sauce. Apple sauce - very American, truly fantastic. I would go again, and I would pay for it.
author: Zaid E.

description: Food was okay, but: the waiter totally forgot to put our order in. After 30 minutes he finally realized and got things moving. We weren't offered anything while we waited for them to quickly rush our food. Then, when we asked for the check, they never brought it. After 15 minutes, we walked up and were told we owed $40+. Worst experience ever in SF. There is better Indian food with much more efficient service elsewhere.
author: Derek C.

description: Had a birthday lunch delivered to the office. The food was delivered directly to the office on time with courteous and friendly service. We have eaten at North Indian many times...love the food! Nice size portions! Delicious! Definitely recommend!
author: Tanna A.

description:
We came here for dinner on a Friday and were seated quickly and brought out drinks. The menu is extensive and ranges from Seafood, Chicken, Lamb, and Vegetable dishes.

We ordered the Bombay Pakora which is an Indian spin on calamari. It was really good especially when paired with the sauces they serve. For the main meal we had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Pasanda. Both dishes were delicious. We ordered them spicy and they certainly delivered! 

The service and ambience is a nice touch! A quality meal with great service for a good price!
author: Shivani G.

description:
What can I say?

I am an avid fan of the Indian cuisine & on a fabled night on the town visiting San Francisco, I was led to what can only be described as a fortress of Punjab delights.  I am somewhat suspicious of most Indian restaurants I encounter in the US since I am originally from the UK (which is renowned for its splendid Indian food).  Nevertheless, my friends and I were treated to a bounty of delicious and flavorful dishes, all of which did not disappoint.

The splurge of curries, naan bread, papadums, samosas, and basmati rice were all enough to make a grown man squeal in sheer bliss.  Sure I was hungry, but even the ravenous hunger which had overcome me could not hide the fact that this food was of the utmost quality.  The service was courteous and efficient.  

And if you're wondering about desserts, well, let me tell you this.  If you are a well behaved man/woman and mind your p's and q's, I can almost guarantee the waiting staff will bless your table with complimentary scoops of coconut and mango ice cream.  The perfect palette cleanser for what ever it is you wish to do with your night.  I honestly considered leaving a Yelp review before this transpired but as soon as the bowls hit the table, I was smitten.  North India Restaurant, you have truly outdone yourselves.
