And for this, I commend thee.  Please keep up the tremendous work you're doing over there.

Also, I would like to add if you're a vegetarian or vegan, this restaurant certainly caters well to you.  You would be foolish to miss out.  Seriously.  Don't miss out.  Or they will find you.
author: Sia N.

description:
Ordered food for delivery..
Got a hard to break and chew Naan (Garlic as well as normal)
Got a tomato juice flavory Paneer Tikka. Eew..!!
author: Ghanshyam M.

description: Came for lunch and ordered off the menu today. Food was bland. The lamb saag was four small, tough pieces of lamb. Low quality.  Service was terrible. We had to ask for glasses, napkins, and silverware. Won't return.
author: B. L.

description:
They were very accommodating to us, when we showed up late and the kitchen was already closed. The location is convenient to many night clubs and the food is more substantial than the typical bar/drunk food (aka pizza). 

The decor is moderately upscale, and is done tastefully but retains the overall Indian feel. I'd call it contemporary Indian. The menu is diverse and even has a good assortment of salads (again, seemingly rare for most Indian restaurants). 

We were greeted by the manager, who had informed us that this restaurant is actually a small independent chain of family-run businesses. There is a location in West Portal, Half Moon Bay, and I forget the other two spots.

Chicken Panang, and a similar Lamb dish, what was ordered. Each was tasty and there was a side of white rice included. The service was superb and the servers were always there to refill water, even if the glass was not even half depleted yet. It would be nice to try out the other locations now, as there is a reasonably-priced lunch buffet for $13.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
Tart-ish and spicy - it's the best tikka masala I've had.  And they deliver.  How much better can the world get? 

The sag paneer is good too as is the naan.  The order of rice is not included but large enough to split between two girls and have leftovers.  Win!
author: Jeannie K.

description: This restaurant has the best tasting Indian we have tried in San Francisco. The portions are generous and the pricing is reasonable especially for dinner. Our kids said the Tikka Masala was the best ever and they are not always easy when it comes to new foods. I will definitely be coming back her when I'm San Francisco!
author: Steve C.

description:
2 Stars for a delivery experience that left a lot to be desired... 

I ordered delivery from North India with friends which included four dishes including my Chicken Tikka Masala. Unfortunately the experience just wasn't up to snuff.

First problem was the wait. It must have been close to an hour before we got our delivery (we were not far). This isn't a deal-breaker though. I don't mind waiting a bit longer for a quality meal.

Second problem was when they delivered the meals (to a hotel room, mind you), there were no utensils. This was really annoying and just seemed like a really thoughtless oversight. Luckily we were able to call down to the hotel and they sent up utensils, but it was really an oversight.

Finally, we opened the dishes and realized there was no rice. We ordered a bunch of saucey dishes and thought it must have been a mistake because they typically come with rice. Upon calling the restaurant we were told that we should have ordered the rice separately. This needs to be made much more clear when ordering dishes because they were pretty silly to eat without rice and I didn't end up eating very much.

With all of that being said, the flavor of my dish was really good (though even the mild version definitely has some heat!). Additionally, the naan was delicious (they have a bunch of flavors).

It's too bad we didn't eat in the restaurant. Perhaps it would have been a better experience. But they definitely need to work on their delivery service so as not to leave customers as unsatisfied as we ended up.
author: Andi P.

description: The Lamb Vindaloo had a touch of heat but didn't overpower. The Chicken Tikki Masala was thick creamy rich. Owner was wandering around answering any question and even customized our dinner for two to make  sure we got exactly what we wanted.
author: Roger N.

description:
Summary: if you want cheap lunch, wait in the line on the other side of the restaurant. Only $5 for a box. But if you are feelling fancy, eat inside for lunch for their buffet and it's around $15+tip per person. Great Indian food!!

Great place for lunch/dinner if you work around the area. The service is beyond amazing. The entire staff is very attentive, a little too attentive actually. Every time I drink out of my cup, one of the waiters will run toward my cup to refill it LOLLL Very nice atmosphere! Everyone who eats there works around the area, so no weirdos there for sure! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: Katy W.

description: Chicken tikki masala is my favorite!!!  Every time I travel to sfo I make a point to stop in or carry out.   It's is consistently delicious!
author: Melissa W.

description:
I've been to San Francisco a few times, but never found a decent Indian restaurant (I'm a little bit spoilt as Manchester - UK - has a fantastic selection). So, I was very pleasantly surprised by North India Restaurant.
Firstly they treated me like a first class citizen - despite being a solo diner (here for a conference). The cleaned an prepared a table right away and were even a little too fast to get my drinks order (no complaints there, though :) )
They have kingfisher on draught (yay!) and water was supplied right away.
I ordered chicken pakora to start and it was very tender and came with a couple of little pots of very tasty sauces (I can't say I know the names, but one was a spicy addition and the other a raita type of affair).
Next I had chicken madras (medium spice - I probably could have upped that to hot), pilau rice and a plain naan. The only strange part was that they brought the main while the starter was still in play. Not a negative, it just surprised me. Having said that, again as a solo diner I appreciated that I didn't have to stare into space for any length of time - and I genuinely suspect that's why the meal was served in this manner as there was no sign of rushing me later on.
All in all, an extremely enjoyable meal with very attentive staff. Definitely worth a go.
author: Rick T.

description: Good food, wonderful service.. the chef messed up with onion kulcha but in return they compensated with a complementary dessert. The rice pudding they offered was good. Once again recommended for their service and food
author: Aniket J.

description:
Updated review: after my previous visit and review, the owner got in touch with me. He was very apologetic, and he offered to send me another meal to make up for the earlier problems. I'm so glad I took him up on it, because it was TERRIFIC. 

Appetizers: The vegetable samosas were really good. The outside was crispy, and the filling was luxurious. The chicken pakora was amazing. Each piece was a little flavor bomb. 

Entrees: The chicken korma was mild, as I'd requested, but it was full of flavor. The chunks of chicken were generously sized, and the sauce was the perfect consistency for eating with naan. The chicken tikka masala was the best I've ever had. 

Accompaniments: The rice was full of peas. The bake on the naan was great, though I'll admit that it still wasn't the most flavorful I've ever had. They also did remember the plates and cutlery. 

While this restaurant at its worst was a big disappointment, I'm glad I got a chance to see it at its best, since that was fabulous!
author: Heather P.

description:
I've gotten lunch boxes to-go for lunch breaks many times and recently came in to sit down for their lunch buffet. 

For a quick lunch, I love the idea of going to an alley and getting food out of the backdoor of an Indian restaurant in the FiDi/SoMa area. Their lunch boxes are very reasonable -- you pay ~$7-9 for 1-2 curries over rice. The portions are very generous; I inevitably end up with leftovers for the next day.

For a sit-down lunch, I would come earlier in the day (by 11:30am) to get a seat as it will get crowded in the middle of the afternoon. If it's a nice day, sit at the tables outside! However, the inside setup isn't too bad--there are small tables on the edge of restaurant, with longer tables for bigger groups in the middle. It's a little but cozy on the inside, so just be careful of knocking into plates at the next table. 

While the selection isn't as diverse as Amber India by Yerba Buena, the food is equally tasty and much more affordable. Try the CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, TANDOORI CHICKEN, and grab multiple pieces of crispy NAAN to dip into the sweet TAMARIND CHUTNEY & spicy MINT CHUTNEY. 

The service is pretty attentive here! Someone will always refill your drinks when you sit inside. If you are getting a lunch box, they will walk inside restaurant from back to quickly look at what dishes are still available. 

North India Restaurant is on my regular lunch rotation list and I will be back soon!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
I was tossed between a 4 and a 5 but the mango ice cream pushed me over the top.  

I've only been in San Fran 2 nights.  I stopped in last night for a quick dinner and I couldn't get it out of my mind so I had to come back.  We came around 8:30 which was after the dinner crowd so we didn't have a wait at all.

The atmosphere is good, although I think they could tweak down the lights a bit.  It was a simple, more modern setting which was relaxing.  The service was better tonight than last.  There were no issues last night but, tonight, the service was more outgoing.  I sense there are some very "authentic", Indian servers which I find to be charming.

My husband and I had a Pinot Noir by the glass which was a very acceptable wine and a generous pour, and, at the $6.95 price, was the best bargain of my San Fran visit thus far.  

The food was, again, generous portions.  I had chicken curry.  My husband had lamb curry.  Wow.  Soooo good.  The price was reasonable and they were offering a discount if you "checked in" via Yelp.  

Now, I'll admit, I'm a sucker for good Indian food.  This was really good Indian that didn't seem to be as heavy (oily)  as Indian food can sometimes be.  I wouldn't hesitate recommending this place to others.  There are SO MANY places in the Mission Dist and decisions are difficult, but if you love you some Indian like me, it's worth the visit!
author: Teresa B.

description:
Great food, our waiter even brought us complimentary dessert (both times I've been here)! Highly recommend the onion naan. Masala chai is also excellent.

The second time I came, a very kind gentleman also offered to pay for our meal - shoutout to the man who made our day! We wish you the very best, and will continue to pay it forward.
author: Kristen P.

description:
I'm not usually the type to leave a two star review. The food here is definitely worthy of such a rating.

Ordered delivery so I can't comment on the facility. The delivery was fairly prompt and the delivery guy was friendly. 

The food was a odd blend of bland and salty. The curry was sorely lacking in flavor, the pakora was dry and extremely salty. I couldn't finish it after the second one. The biryani was surprisingly salty. No real flavor other than salt. So disappointed. I enjoyed no part of my meal.

With so many other options it's hard for me to reason why I would try them again.

Sorry
author: Aaron T.

description: Tasty food. Only order it to go through Ritual, but usually made in a timely fashion. If you like spice and flavor, this is a place for you!
author: Max F.

description:
Very bad food. All curries tasted the same. The biryani was blunt, no flavor what so ever. Nan was soggy and uncooked on fee sides.

Would not recommend at all.
author: Vamsee ..

description:
Highly recommend for authentic indian food.
Good taste and a lot of variety available.
author: Bikramjeet S.

description:
We got delivery through Yelp and I was a bit skeptical about the quality because of it being delivery but it turned out to be hot, delicious and super appetizing. 

There were a few of us so we got:
Chicken Tikka Masala $12.95 
Rogan Josh $12.95 (Chicken of Persian origin)
Bombay Chicken $12.95
Saag Gosht $13.95 (Lamb with spinach sauce)

We also got rice and naan.

Everything was very savoury and you could taste the distinct spices and flavours across each of the dishes. My personal favourite was the Saag Gosht because the lamb was really good and cooked to the perfect tenderness and I really enjoyed the sauce and it went well with my naan.

I'd definitely come back or get delivery from North India Restaurant again.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Only a short walk away from Montgomery, I love coming here for dinner! AMAZING food, good portions, and the flavors are never underwhelming or overwhelming -- they're just right. 

Pretty popular joint for lunch, being in the FiDi and also offering a killer lunch buffet, but I've been here for special occassions as well! They've got great ambiance and the service is always great. 

HIGHLY recommend: Saag paneer and dal, in addition to their chicken tikka and tandoori!
author: Varsha R.

description: Found a huge piece of paper in the rice that we ordered, bad/late service on Christmas Day is still ok, but bad food that we got after waiting for more than an hour is not. Would not visit or recommend it to anyone.
author: Ahuti S.

description: Great food and friendly service as always. Nice family run business, one of my fav chicken tiki masalas around
author: steve c.

description: We specifically ordered mild dishes for my children unfortunately all the dishes were extremely spicy. I eat spicy food, and this was really spicy even to my taste. We had to call the restaurant back and asked them to make the food non spicy. They were apologetic and remade the food but it took a lot longer than first time which tells me they had to make it from scratch. Owner added a rice pudding dessert along with lentil soup and yogurt for the kids for the mistake, which was really nice of him. Food was really tasty and fresh otherwise. And it wasn't spicy the second time. Chicken biryani was so much that 4 people can eat it almost. Their naan bread was not so fresh unfortunately. It was chevy, almost as if bread heated up in a microwave perhaps. Their plastic utensils they give for takeouts are really flimsy, they can use better quality ones perhaps. Otherwise, very nice attentive owner, place was full with dine in customers and tasty food. If you like spicy food, I recommend it.
author: Kelly N.

description: Super bomb, affordable vegetarian dishes to share here! Walked here before going to the museum of modern art and it was such a good way to start the day in the city :)
author: Megan N.

description:
A friend and I happened upon this place after a long day of exploring the city. We were starved so I thought that's partly why the food tasted so good. It was later in the evening on a Monday night so it was very busy and we were seated right away. The service was a bit slow but friendly. 

Since we liked the food so much, we decided to go back on our next work trip. This time there were four of us and we were seated right away. Service was again slow, but friendly. When our meals came out, they forgot one of my friends entrees. We had to flag the server down to remind him that we were missing a dish. They were apologetic and we're off to find the dish - I honestly think it just didn't get made because it took a while to come out. We were almost done with our meals by the time hers came out, but they were really nice about the error and hooked us up when it came time to pay the bill. 

Overall I'll continue to visit here when I'm in SF. I don't expect the fastest service, but the food is so good!!
author: Kristy P.

description:
Amazing service and waitstaff.
Store owner Cooldeep was friendly and offered extra dipping sauce for my garlic naan. 
Nice ambience for a chill evening. Would recommend to friends. 
Forgot to mention that the garlic naan was delicious. My favs are the garlic naan,Aloo mattar and kabuli naan.
author: Victoria y.

description: The food was OK. It was more of color and less of taste. I had the Lunch Buffet. If not for the Chicken Makhani and fresh Naan, it was mediocre.
author: Ashwin D.

description:
North India is a classic North Indian restaurant (Go. Figure.) that serves up an average lunch buffet with the standard vegetarian options. Lentils, paneer, mixed vegetable kormas, etc. were all available.
I was coming back from Yosemite with a friend, and we decided to see another friend in San Francisco before we flew out. He's Indian and recommended North India, though was worried it would be packed. He explained that during peak lunch hours, the line is out the door.

North India was all very in line with expectations. It's the kind of place I would visit maybe once a month if I were working nearby and looking for lunch. The lentils look watery in the picture, but they actually tasted great. The mixed veggies and the saag paneer were very average. I found myself going back to the buffet only to get the lentils, rice, and naan. I love how the naan came out fresh here.

I'd probably avoid returning here for lunch unless it were off hours when on my own, but wouldn't say no to an invitation to come back.
author: Chris O.

description:
This place was super good. They were able to seat us super quickly when we arrived on a Friday night and the food and service were both excellent. We weren't the easiest group, with a variety of dietary requirements, but they were very accommodating. Highly recommended!

We recommend not combining the ice cream with the chutneys though
author: Ira K.

description:
I liked the service, food was ok( my favorite dish was tandoori chicken and saag) but there are few things the restaurant can improve:
The pakoras were undercooked.
There was a bird inside the restaurant under the food buffet. 
The dishes could be cleaner
It was a hot day in the city and if the restaurant doesn't have AC they can use some ceiling fans.
author: Bobina K.

description:
Great spot. I used to go to their other location,  India clay oven, on Clement all the time. Just discovered the same guys also own this location. They know how to run a solid Indian restaurant, with excellent food, cold Kingfisher beer, and crispy papadam. Great service, great food. 

This is our go-to spot for Indian food in the city!
author: Austin L.

description: I haven't tried the take-out here, but the dine-in buffet experience was great and so I imagine that if they use the same food from the buffet for their take-out orders, take-out is probably fantastic as well. That would also explain the long take-out line! Anyway, I came here for lunch with a friend around 11:40am on a weekday. Wasn't crowded at all, and we were seated immediately. They pack a lot of tables/seats inside, so there's not too much space between tables. You'll be nice and cozy with your neighbors. The lunch buffet is $15/person--very well-worth in my opinion! The food selection is great. I loved their fish, lamb, chicken, and curry/sauces (of course). Oh, and rice. Can't forget about the rice. I think at the end I was basically just getting hella rice and trying out the different sauces. Delicious!! Nothing was too spicy, or really spicy at all, actually. The flavor in everything was amazing, though. Gotta love Indian spices. I had 2 full plates of food. Not bad at all for $15. And if I was smarter about my choices and didn't fill up so much on rice, it would have been even more worth. But who am I kidding, rice and curry/sauce is what I live for when it comes to Indian cuisine. Will definitely be back! Will probably try their take-out option as well at some point.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Owner's Response:

Norman from north India I am sorry yesterday experience our food our driver was not available so we send from my other location not from north India I'm sort about that but I can replace this order from north India anytime in future not any charge or I can refund the amount to u your yelp reiview and your Bussness is very important for us if u can take care your review I will really appreciated as u know these days not easy to running the Bussness I hope u will understand I am waiting hear from u my no 4153778422 and email northindiasf @ gmail It's my appolozy


My Response to the Owner:
You said you got this order from your another location? No where on your website does it mention your another location. Try going to your website and clicking on "Location" (Singular not Plural), you will see only one location there. Better yet, go on google and type in your business name to see how many locations come up. Thank you for offering me the refund but i'm not looking for free food or my money back. I'm willing to try your food once again (I will pay for it too), if I like the food then I will update my comment and give better review and still keep the original review here.

Thank you

*****I wish I could upload the screenshot of this message to you guys*******

========================================================================
This place is good if you are looking for overpriced, buffet, grab-n-go, and flavorless food. I would not recommend this place for any North Indian looking to have some good food. I ordered some mix vegetable Jalfrezi with side of diced green chilies, forget getting the order right and caring about the customers special request, they literally made the curry taste like it was frozen vegetables boiled in hot water and topped it off with some red chili sauce. Curry had "0" flavor whatsoever, no masala or anything whatsoever. I have never tried such blad type of curry in my entire stay in Bay Area. This by far has been the worst food that I have ordered and so was the customer "online order," I don't get how you can mess up online order that's in clear english writing in front of you. If it was placed over the phone or in person and someone couldn't speak clearly, I would have understood if the order was wrong but come on this is an online order. Also, their "nan" are actually thick "roti," not truly naan so don't get fooled with those breads with your order.

I wish there was a way to rate less than 1 but since yelp only allows 1 being minimum than that's what they get from me.
author: Harsh V.

description: This is a very good place. It has your standard food that us westerners consider "Indian" food like chicken korma, or tikka masala. But they have some other dishes that were good too. Had a Punjabi fish curry which was very good, and a vegetarian spinach and mushroom dish which was also excellent. I would recommend this place if you want to have some Indian food that is out of the ordinary.
author: Kenson K.

description: Awesome, waiter was so nice and funny. Food was great and he even brought us or some ice cream on he house- took it back and put a candle in it when we told him it was actually our friends bday. Great service
author: Alka M.

description: I've ordered from here multiple times and dined in once. Everything on the menu has been great so far, and I'd recommend the fish tandoori and chicken jalmrezi if you want to venture out a bit.
author: Ben H.

description:
Sadly, this food was literally not edible. $30 for tandoori chicken, raita, dal and nan. Chicken was old, watery and flavorless, even the nan was surprisingly burned. It was also obviously old. See photo. 
Totally ruined my lunch.
author: S T.

description:
I love Indian food but I've never been able to find my go-to place in SF. Too common is it to find overly oily food at the lower end restaurants yet Amber India (on Market St) is too expensive to eat at on a regular basis. However, I think I've finally found my spot at North India.

Good location, food, service, and price. I always come here with my friend who is Indian and has confirmed the authenticity of the food. I found that my palette has needed a little bit of adjustment because I'm a bit too used to Americanized Indian food. Reviews are mixed but I've been three times for dinner and it's been consistent. That being said, none of the dishes were AMAZING but it hits the spot for casual Indian.
author: Sarah S.

description: I am visiting from out of town and had a craving for Indian. I came across this place and was not disappointed!  Their food was flavorful and good serving sizes. Above all the staff was absolutely great! Very attentive and generous!!
author: Linda W.

description: Place is awesome! I had the Saag Gosht it was great! And we had the lentil soup... Talk to Norm! He runs it... The trick though, come here for the buffet during lunch! If you work at Galvanize, it's right around the corner.
author: Joey R.

description:
Hands down my favorite Indian food place in the area-- delicious, quick (even during the lunch rush), generous portions, very reasonably priced.

Also, their saag paneer is fantastic.
author: Sarah M.

description: Really good food and service. We ordered aloo ghobi, chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Everything was spiced to perfection and good portions. You do have to order rice separately as it does not come with the entree.
author: Candice C.

description: North India is really great for large lunch groups, and they're always very flexible about reservations. And the food isn't bad either! Their friend options are actually crunchy, which is a plus, and the buffet includes dessert options like ice cream and their rice puddings.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
The Saag Paneer here is probably the best I've had and their tandoori chicken is always on point.

I think the service is what pushes this place over the top though - whether dining in or waiting for pickup, they've always been super attentive.
author: Jimmy G.

description: Decent food but horrible delivery service. So many better options in the city unless you are OK waiting an hour and a 1/2 plus for food.
author: Big A.

description: We came here with some friends for an outing in San Francisco. We stumbled upon this great Indian restaurant and was very satisfied by the wonderful service and exquisite plates. Our server Cooldeep was very accommodating and even brought us some surprise desserts, compliments of the house. It was a great dining experience and highly recommended if you're ever in the city.
author: Saman A.

description: I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone. We visited the restaurant as it was the only place open late at night on Christmas. The place was dirty, the cutlery was dirty and the staff was unpleasant. We had to request to change cutlery thrice before we had to settle for relatively cleaner places. The food was pathetic as well.
author: Priyanka K.

description: Food was amazing, service was exceptional, and they even accommodated our dietary restrictions!
author: Scott S.

description: Really delicious and affordable! Great service, ambiance, and awesome Yelp Check in deal.
author: Sabra M.

description: Wonderful service, deliciously spiced food, and open on the Friday after Thanksgiving! We'll be coming back during the workweek - I bet their buffet is amazing!
author: ford f.

description:
Amazing Indian food. Rice was on the house. Best tandoori chicken I've had. & Free Indian chai 

Second time in this hidden gem.. great food & generous server ! Don't know why it's not more crowded. 

Third time here and still love it !! Try the tandoori chicken and tandoori prawns
author: Jessica T.

description: Very good place, we like it!)best in downtown sf nice clean and friendly staff we will back here again when we come to sf
author: Liana L.

description:
Yelp reviews can be deceiving and I keep forgetting to look for the hidden ones that tell the real story. 

North India was a disappointment. The first thing you notice is that it's a restaurant trying to look nice with the veneer of white table clothes, but look a little closer and you see stains on the clothes and a floor that looks like they just schemer the food around, leaving a greasy slime covered look. 

The next disappointment were the simple drinks we ordered, a coke and ice tea. The tea wasn't even "as good" as Lipton and the coke was flat and came in a glass with food crumbs on the bottom. 

The Aloo Ghobi tasted like they had kept the Cauliflower a little too long. I got the Lamb Vindaloo, which should be a joyous expression of Indian curry full of flavor, spice and heat and it was none of those things. It wasn't hot or spicy and it was just OK enough to eat, my wife couldn't eat her Ghobi. The garlic naan was decent. We also got Dal but it was boring at best. 

Lastly, we were there at 7:00 on a Saturday and we were the only ones there when we left.   No, we didn't take the leftovers.
author: Mark T.

description: Best tandoori salmon I have had yet. Perfectly cooked and juicy which is so hard to find when getting tandoori. Highly recommend!!
author: Harmony H.

description: Impressed so far! Ordered chicken tikka and samosas through Eat24. Service was on time and friendly. Food tasty. The samosas were lovely and crispy, and a little bigger then I've had before.
author: Tilly D.

description: This is a WONDERFUL Indian restaurant. I got the butter chicken, and it was AMAZING! I matched the butter chicken with garlic Naan. The creamy sauce matched with the flavorful Naan made a great combination. Their dishes have good portion, and for those who are on a diet, they also have extremely healthy vegetarian options. They also had delicious store-made ice cream. I would highly recommend coconut flavor. The service was great, and I had a great time dining here.
author: Cordelia Y.

description: Amazing food and an equally amazing service. That too on a Fri evening. Best experience ever!
author: Mahesh G.

description:
I'm not really a big fan of Indian food but nothing is open in SoMa on Sundays so my roommate and I ended up here for dinner. They have a Yelp check-in deal for BOGO 50% off on your entrees (after 3 pm, I think). I ordered chicken masala and my roommate ordered a lamb dish. I thought both dishes were pretty good BUT... RICE IS SOLD SEPARATELY!!!! WHAT?! The rice costs almost as much as the meat dishes, too. I've only had Indian food once before this and it was at a buffet so... is this a thing?! Serious question!!

Anyway, 3 stars for the food, 1 star for price.
author: Anny T.

description:
One of our charity fundraisers was catered by North India Restaurant. The ONLY reason this is 4 out of 5 stars instead of 5 out of 5 is that I have not yet experienced their service.

The food is THE BEST indian food I've ever eaten. Fresh, excellent quality with the perfect blend of spices. The trays full of rice, chicken tikka masala, chana masala, lamb curry, naan, samosa and rice pudding were perfectly packed and kept the food hot and fresh during service.

I will update my review once I've had the chance to visit their location, which thankfully is just a few blocks from my office.

Yum!!
author: KJ F.

description:
My coworker who normally doesn't have the best restaurant choices recommended this place and although hate to admit it it was awesome. 

We started with the vegetable samosas which were great, nan, garlic nan, lamb vindaloo, chicken Bombay and saag paneer.  

I eat at Indian restaurants all over the country because we do not have an Indian restaurant in my town so I consider myself a bit of an authority. Everything was fantastic and I would eat here again and again and again.
author: Darren S.

description: Their service was nice and the staff were very welcoming. We ordered food to go and they offered us free chai latte and beer. Definitely coming back again!!
author: Abdulrahman A.

description: Really good food and service is excellent. I usually order the chicken kabob, Chana masala, or saag paneer, and all those dishes are really yummy.  The kabobs are really big and not dry. I highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner.
author: Nadine F.

description: Lovely lil restaurant, open late, solid saag paneer, great vibe, funny owner. Great place for a SOMA date
author: Zach H.

description:
Wonderfuly dark ambiance for Romance or just to soak up and reflect on lifes events or to be transported away from the stresses of the big city.    
     I truly felt invited by the warm hospitible service provided by Cooldeep and Love who wanted nothing more than for a perfect dining experience. Family owned and you can tell. It is about your experience...not your money.
        I feasted on the Sea Bass "curry" and the mushroom spinach dish. The Pinot Noir was very nice. The food gets a 10/10 easy. The experience was enchantingly perfect.
author: Scott D.

description: We were here for lunch buffet during the week. The place was jamming, so service was strained. We were seated at a dirty table and it took several minutes to correct this and several more minutes to obtain water and utensils. The food was tasty, but the selection was smaller than expected because some of the chafing dishes visible are not part of the buffet - they are there to expedite take out orders. However, the quality of the dishes was high and we enjoyed the meal.
author: Lynne L.

description: So glad i found this restraunt!! Saag aloo, bengan bartha, naan, and chicken masala always delicious and flavorful.
author: Cyn L.

description: Great food, great ambience, great service. The food reminds me of India! The staff is also very friendly. I had a great time here - this place is a must try in the Financial District.
author: Sarthak G.

description: This is my favorite lunch restaurant! They are perfect for a really large corporate group lunch and the buffet is AMAZING! Everything is really fresh and there are tons of options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike.
author: Chris P.

description: Food got out fast as hell, naan was a bit oily but rice was fluffy and soaked up the sauce exactly how I wanted.
author: Archie Q.

description: Great food, the samosas were really good, but the okra was amazing - everything was super fresh. The service was great - everyone was really helpful and friendly. Portions were really big. Had some complimentary gulab jamun which were very light and the perfect way to end the meal. Will definitely be back.
author: Mary O.

description: This food was delicious as hell. Amazing butter chicken! Good prices for such great food.
author: Emectar1 ..

description: Went for dinner.  Small quantity of food for the price.  Taste of the paneer was stale.  Food was not very fresh and 3 different dishes came out within 5 mins of ordering.
author: Raj J.

description: I love this restaurant! I won't go to any other Indian restaurant in the city. Great ambience with relaxing music and candles and the food is the best in the Bay Area. The best part of this restaurant, though, is the waitress Monica! What an amazing waitress, amazing customer service and great conversation! Always so nice to see her welcoming smile and kind demeanor after a long work day. She is truly one of a kind. What a great dining experience she makes it!  Two thumbs up!
author: Lisa S.

description: One of the best Indian foods we've had! We had murgh makhani veggie jalfrezi and the best garlic naans!! We found this place coz we saw plenty of ppl inside but m so glad we walked in! Service is v v quick but dnt expect too much talking from servers!!That's just how it is: eat pay leave!
author: Deena Z.

description:
This is a great place to come with co workers for lunch when you have a sizable group and probably forgot to make reservations somewhere. During lunch, North India has a buffer with a nice variety of meat and vegetable curries along with a vat of ice cream at the end for dessert! I'm no Indian food connoisseur, but the food is definitely tasty. I really like the meat curries, although they tend to be on the spicer side for me. The garlic naan here is also delicious! Crispy on the inside, but soft and warm on the inside!

They're also serving up lunch boxes to go literally outside their back door around hte counter. Prices don't include tax, so a chicken + vegetable lunchbox was $7.61 and was pretty filling.
author: Virginia T.

description: This is a relatively new Indian restaurant at SF downtown.  We tried chicken tikka masala and lamb curry. They were great. The naan was fresh and tasty. The ambience at this place is really nice. And the location is fantastic on second street surrounded by cool places and close  to the heart of the downtown.
author: Ahmad A.

description:
Part of the appeal of North India is the adventure: will they have silverware? Will there be any chicken curry or naan left? Will there be a free table? Exciting! It isn't like all those other restaurants that coddle their patrons with predictability.

That being said -- it's affordable, quick, and quite good.
author: Maz A.

description: Picked up to-go Baigan Bharta and mutter paneer. The quantity was more than enough for 4  adults and the baigan was surprisingly delicious! Definetely recommend
author: Anju J.

description: This is the best Indian food in downtown SF! Great energy & the nicest professional service. Also love the daily $15 all you can eat buffet. Highly recommend it!
author: Jodi N.

description: Loved the food and ambience. Service was good too. Authentic Indian cusine with just the right taste
author: Mayank A.

description:
From Wikipedia:  North India lies mainly on continental India, north of peninsular India. Towards its North are the Himalayas which define the boundary between the Indian subcontinent and the Tibetan plateau. 

I've been meaning to drop by this place for lunch for a while now, and finally got the chance to last week.  Let me preface by saying that I certainly felt I was lost in North India after my dine-in experience here.

After entering the restaurant, I had to wave down someone to seat us.  Of course, we were seated at a table directly under the sunlight, so I asked if we could be seated at the empty table across from us.  The hostess said it wouldn't be a problem and told us to get our food first.  After shuffling through the buffet line, we ventured to our "assigned" table and to my surprise, another hostess had seated another group.

At that point, we just went to sit wherever there was an open table, and of course, there weren't any utensils so we had to flag down a waiter for forks and knives.  It wasn't until halfway until the meal that someone came by and offered us some water.  After going for seconds, we come back to our table to find that my coworker's forks/knife was taken away.  After asking for another pair, waiter #1 proceeded to cuss out waiter #2 in Punjabi (I think...? or some other native Indian language).  By that time, my coworker and I just blankly stared at each other, totally confused.  It took them another 10 minutes to give us another set of utensils.

For the actual food, their chicken is extremely tender and the naan is freshly cooked; options are limited for the lunch buffet though but can't complain about the price.  Service is non-existent and makes you feel lost like you're in the Himalayas, but the tandoori chicken and other spices are worth trying if you want a cheap lunch option in FiDi.
author: Kevin C.

description: This is probably my favorite Indian food spot in SF! I came here for their lunch buffet and also for dinner. Both are excellent quality / price options. Food are pretty authentic and good. Highly recommend.
author: Julie L.

description:
Being from the East Coast, having lived in Little India, I know good Indian food. This place has good Indian food. To start there are many Indian patrons which is always a good sign.

We got the chicken tikka masala and eggplant with garlic naan and rice. All were excellent. Service with Cool was fantastic. He even threw in some free coconut ice cream, and took the eggplant off our bill because of a sticker I found in the food. Food was delicious which is all I really care about, service was fantastic. 
We will be back soon!
author: Diana L.

description:
North India Restaurant is one of my many go-to lunch destinations. It serves some pretty inexpensive lunch plates outside of their super sketchy back door. The food also comes straight from the buffet, which is probably to be expected.

Overall, I'm fine with giving North India Restaurant 5 stars for those tasty rice plates. There's quite a lot of food for the fairly cheap price point. One bit of advice though -- lines can get long during the lunch rush so it may be a good idea to head over a bit early or later so you're not waiting 20 minutes.
author: Grant S.

description: Seek out the side door for to-go. Decent value for a city lunch. Though admittedly I'd prefer a little more paneer in my saag.
author: Yad L.

description: Good food, attentive service, comfortable atmosphere, and good location. Perfect for a romantic date, a friend date, or even just to take yourself out to dinner in peace. Also very fair prices.
author: Melissa T.

description: I wasn't sure about this place based upon the name, but trust me, it's worth going.  I got amazing service and food. I asked for the house recommendation and got an amazing lamb rogan josh delivered to the right spice level.  The naan was perfect, and their kheer is great also.
author: Scott L.

description: Strongly recommend against ordering delivery from this restaurant. Food spilled all over bottom of bag and bag falling apart with leakage onto the carpet (I did not notice this before closing the door and getting halfway into my hotel room). Very poor delivery experience. No utensils provided and food was cold. Just order from somewhere else.
author: Vic B.

description:
I don't usually visit a restaurant more then once when I am in a town for just a short trip. However...I ate dinner here by myself my first night in town (because of their Yelp reviews) and then I brought my bosses back the next night.
The staff is awesome! The food is so great! Order the Taj Mahal beer, they have such a fun way that they pour it.
The portion sizes are perfect! It's a must try!!
author: Rachael Y.

description:
Ask any of my co-workers, this is my go-to lunch spot. As a vegetarian who loves saag paneer/aloo to the point that I should be committed to a group specializing in addictive personality behaviors, North India never lets me down! I honestly would go here every day if I could.

The staff is friendly and I highly recommend the box lunches sold out of the back door ($5-$8). You can specialize your box lunch order to contain anywhere between 1-3 different types of vegetarian/meat curries/entrees. I usually go with the saag dish of the day and daal. 

I also like the buffet here because all the food is wonderfully spiced and presented. It's a nice way to escape the office scene: stuff your face with delicious Indian food while conversing with friends - what sounds better than that?
author: Ruth R.

description: For the 3rd year in the row, North India has catered our Diwali lunch at work. We ordered for 120 ppl and everyone loves the food.  It's becoming one of our popular events in the office.  The only complaint was not having enough naan.  Next time we'll request for more naan!
author: Mari D.

description:
Affordable lunch buffet, nice decor.  The line moves fairly quickly and I like how you can order things from off the menu too.  Didn't care for the tandoori chicken as it was really dry.  They ran out of naan during my first round of the buffet and had to scramble to make more.  They had a curry chicken but it wasn't listed as tikka masala but it was pretty good. The pakora veggies I enjoyed but everything else from the buffet that I sampled was pretty average.  Their garlic naan was perfect though (off the menu) but their lassi was way too heavy.

If you're not wanting to take the time to dine in or go for the buffet, they have a cheap take out lunch option.    Another plus for the restaurant is ease of reserving a table for our large group on OpenTable.  Rounded up to a 3.
author: Cat C.

description:
Friendly banter full staff. Food is solid and hits the spot. Chai is very milky and not as spicy as I would've liked.

Dependable place that could be a regular go-to.
author: Chia L.

description:
Updated Review: 
This place has really really good indian food. I used to order from here pretty much every other day. Amaaaazing food and drinks! However, I had to revisit my rating and lower it coz its really sad that this restaurant got flagged again by the "poor health safety" tag. A total bummer! Please get that fixed "North India" .. We want to be able to go back to your restaurant again. As soon as the health score goes up from 68 to at least 80+. I hope that will be soon... 


Old Review:

Pros: 
(When it come to eating at the restaurant and pick up):
Nice ambiance 
A very clean restaurant 
Delicious Indian food
Very friendly staff
I would say fast as well 

Cons:
(Ordering a delivery)
Very very late, you have to actually call and check up on your food. And I actually live 5 mins away from the place. 
Food comes cold and by that time it arrives, it loses its taste :( 

I'd probably not order a delivery again but will definite either go eat there or pick it myself.
author: Hamda A.

description: Great meal Good service from Cooldeep was the best in the west. Give him a raise!
author: Mark L.

description:
Pretty average food given the prices. We ordered the chicken Tikka kebab and chicken jalfrezi. The kebab was not a kebab at all. It was under marinated chicken on a sizzler.

The Jalfrezi had a similar story. Low on flavor and pieces of chicken floating around.

The only item I enjoyed was the keema naan and the other bread items were quite good.

It's not the worst Indian food I've eaten but it's far from being worth the price.
author: Romit K.

description:
Trying to introduce good North Indian food to my friend but not being a local of SF, I did a lot of digging but still had suspicions when I reserved a table for two at North India Restaurant. The obviously not-fresh papadum and more potato than anything veggie pakoras we received as starters didn't give me too much hope.

However my doubts were happily proven wrong the second our mains arrived. We got Chicken Korma and Bengan Bartha. I was surprised with how wonderful the consistency of both curries were--not too watery, not too thick, just perfect velvety fluidness. Moreover, korma was very flavourful and chicken meat used was very good. I would have liked my Bengan Bartha hotter and did ask for it to be spicy but I guess the waiter may have got the wrong idea about our spice tolerance; still, flavour was spot-on and texture was pleasant. We also ordered garlic naan on the side and it was so good that we ended up ordering another. I was also surprised at how fast the orders came, especially given how good and well-prepared they were.

All in all, this is definitely my favourite North Indian restaurant in SF and the first place I'll go if I ever crave curry while in the city.
author: Bengisu K.

description: Good quality food.   Normal amount of choice in the buffet
author: David E.

description: I think the food is good.  Could be a little more flavorful. They do a variety on the buffet, with some staples.  I love the grab and go in the alley at lunch time. It's a bargain!
author: Tracie P.

description: Great Indian food restaurant with a great ambiance and helpful waiters. Tikka masala is superb as always and the portion of rice was big enough to share with my girlfriend. Would recommend for a nice business lunch even!
author: Eddie L.

description: The service was good, the atmosphere was comfortable, and the food is yummy. We had the chicken tikki masala and lamb and lentils.
author: Jeunesse S.

description: It was my first time at this restaurant and I LOVED it. It was the BEST Indian restaurant I've ever been to in my life. Everything was so clean & service was perfect. Our waiter, Cooldeep, came to refill our wines & water every time it went low. Every one was very nice and professional. The place was beautiful and amazing! I would definitely recommend this to everyone!!
author: Senait T.

description: Awesome, amazing food. Great down to earth atmosphere. The desserts were better than I could have imagined..never had Indian dessert but it's INCREDIBLE. Everything was the best.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
I came here a couple of weeks ago and was blown away with the quality of food. 
After such an amazing experience I had to come back!! I highly recommend the Chilean Sea Bass
author: Allen J.

description: First disappointment was to open my takeout with Aloo Gobhi and Nav Rattan Korma and find no accompanying rice. I could get over that. Second, inexcusable issue was finding two small meatballs in the Nav Rattan Korma- the first meat I've tasted in years. Gross!
author: David C.

description: Great value for their lunch buffet. Good selection of fresh and tasty dishes. Great service despite the restaurant paying incredibly full.
author: Henry B.

description: Stumbled on North India when we were visiting the city. Had the lunch buffet. Very reasonably priced and incredible food. The service was spot on and friendly. We liked it so much that we returned for lunch the next day! Hint: you can order garlic naan that's not in the buffet for a little extra, it's amazing. Saag paneer was delicious, and so was chicken tikka. I think for two of us it was around $30. Will absolutely go back!
author: Alix C.

description: Very delicious chicken tikka masala and great customer service. I usually order take away from them, make my food ready in timely order.
author: Julia H.

description:
Ordered takeout from this place, and overall loved it. Will definitely be ordering from here again. 

We got:
Samosas - perfectly cooked, not too greasy

Naan - standard quality

Mango lassi - a bit too fake bright orange, but yummy

Karahi Gosht - ordered this "hot" and it was insanely hot. I am used to spicy food, but this was beyond. I added a ton of yogurt to cool it down. Despite this, still yummy.

Prawn Jalfrezi - ordered this "medium" and it was super mild. 

Food was delicious, but I took off a star due to the wildly varying levels of spiciness, despite there only being three levels to choose from (mild, medium, hot).
author: Var N.

description: The butter chicken was absolutely delicious as well as the tandoori chicken. And of course the service was friendly and prompt.
author: Sophia J.

description: A lovely place during a rainy weekday night in SF. The chicken tikka kabob here was excellent - just the right combination of char and moisture. The naan was perfectly risen. We also ordered a bengan bartha, an enjoyable eggplant dish, and chicken spinach (saagwala) that had lovely, tender meat.
author: Andrew G.

description:
I have been here several times now and the Indian food is ok.

The first time it was incredible but for some reason the last time I went with a large group of work friends the quality was not as good.

Good buffet for lunch but less of a great place to eat for dinner.
author: Steven W.

description: Cooldeep hooked us up with dessert! Nice guy! The fish saag was pretty darn good. However, mango lassi was sour and the tandoori butter chicken dish was mediocre. Get the chicken tikka masala instead!
author: Albert H.

description: Came here with my coworkers during lunch on a weekday and got seated immediately even though it looked pretty packed. We opted for the buffet lunch, which was probably less than $20 per person (didn't get to see the check). The service was quick because they cleared our dishes when it was empty and refilled our waters without us asking. The fried veggies, carrot & peas dish, and the chicken curry dish was my favorite. The owner also walked around asking people if they wanted the garlic naan when they had the regular naan at the buffet. Left super full, but it was tasty. The chickpeas salad was the spiciest I had on my plate that day too.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Pros - looks clean 
Cons - average food, very few choices in the overpriced lunch buffet, crowded seating, average service
Sample size: two visits separated by one year
Going back?: probably not
author: Dinesh K.

description: The food is fatastic. Thisbis my first indian food, but all the tastes are amazing..!!
author: Derek S.

description:
Decent place to drop by for lunch and try delicious Indian cuisine. 

Buffet verity could be a bit bigger, but great taste and spirit compensates. 

Price is only $15.21. 

Will be back to try more. 
Thank you.
author: Slava C.

description: We had a real nice New Years Eve dinner here, with the usual curries and veggie dishes. I found the roti and chapati breads particularly tasty and fresh, but thought that the chicken tikka was not so special - the meat was cubed and curry sauce undistinguished. Still, the meal was good value in this moderately-price restaurant.
author: TeeJay D.

description:
This place has the worst food. The buffet is terrible. Food is absolutely bland and served cold. I'm shocked at how the service is - they place the wrong food tags and give the potential customers false hopes of what will be served at the buffet.

Their options are very limited and food is terrible. Please don't go by the ambience. The food is not worth a penny even.
author: Saloni J.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in SF. Amazing food every single time I've been here. Amazon saag paneer, awesome buffet, yummy naan.
author: Hil B.

description:
One of the best Indian places I ever ate in!
Awesome dishes with totally reasonable prices and great service!
author: Oriel B.

description:
Perfect place for a late Friday dinner!
Got to have the Indian beer, super special!
Cooldeep is the plug, make sure you say hi to him.
author: Jin Z.

description:
Been here for lunch buffet and dinner service.

Lunch Buffet:
- Fairly inexpensive (something like $12 / person)
- Food was great! They somehow managed to keep chicken juicy even though it's been sitting out.
- Good variety of foods

Dinner:
- Portions were a bit small for the price ($12-$15 / plate.)
- Rushed Service*

*Rushed Service:
1. We were the first people in for dinner service. Completely empty.
2. We ordered 2 dishes, rice, and naan.
3. I was catching up with somebody and so we were eating fairly slowly.
4. They kept coming over and asking if we were done when a lot of the food was still out there, just not on our plate. We're busy catching up! Leave us alone!

Recommended for lunch buffet but NOT for dinner.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
No. 

Food is good; service leaves a lot to be desired.

We ordered and watched the people who arrived/ordered after us, received their food before us. I flagged the waiter/host who took our orders after 15 minutes and he told me "the food is being prepared". Really? 

Waited another 10 minutes and went up to him and very explicitly asked him why the food was taking so long and told him that the other people around us all received their food before us. He told us our food was taking longer because we ordered appetizers - ironically enough, the table next to us ordered appetizers AND received their food quickly. Weird, eh? 

Really poor service, even after being called out on their crap. Avoid - there are better places in the FiDi.
author: Erwin K.

description: Fast and cheap! The food is good and very authentic north Indian. If you have time, sit down for some awesome buffet!
author: Zaki S.

description: North India is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in the bay area! When I am in the city for work, I hang out here quite often which means mostly on all weekdays. Their lunch combo (an option to pick a curry from 4-5 freshly prepared ones along with rice or naan for less than 8 dollars) is a great deal! My favorite dishes from this place are the Punjabi Kadhi and Kaali Dal. Reminds me of the one grandma makes at home back in India (:
author: Srishti S.

description: I've been on yelp for years and I've never written a review but after eating here around 2x per week on my lunch break for the last year I felt it was time to break my celibacy... Not only is North India one of the only restraunts in soma open 7 days a week but their food is ridiculously delicious! Seriously, if you like Indian food, try anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed. Local tip: come here for their all you can eat lunch buffet. PRO tip: walk around to their side door during lunch for one of their famous to-go boxes. $5 for a satisfyingly large portion of some delicious tikka masala. You won't be disappointed!
author: Nathan B.

description:
I've been here three times (all for dinner) and every single time has been exceptional. The entire wait staff is professional, friendly and helpful, but Kuldeep is the guy who really goes above and beyond to make sure you have a great dining experience. 

I've ordered personal plates, as well as shared the 'Dinner for Two' and everything has been delicious. The portions are good size and served family style so you can share with everyone at the table. If you have never really had Indian food, or don't know what the try, the Dinner for Two is a great place to start.  I have yet to leave this place hungry. If you enjoy drinks with dinner, the beer and wine list isn't extensive but is very reasonably priced. 

This place is my go-to for Indian.
author: Hector L.

description: it's been over an hour and a half since I got my confirmation. We called the restaurant at 10:43pm they said it will be there in a few minutes. 2 hours later I still did NOT receive my food and it says my order was delivered at 9:58pm. Seriously!!! Then I find out they delivered it to someone else for FREE!!! it's $72 worth of food. Ruined my party!!!
author: Jackie S.

description:
Very authentic food, overall. Service- they gave it their all even while they were packed. Naturally, mistakes were made (but they certainly made up for it). Offered us complimentary beverages at the end. 

Definitely would recommend, and would go again.
author: Sander G.

description: I just moved to SF and figured I would try North India Restaurant since I love Indian food. I was not disappointed! The food, service, and ambiance were all great. The menu was impressively large and varied, with a good sampling of meat options and traditional vegetarian dishes. I ordered garlic naan with paneer makhani, and both were amazing! The naan wasn't too crispy or sopping with oils, and tasted amazing. The paneer was incredibly fresh (often it isn't!) and the sauce was so tasty. I had enough to take home with me for leftovers, and the servers were happy to package it up for me. Very reasonably priced food that was really well done! I'll definitely be coming back :)
author: Megan D.

description: Honestly the best Indian food my boyfriend and I have ever had. The food came so fast and the staff were all really helpful and gave great recommendations. We got the samosas,saag paneer,chicken tikka masala, and garlic naan. Everything was so incredible and fresh! Definitely a must when you are in the city!!!!
author: Ceilidh C.

description:
good food！
It is delicious！
Good LAmb KOrma!
Delicious chicken.
Best India food ever!
author: Linyang W.

description:
The thing with lunch buffets is that it since the food is mass-produced, quality is often sacrificed for quantity. That was also the case at this restaurant, where I dined for the first time for a lunch with coworkers and supervisor. 

In spite of that, it wasn't bad. I think the highlight of that lunch was the naan bread, simply because it was perfectly toasted and not greasy. I also liked the lamb curry, the aloo mutter, and the chicken (because it wasn't dry!)

I did have an issue with one of the waiters on water duty though. In my eyes, it is unacceptable for anyone to interrupt another person's conversation unless in an emergency. Same for waiters. You don't yell "EXCUSE ME! EXCUSE ME!" repeatedly just to ask if you want your glass refilled with water when someone else looks occupied. That is simply rude. 

Other than that, I would like to redeem my 50% off entree coupon soon, so I will be back. Probably for takeout, though.
author: Viet N.

description: The food at North India was delicious and I give them an A+ for hospitality. The management and wait staff were exceptional. Overall, a great experience for anyone looking for some good Indian food at a reasonable price.
author: Felix S.

description:
Great food!

Had chicken and lamb for dinner and they were delicious!

Free dessert too
author: Tony L.

description:
Was working on a Sunday downtown and we were fiending for some Indian for lunch.  Our options were limited since it was a Sunday but this place seemed legit based on the reviews.  We ordered their CTM and some saag paneer and both were so-so.  Some salt was needed on the saag to bring the flavor out a bit more but it was still lacking.  

Maybe doable for the working crowd during the week but I would say pass for anyone with a discerning taste for the city's better Indian food.
author: Saminda W.

description: Amazing place dine in with an amazing atmosphere or order togo you wont regret trying this place, the staff is always kind and attentive but best of all is the food!!!!!
author: Ashley H.

description: Awesome food! Ask for the Tika masala and some naan with garlic, you will only regret not being able to eat more. Also get some rice with the yogurt sauce thing, delish!!!
author: Ignacio A.

description:
It was my last night in San Francisco and I in the mood for spicy food so I immediately thought why not Indian! Now I'm not an expert when it comes to Indian food but I'd heard from a friend that I needed to try some while out in San Francisco.

Truth be told... I'm beyond happy I chose Indian because the food from North India to this day is probably the best Indian food I have ever had. I ordered the Chicken tikka masala (extra spicy) and garlic naan) along with the rice pudding for dessert. 

Well...Let me back up a little. When I called in to order some food for delivery, a very nice man took my order and some how he found out I was from out of town and then proceed to say he hoped that his food was better than the Indian food in Chicago and so far his wish came true lol He then said that he would add an extra dessert to my meal to make my experience that much special. He added the mango lasso and it was delicious. I'm still dreaming about this food weeks after visiting San Fran. Hopefully next time I can dine in to get the full experience but this will be a go to spot when I return!

Save me a seat because I will be back :)
author: Sherren L.

description: Damn. Food was on point, particularly the lamb. Group of six ate heartily for under $100. Staff treated us life family and topped off our meal with free ice cream. So good.
author: Matthew I.

description:
Well it's a one star restaurant because !!

1) The place is so congested, if  you want to comeout of the place for a second round on buffet , you may need to put your ass at a certain angle to do that.
2)They don't have Chicken biryani, mutton biryani or yogurt rice or any other yogurt related stuff.They have plain white rice and they call it pulav? r u serious?
3)That mutton curry is roasted till death.
4) Well forgot to tell ya , they have ice cream, went to try it hoping it will be good, but i found a curly hair in it ( not sure whether it is from the pit or from the bush downstairs ).
5) i went with my colleagues today and one of the guy was vegeterian , i gotta check his face, he is so pissed.
6)I didn't see lot of indians there because they know it, poor americans and chinese , i pity them.


Finally i have decided to open up a nice restaurant which will give quality food and service (money making is not my motto) that , what people deserve. Adios
author: Louis X.

description: This place is nice with good food.  Came here for a lunch buffet for 13.99 a person.  The chai was really good too.  The service is great and welcoming.  Venue has a modern Indian feel to it. I'll be back for sure.
author: dina d.

description:
Appreciate when we can go eat Indian and not come back smelling like it too. The place is really big and portions are good. The curries we got were a bit salty for me, but that's what naan is for. The regular naan was the best because I feel like the garlic one was a bit drier and then had lost it chewiness that I love in naan. 

Servers were really nice and just wish that there was more parking around the area so that we could go more often. Got a groupon too!
author: Annie S.

description: Food was BOMB! We had a spicy chicken dish, white rice, an okra dish, and garlic naan. If you ask the waiter what's popular and delicious, you can't go wrong!
author: Connie E.

description:
Finally another INDIAN place in SOMA with decent ambience. Kuldip (Cool-deep) was our server and he was amazing... He even offered us tea on the house... We ordered fish tikka masala, which was yummy!!! Their oven chapatis are delishhhhh!!

I will definitely come back again... Great alternative to Amber in SOMA...

Thank you "North India"!!
author: Sachin K.

description: One of the best restaurants I visited in USA, Good was really tasty, and the staff was cooperative. Honour was really kind and sweet to speak.Bryani and kher I enjoyed the most .
author: Dewan P.

description:
This is my go-to Indian restaurant. 
I always order the chicken tikka masala and the garlic Naan. These two are the best combination. The curry is very creamy and it compliments the naan very well. Spicy-mild.
its pretty surprising to me how slow this place is during lunch time (Although I have never came during dinner time) because this place is great. Plus they have great lunch time deals on yelp!! be sure to check it out.
author: Anudari K.

description: Really good food great ambiance food staff is lovely and authentic good service specially cooldeep ( Kuldeep) great person everyone has smile on the face and recommend to everyone cherry and Krutika
author: Cherry L.

description: Wow. Impressive. Some of the best naan I've had. I went right after How Weird and the atmosphere was great. They were very accommodating to everyone in their current state.
author: Matt F.

description:
This review is specifically for the lunch boxes, not a sit-down meal: If you go to the back of the restaurant around lunchtime, they sell takeaway lunch boxes for between $5-$10. You can choose lamb or chicken tikka masala and one of two vegetable dishes (which seem to rotate), or just go with the $5 vegetarian option. 

The lamb is good, but it costs an extra dollar and is harder to chew. I recommend the chicken because as my coworker says, "the lamb is not quite $1 better, plus the chicken is in nice bite-sized pieces." The chicken tikka masala is quite tasty and has just enough flavor and spice to get your nose slightly runny, but not enough to make you cry. 

The lunch boxes are really filling, and maybe a bit rice-heavy. If you don't have a big appetite plan to take some home for dinner.

If you'd like to get takeout for lunch but are sick of sandwiches and sushirrito, North India's takeaway "back door" is a great option. Bonus: the line is usually not too long and they accept credit card!
author: Brittany C.

description: My friend and I were visiting SF for a few days and she told me she never had Indian food so I told her we had to go check one out! We found this place on Yelp and it did not disappoint. We made a reservation for Sunday night, but really didn't need it. The atmosphere was very nice and so was the staff. I ordered the chicken korma, she ordered the chicken madras, and we shared the onion naan bread. Both were delish! Wine was really cheap about $6. Def check out this place! My friend now loves Indian food.
author: Jamie V.

description:
Its great to see that buffets still exist in San Francisco, and close to the BART station as well! This place has a great lunch buffet for around $10. 

I've been here for the buffet several times and I can state that you won't get a better deal in SOMA. They have several appetizers including fish pakora which is very very good as well as vegetable pakora, and tandoori chicken legs/breast (always fresh and always good). For main dishes they have goat curry, chicken tikka masala (the dish everyone waits for), saag paneer (spinach and cheese curry), and daal (lentils). They have other dishes as well in the buffet but these are the ones that stand out for me. For dessert they usually have kheer (rice pudding) and some flavor of ice cream. 

Overall this is a great place to come for your lunch but I cannot emphasize enough that once you come after 12 pm you will be waiting, but for good reasons.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
Naan was pretty much perfect. (A touch on the buttery side, but I'm ok with it.) Rogan josh was flavorful and tender and amazing! I absolutely loved the warmth of the setting. Excellent meal for under $20. I felt the service could definitely have been warmer, but ultimately it wasn't bad. I'll definitely be back.

Edit: I am revising my review after my second visit- the lacking service forces me to change my rating from 5 to 4. I previously disregarded the service not being cold, but on my second trip, I waited 15 minutes to get my bill, (my very not personable waiter was sitting to eat a few tables down from me) When my check was incorrect, it took forever to have it corrected. Not to mention, one of the other waiters kept staring at me as I ate- I think he wanted me to leave, as he kept checking his watch. (I paid and left within an hour of closing)

It seems my first trip was on a good night. The service was terrible, and if the food were not as good as it was, I would without hesitation drop my review to 3 stars.
author: Jake K.

description:
I meant to place a delivery order through Eat24 but accidentally selected pick up.  I was annoyed at myself, but the guy who helped me when I called was nice enough.  He also threw in a complimentary item when I came to pick up the order. 

The garlic naan, butter chicken and tandoori chicken were all good, and I would order from them again.
author: Seong P.

description: My family from abroad was visiting me, I got some food to go. Due to some dietary restrictions, they can only eat mostly vegetables and a little meat.  They were impressed by a the dishes, I got a couple of vegetarian dishes and chicken tikka masala.  The food was amazing and wasn't too spicy. Food portions are good, I got 3 entrees and it was enough to feed 6 adults with some left overs.
author: Louise M.

description: Food was average. Service was a joke. They weren't that busy. You can't go wrong for average Indian and frankly average Indian food is probably a compliment.
author: Mike H.

description:
"Tara! Home... I'll go home. And I'll think of some way to get him back. After all... tomorrow is another day." Well, fiddle-dee-dee, I didn't know Miss Scarlett done up and changed Tara to North India Restaurant. It must have happened after the credits. Tara was actually a fairly low-key Thai restaurant that had two dishes I liked and ordered often, the Hainan Chicken and the Prawn Mango Green-Papaya Salad. But that business done gone with the wind. Lawzy, we gots to have a doctor. I don't know nothin' 'bout birthin' babies. But I do know standout Bhindi Masala when I have it. Ever been to a hole-in-the-wall called Alhamra? Frankly my dear, I don't give a damn, but North India ain't no Alhamra, Miss Scarlett.

Jamie W. and I gave it a try after work and had no trouble getting a table since the place was empty except for two other couples between whom we were strategically placed despite the fact that empty tables abound in the large space (photo: http://bit.ly/XZVKUg). The complimentary Papadum (normally $2) was a nice touch even if it didn't come with any condiments (photo: http://bit.ly/1wIxe66). We decided to share two dishes, the first being the $14.95 Lamb Korma, a paucity of tender lamb chunks drowning in a sea of yogurt and cream sauce topped with almond slices (photo: http://bit.ly/1x57cgt). No kick at all, none expected. The second dish was our old standby, the $11.95 Bhindi Masala (photo: http://bit.ly/1mH2ZMs). The okra was plentiful enough, but they were rather on the dry side with the chopped onions barely there and the cilantro way too abundant on top.

Whatever Indian spices were in the dish were nondescript. It was a miss. We asked for the rice with peas, two servings of the Pulao (photo: http://bit.ly/1vb2kSR), which turned out to be too much. I wish the waiter would have offered some opinion on that to steer us in the right direction. The $3.95 Kabuli Naan turned out to be more dessert-like since it was filled with fruit and nuts (photo: http://bit.ly/1sVHJzk). No complaints from me though, I thought it was pretty tasty. It also didn't stop us from ordering dessert since they were the only bargain that evening, $3.50 each. I tried the Kheer, which was a decent handling of traditional rice rice pudding (photo: http://bit.ly/1mqg6Bj), while Jamie had the Coconut Ice Cream which was marred by over-freezing (photo: http://bit.ly/1uBKLe5). We both left the place puzzled as to why the whole meal was so oddly bland for such a great cuisine.

FOOD - 3 stars...plentiful portions but overpriced and consistently bland
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...decor is nice but why crowd us against the window...ah, I see...to make it look more popular than it really is
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a bit indifferent and not too helpful
TOTAL - 3 stars...barely hanging on to the third star here...spice it up please
author: Ed U.

description: The first thing I want to say about this place is that it is not clean.  The silverware wasn't clean, the condiment holder had dried food on, the plates the food came out in had dried food on the outside, I could clearly see that the plate in which the rice came out had curry in it last time it was used...  I just now noticed that they have a Health Rating of 87 out of 100.  I think that's very generous.  As far as the food (which I ate some of it because I was starving), the lamb did not taste fresh, it left a weird taste in my mouth, the naan was soaked in grease, the rice was dried out, I could tell it was steamed some time ago...  As far as the service, it was pretty fast, but not courteous at all.  Over all bad experience.
author: T. B.

description: Got take-out here.  The food was ready promptly in roughly 10 minutes.  Got the lamb pakora and the chicken korma.  Dishes were fine, though they didn't taste terribly different from one another.  As other reviewers have mentioned, be sure to order rice separately as it is not included with the main dishes.
author: Chris L.

description: I was fortunate to come across this place while walking home from a Giants game with my father and husband.  We needed a break and the $2.99 HH beer lured us in. We LOVE Indian food and this place absolutely did not disappoint.  This past Saturday we found ourselves back in and had the Mulligatawny soup (light and hot and delicious) and fish pakora (light, not greasy, perfect) as we were there a bit too early for dinner.  Having traveled to Northern India where I ate Indian for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, this place is a welcome treat.  And the ambiance is nice and clean.  Thank you!
author: Al W.

description:
Food was good + we got tea complimentary in happy hour !
Happy happy !  Enjoyed Saturday lunch in sfo - yum  yum !!!
author: Darshita S.

description: The food was absolutely amazing! It was fresh and hot! Like, really hot! I've been to many a Indian restaurants and have requested my food spicy, only to find myself disappointed. Not here. One step above the food was the service! They welcomed our group and were willing to customize my order to fit my dietary restrictions. Great place to try for vegans! I will definitely be back!
author: Ty S.

description:
I ordered for delivery:

1 star for having online order and timely delivery
2 stars for the portion size
doesn't get a third star because they delivered me food without utensils or napkins... How am I supposed to eat my food?! (I went down stairs to hotel lobby to get utensils)
doesn't get a fourth star because the food was really salty 
And fifth stars are hard to come by.
author: Jackie M.

description: Okay. Tried it for the first time since it was around the corner. First their green chutney is extremely like Mexican sauce. But worse, the tandoori prawns had a hair on it, plastic pieces in the water. But sanitary and not good good service. Murgh makhani was okay. Paratha was okay but saag paneer was super bland. They give us iced coconut ice cream for free as consolation.
author: Joyeta S.

description:
The food was really great! 
The tandoori chicken and the meat player appetizer is a must. Super tender, get it! 
Also, You can never go wrong with garlic naan and chicken tikka masala. :)
author: Alisha Y.

description:
I Ioved the name from the get go because I am a big fan of Northern Indian food, but not so much Southern. Originally we were to go to some place called "Dosa" which immediately meant Southern, I am glad we changed. 

We have for dinner. I had the Navratan Korma with veggies and my friend had the Chicken Tandoori. I would say that the latter was much better. I love the Veggie Korma offered at Swagat in Hillsboro in Portland, but this one wasn't as good, though not bad either. I can't really describe why not as good, perhaps it was not as creamy, perhaps it is the spices. The veggie samosa appetizer was super spicy and I mean super, but overall good flavor, perhaps slightly overcooked. The naan bread and rice pudding were decent, but the chai was excellent. Man, it kept me up all night long but they did an excellent job on the flavor; just the right amount of spice and sweetness. I liked the atmosphere, airy and bright. The service was awesome, super friendly (and incredibly cute!) Indian servers. 

I would love to come back for buffet sometime to try their other dishes as well :)
author: Betsy B.

description:
I enjoyed the $6 lunch when lining up in the alley but since I was feeling super hungry that day, I ended up getting the chicken tikka masala and the lamb plus a naan on top of that.  Getting two meats plus a naan jacked up my lunch price to $11 but it was well worth it.  The lamb was well worth it but the chicken tikka masala was not as good as I liked.  I think I'm going with the saag paneer.  

They take cards in the carry out line but it's just one dude doing all the legwork so I tipped him.  Definitely worth coming back since the line usually is small and there's absolutely no way to find a seat here during lunch buffet time.
author: Ben H L.

description: Delivery - very quick, took 15 mins for food to arrive since I called.
author: Space T.

description: Very good Indian food. Dishes are cooked in a healthy way without lot of cream. The garlic nan was very fresh and good. The saag mushroom was pretty tasty. The place is clean and waiters were very curious . Nice ambience. The dessert gulab jamun was fresh and tasty.
author: Karthik R.

description: I wish yelp had a negative star. I usually never review on yelp for bad food. but this was the worst experience.
