I had ordered food from this horrible place. it took about 1 hour 45 mins. apparently the delivery guy was "waiting" outside the apartment for 45 minutes. Let me get to the food now. The paneer jalfrazi was just half cooked vegetable mush with more than half of the dish was just potatoes. Pathetic food! Gulab jamun tasted stale. Will never try this place again.
author: Irene D.

description:
Amazing! This place is just terrific. We have had fabulous service from Cooldeep whom I've spoken to each time we ordered. The food is really some of the best Indian food in SF. We don't order from anywhere else! 
You won't be disappointed!
author: Jessica W.

description: I came here and got their Saag Paneer which I liked. Their naan is separate but their portions pretty big. Also, they have a 50% off second entree offer that is pretty worth it. They let us use the offer even though we were getting takeout. Also, while we were waiting, they gave us some complimentary tea.
author: Guorui W.

description: Great food, great service! Loved the Rogan Josh and uncle ji was so sweet - he gave us free pineapple mango icecream :)
author: Devika M.

description:
Unbelievably good North Indian delivery! I love the late closing hours and the Tandoori chicken, the naan, and Tikka Masala. The spices taste freshly ground and the blends are sophisticated. I haven't had North Indian cuisine this good since the legendary North India Restaurant in Cow Hollow closed decades ago!

Be warned delivery is great most of the time but once in a while it can be slow. The check in feature is hard to use.
author: Peter M.

description: We visited for the first time and loved food here. Paneer jafni was delicious. Navaratna korma was superb. Service was superb, very friendly. Certainly will visit again.
author: Dilip A.

description:
This place is great. We liked:

1. Food
2. Service 
3. Prices

The chicken tikka masala was fantastic and the atmosphere is very nice!

Thanks!!!
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Good North Indian food!  

A buffet lunch daily provides lots of great choices!

I've been here twice now - consistently good.
author: Randi H.

description:
I came here with a couple of my friends on Labor Day, and I have to say the service was incredible here. Our waiter Cooldeep was extremely courteous to us and hooked us up with rice and naan free of charge since the restaurant wasn't too busy that day. 

We ordered the Prawn Coconut, Chicken Korma, and Lamb Jalfrezi. My personal favorite was the Chicken Korma: the chicken was very tender and the curry was just creamy goodness. The Prawn Coconut was also delicious and the coconut was not too overpowering at all. The lamb in the Lamb Jalfrezi was cooked to perfection while the curry was a little more meatier-tasting than the other two. For the naan, we got garlic, onion, and goat cheese. My favorite was the garlic naan, but my friends were a big fan of the goat cheese one as well. 

Overall, highly recommend eating at North India when you're around the area! And try to get Cooldeep as your waiter lol.
author: Grace N.

description: I like it here!! The food was great, server were friendly and offered to give us free ice cream because they heard that we were celebrating. I would totally come back again! (Shh...This place is also available on meal Pal)
author: Leo L.

description:
We've found our guy at this place and Kuldeep Singh it is. The food at North India Restaurant is *pretty nice* according to San Francisco Indian restaurant standards. But I believe it is the people who make or break the experience. And Kuldeep here took special care to get us service with *less oil* which is rare. 
We asked for bhindi w/o the tomato and capsicum pieces, and it was served as requested. Very few staff bother to follow through with special requests so we really appreciated kuldeeps attention to detail. My date and I were cozy, which he may have noticed so quietly that he brought a candle and placed it next to the rose at our table with a smile. We're back today and he remembers us. What more could one ask of a restaurant?
author: Nutcrackin C.

description:
Hook: Classy indian food

Came for an early dinner with a friend. We asked for recommendations, and they told us Tikka Misala and tandoori chicken. Being that this was the first time trying it, we accepted it. The Tikka Misala was okay, but nothing special, a solid 3.5/5. However, the main problem we had was the tandoori chicken, which I'm giving a 0/5. It was probably one of the most poorly prepared chicken I've had at an restaurant. The chicken was burnt, drowned in hot oil that was spewing burning droplets, and extremely dry and tough. The best part - it took about 50 minutes from order to serving.
author: Matthew L.

description: We went for buffet here and they had very few vegetarian options. They had a tava sabzi which was quite good but that was the only nice option for a vegetarian.
author: Deeksha R.

description: This is one of the best places to get Indian food in Downtown SFO. The owner of the establishment was kind enough to get some special items prepared for my birthday and is very friendly... Would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for great Indian food!!!
author: Ashish B.

description:
You could probably skip this place to be quite honest. I came here with a friend on a very quiet Sunday night and we shared a vegetable samosa, garlic naan/butter chicken, and chicken biryani with raita. 

The samosa was just okay - kind of spicier than normal but also nothing amazing. It just felt like eating fried pastry with bland potatoes and peas. Something was off about it. The garlic naan was okay as well...but the butter chicken simply wasn't good. It was too liquidy and didn't have the creamy texture that you usually look for in butter chicken. Kind of disappointing but the best part of the meal at least was the chicken biryani. It was nothing great compared to some other biryanis I've had in the Bay but at least it held the meal together. I won't be back with so many other places to eat in SF.
author: Manosai E.

description:
Indian cuisine is one of my favorite comfort foods, but I've been slightly disappointed so far with the lack of Indian options in the downtown area. Thus, I was pleasantly surprised when I tried out this nondescript-looking restaurant (with even more bland name) on a whim after my original restaurant choice proved too crowded.

The menu seems pretty typical for Indian American restaurants, with the popular hits like Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo. The meat in the Chicken Tikka Masala and Rogan Josh (lamb curry) were tender and fresh but a bit dry on the inside (perhaps they would've been better cut into smaller pieces). The sauces they came in were delicious though, especially slathered over some garlic naan. I found myself wishing it came with more sauce and less meat! The Bengan Barthaa (roasted eggplant) was a nice light contrast to the heavy meat dishes.

As much as I enjoyed the food, the service was even better. We originally had a 50% off a second entree deal from checking in on Yelp, but when the waiter asked to see it, we couldn't seem to find the deal again. Our waiter gave the deal to us anyway, and even threw in some dessert on the house!

The only nitpick I have is that the price adds up quickly since everything is a la carte (including rice), but it's still a decent value for the amount of food you get. I'll definitely be coming back here.
author: Terry L.

description:
I've been here for both a la carte and lunch buffet. Quality is definitely here when you do a la carte as they pay more attention to you but the lunch buffet isn't too shabby. 

$10 for lunch buffet. AYCE- who would be against that? I was more worried about my self control! When I went to the lunch buffet, there were two fried items (onions, chicken), tandoori chicken, salad, saag paneer, aloo gobi, spicy yellow cabbage, chicken curry, potato pea curry, lamb curry, huge amounts of nann and Kheer (indian rice pudding made with coconut milk, raisins and nuts). I really like their nann, they've mastered the fine balance between the crunch and dough. Make sure to grab them while they are hot! A la carte- we ordered a potato and pea curry, crushed paneer dish, chicken curry and another paneer (cubed) curry along with nann.

Service is attentive but beware of their white napkins, they give you white lint on your dress pants! Several of my coworkers made this mistake :X. Enjoy!
author: Jennifer D.

description: DO NOT eat their lunch buffet on the weekend. Probably the worst Indian food I've had ever and I'm Indian so I've had a lot! Everything we had either lacked flavor big time or probably were leftovers heated up. Midway through our lunch, they took out the fish pakoras and replaced with stale French fries.
author: Arjun S.

description:
I frequent North India ~3 per week. It is by far the most reliable and amazing restaurant in town. The restaurant has a great ambiance and courteous staff. They refill waters constantly! Great date place, great lunch spot. Bring your company and family.
:)
author: Kieran O.

description:
My friend and I were looking for some bomb indian food in the city and North India restaurant just happened to have times open for reservations! Perfect. 

we ordered for two people:

- aloo paratha
- lamb madras
- vegetable biryani
- chicken tikka masala

Don't get me wrong I love my friend, but I'm pretty sure I barely talked to her because I was too busy eating yummy food....... 

Def will come back!
author: Christina L.

description: This Indian is better than anything else I have tasted in SF to date. Very fragrant, great selection of food and wine, amazing service.. You can't beat this place. Highly recommended
author: Dan S.

description:
BEWARE of your bill!!!! 

I would've given this restaurant 4 stars if not for their dishonesty. My recommendation is to watch out for your bill as they overcharge you deliberately. My coworker and I went there for lunch. After asking our waiter to split our check 50/50 and charge it to our credit cards, we noticed that he added $5 to each of our credit card transaction. At first we thought he made an honest mistake to our charges and when we called him, without even pointing out the error to him yet, he told us that he'll refund to both of us $10 by cash. This seems strange. If he knows that he overcharged us by accident, then why didn't he acknowledged that error when he first brought us our credit card copies to sign. His reaction confirmed my suspicion that the overcharge was done deliberately. Most probably, it is a scheme by this restaurant asking their employees to overcharge customers and most likely, many people may not have noticed the overcharge. So beware of your bill!
author: Cecelia H.

description: Cold lunch buffet for 4 people $60! The buffet was very very cold and the buffet table was a mess
author: Norah A.

description:
I was craving Indian food during my visit to San Francisco, and was very disappointed with the food and service at North India Restaurant. Pretty sad considering I convinced my sister to break her diet to try this place and it was not at all worth it. We were ignored for the first 5 minutes. Finally a waiter came to our table. Before ordering, I had to send my water glass back  because it was covered in crud and food residue. Not the best first impression.

My sister placed an order for a sizzling lamb dish (the name I can't recall) and I opted for the lamb curry, extra spicy. After over 40 minutes of waiting our food came out. In all of my visits to an Indian restaurant I have never not been served rice or naan (dosa, etc. as a side) to eat my entree with. In this case--- nothing. Just a bowl full of meat. Perhaps he wasn't done bringing the order out.... so I waited 5 more minutes.... Nothing. So I ask him if my lamb curry comes with either rice or naan. He shrugs and mumbles something inaudible. I am assuming he put in an order of rice so I wait another 10 minutes. By now, both of our lamb dishes are getting cold waiting for something to eat it with. I try to make eye contact with the waiter to check on the status several times in an empty restaurant, without success.  Hungry and feeling ignored, I get up to walk to the counter of this empty restaurant, and ask him again if he could bring out naan OR rice to accompany our meal. He says ok and I wait 5 more minutes. Finally, he returns with BOTH naan and rice... and charges me extra for BOTH. To make matters worse, I was starving at that point and the lamb was cold and dry as can be. 

A plus would be that they have a check-in offer. But even that can be a hassle to redeem a % off of your meal. Neither my sister nor I live in San Francisco (so we had never been to this restaurant before) yet he interrogated us about whether we redeemed this offer already. Pretty disappointing experience. And I usually just love Indian food!
author: Helina G.

description:
Great place! Quiet atmosphere and friendly service 
The food is authentic Indian cuisine. The staples are all there.  Tandoori chicken, chicken tikki masala and a fantastic lamb gal dolth (probably spelled that wrong but you'll know it when you see it)
author: Eric S.

description: Food was amazing. Great atmosphere and the service good too. The staff were all very friendly. I got the matar paneer. It was creamy not too watery, went great with their nan bread. My boyfriend got the lamb biryani. The portion came huge and the lamb was tender and very flavorful. We also got their mango and saffron kulfi for dessert. I would recommend both flavors if you end up having enough room for dessert :)
author: China O.

description: Good, quick lunch buffet. Not much more to say than that, but Yelp makes me type more.
author: Kenzi C.

description: Talk to Cooldeep! He is awesome! He is super nice! Had dinner there, and my friend and I were having a stressful day. Cooldeep sent us some chai and was so positive and friendly. It made our day! Great service, good people, nice location!
author: EatVegetarian F.

description:
Baigan Bharta was awesome and  they have lip smacking butter chicken.
Tandoori Chicken was not upto the mark... but green chutney along with it was worth it.
author: Abhishek S.

description:
First thing first: If ordering delivery, please take note: entrees do not come with rice. (I didn't see this on the app when ordering delivery, and looks like other people are mentioning the same issue. 

And is it just me, but do utensils not come with delivery anymore, or do you specifically have to ask for them? (Asking, for real, cause I'm not sure.) Even when the delivery destination is a hotel room, you would think, right? Someone please let me know. 

Other than that, and a slight wait (it was dinner time, so not the biggest deal) the spicy Saag Paneer really needed the mellow rice to make it the fantastic dish that it was. Sure, I ate a lot of it alone, but damn, I wanted the whole experience here. Naan and samosas were good and had excellent flavor was well, but it didn't take away that overall disappointment. (We ordered 4 entrees, 3 types of naan and samosas and spent around 80 bucks, and we were introducing a friend to her first Indian food experience. 

Super sad about the entire thing, so wanted to give you delivery order-ers a heads up, so you could avoid the womp womp and enjoy the meal as it was meant to be. 

(And pretty sure, I ordered from this place last year, and there wasn't this issue, so not sure if I just misread, or what.)
author: Allie A.

description:
Ordered 6 dishes for takeout today. Each curry flavor came in unlabelled plastic containers, causing headache and unwanted taste tests to figure out which was which. The naan bread pieces were not only soggy but were small too. No other side dishes came with the order, meaning the ratio from curry vessel to curry was /way/ off. Additionally, the chicken that I ate (Bombay Chicken) was dry and grainy. Frankly, it was a task to finish my meal and I am left extremely dissatisfied especially considering we paid an average of $13-14 per dish.

So, in conclusion, the takeout was disorganized, the meals were badly designed, the chicken was meh, and the dishes were overpriced considering what you get. Although I have to say the curry sauce was a solid 7/10.
author: George K.

description: The best service ! Very friendly environment and the food is great. Our server was so kind and informative about everything on the menu! Defiantly will come again and I strongly recommend it!
author: Sophia A.

description:
Fantastic and spontaneous dinner with my GF.!
Bombay chicken is absolutely must try. The environment suits great for date or even a casual hangout. 10 out of ten for chef and service.
author: Sagyn B.

description:
Amazing restaurant open late at night in the heart of downtown! Authentic Indian cuisine and great staff

So I just lied. The host was the weirdest man I've ever encountered. He offered to give us $20 off our meal if we left a 5 star rating and say nice things about this restaurant. The food was average Indian and the service was as you can imagine, really weird. He hovered over my phone as I wrote the above comments to make sure I did and he touched our phones to direct us to tell us what to do. What a weird dude.
author: Somer S.

description:
Good, decent meal that was delicious. Friendly staff, water always filled and the tandoori chicken is spot on.

Took a little long for food, but is well worth.
author: Oliver T.

description: The food was very good and the service was excellent. We are vegetarian and there were lots of great options for us. We would definitely come back!
author: Samuel N.

description:
I was on my way to Muffins Muffins and what do I see....? Tara has become North India Restaurant. Like other local Indian spots, North India has a takeout lunch special which my friend and I tried. The lunch special was $6 and I think there was a choice between chicken or lamb (maybe also a vegetarian option) which is only ~$4 less than the buffet. If I had the time (and didn't have to go back to work), I would've tried the lunch buffet...

Pros:
- Chicken tikka masala was good. Hearty, lots of chicken.
- Great price point. $6! (Though a tiny bit annoying that they don't include tax, like their competitor Mefhil). 

Cons:
- Operational inefficiency. Granted, they had only been open a week or so when I went, but it took about 15 minutes to get my takeout and there were only two people ahead of me. It was excruciatingly painful as they haven't figured out how traffic will flow, especially while you're standing around other people's tables.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Food was okay.  Not amaze balls.  Don't get blindsided by their fancy ambiance.  Ambiance doesn't make up for their lack of tasty food.  Their carpets don't match their drapes (if you know what I mean).

The waitstaff was borderline pushy yet helpful (i.e., they were pushing me to give them a 5-star yelp review.  that left a poor taste in my mouth - no pun intended).

If you're looking for a quick and tasty fix, I'd recommend checking out other Indian cuisines nearby along that street instead.
author: Sam C.

description:
Really yummy Indian. Lunch has an all you can eat buffet. 

It gets crowded but the line moves quickly. Also, service is on point. My glass was refilled almost instantly every time I took a drink. Definitely a go-to spot in the neighborhood.
author: Harrison L.

description:
I really enjoyed my lunch here. The parking was a bit tricky though but I think if you live or work nearby it is definitely worth popping in. 

The food was very good. I think I tried almost everything at the buffet. I would also recommend ordering off their menu as well. I especially liked the lentil dish they had at the buffet. 

The service was good too! I had a chai tea as well.
author: Sara P.

description: Came here last weekend with a couple of friends and had a really nice meal. Between the four of us, we ordered two appetizers, three entrees, two garlic naan, and two rice and that was more than enough. The server was definitely trying to upsell us on more food but we left completely stuffed. We started with the samosas and papadums (Indian chips!) and they were as you'd expect - very good. We shared a veggie garbanzo dish, chicken tikka, and rogan josh lamb. All were very good and we liked being able to share amongst the group. It tasted a little different than other Indian I've had - a little sweeter, but still very tasty. Very reasonable price, we all had a drink and in total we spent about $20 per person - not  bad for SF!
author: Kendra N.

description: Very hot spicy food even when requested mild. Rice must be ordered separately. Got a good deal because of Yelp special check in offer. Not as flavorful as other Indian we've had.
author: Dustin T.

description:
I ordered delivery to my hotel on my first night in San Francisco! Fast delivery, amazing service, and incredible food. I'm Indian so I know ! Great food great prices. I ordered the saag paneer, the chicken korma and chicken tikka masala and they were all great! 
Definitely coming back for more!!
author: Malina M.

description: The price was not too expensive for 2 people and there is a large variety to select from for lunch (buffet style). The place is quite clean, has many tables, and is a good place to catch up with friends.
author: Michael T.

description: Delicious food and friendly people.Its seems empty restaurant most of the nights because it's located on the financial district,with new residential buildings coming to neighborhood this place will be famous to go at night out.Must eat here,nice place.
author: Samet Y.

description: There lunch time window is one of the best quick bites at a reasonable rate. Lamb and Nan has become a staple of mine on my lunch break. Definitely worth a visit if your looking for a new place to catch a bite.
author: Joshua K.

description: Good food, the coconut chicken dish was a small amount for two people especially with the huge amount of rice we got. The lamb naan was better than the potato naan. I may hit the lunch buffet it may be a more reasonable choice. Thank you.
author: Giselle K.

description: It's really good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you Cooldeep !!!! Best service. Delicious food. One of my top favorite restaurant eveeer.
author: Chia Chi H.

description:
If you are looking for a quick takeout, make sure you have enough time to wait for 15 - 20 minutes.
Food is alright. But I've had enough of waiting in line to not go back again.
author: Avi T.

description: It serves a good variety of North Indian options but the Lamb was really tough and inedible. Chicken dishes were decent/good though.
author: Amiraj D.

description: Not impressed, in any way.  Let's be real here, it was a late night order, so my choices were few and far between.  But despite being ready to CRUSH some food, I just  didn't enjoy it. I had a few bites, put it in the fridge, and tried again the next day, and was even less impressed.
author: Julia S.

description:
Super delicious. Sag aloo and Bengan Bartha were both 5/5 delicious. Seriously dangerously good. Garlic naan gets 4/5.

Was surprised they had take out order (via phone) ready so fast.
author: watson w.

description:
If you are in the financial district I recommend stopping by for lunch. The buffet offers a much better deal than many other places in the area and I have never left disappointed.

A warning about delivery. If you plan on ordering during peak dinner hours make sure to call an hour before you plan to eat as delivery seems to take between 40-60 minutes.
author: Ethan V.

description: I would recommend this place to everyone who loves great authentic Indian food! The food is amazing! They cook it to your specifications, not like some other places that make everything so spicy you can't taste the food. You savor every bite of your food here! Besides the food, the service is amazing! I am a regular customer, and when one of my dishes in my order was incorrect, Norman and Cooldeep went above and beyond to make it right. I appreciated that a ton, and that's why this is my regular spot! Thanks again!
author: Thommy L.

description: The food was awesome as well as the service. Owner gave us a complimentary dessert. Recommend for all who love Indian food
author: Lisa M.

description: Came here with my girlfriend for dinner had the tikka masala, pulao, and garlic naan which were all very delicious. Would recommend to others.
author: Josh M.

description: The food was really good. I got the chicken Bombay and I'm really glad they can make everything spicy. I love spicy food and the waiter was really accommodating and brought me 3 different hot sauces before we found one spicy enough for my taste. The portions were also very big.
author: Polina T.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala: 2 stars. Cream was great but chicken was dry. 

Palak Paneer: Tasted fine but creamy and the paneer was hard rather than smooth and soft

Service: staff was not warm and smiley. Cold overall but not mean.
author: Kem K.

description: I've been here twice and both times have been amazing.  The vegetarian dishes are delicious - favorite is the okra and the garlic naan is great too. I'm surprised there aren't more folks around dinner time, this place is so tasty!
author: Simone W.

description: Outstanding restaurant. Mixed tandoori was delicious. Fantastic lamb saag. Great service. Nice modern dining room with a "hip" feel. We'll be back next time in SF!
author: Christopher W.

description: Great room and great food. The people working are very kind and accommodating. Cooldeep is a sweet guy!
author: Sarah M.

description:
This place was suprisingly good!! I've walked by this place almost a thousand times and finally got to try it out. We came around 11:30 am and it was still empty. Lots of great choices, fresh, clean and Naan was freshly baked and placed on the buffet. I've had and make better Naan, but it's cool to find it on the buffet line. Great service. Place started to fill up by 12, but we were nicely filled and ready to go back to the grind.
If you're coming for lunch and have to go back to work after, be careful sitting by the window with all the pillows. You just might knock out.
author: Vika K.

description: Get service, excellent food, and Excellent ice cream! Second do time here, will def come back.
author: Mary C.

description: Super excited to have some lamb korma and paleek paneer! I'm obsessed with Indian food but very few places take traditional methods to their cooking. Once I talked to Cooldeep I knew I was in for a treat! Super excited to find this place!!!!
author: Melanie K.

description: Good Indian food especially their tandoori items, naans and curries. Nice ambiance, beer/wine options. Clean and good customer service. Check thus place out.
author: Abs D.

description: The garlic naan was the best I've ever had. The chicken tikka masala was yummy and the lamb vindaloo didn't disappoint. I can't believe o haven't tried this place before I would totally come here for lunch. The service was really good. I recommend this Indian place. Great location in the financial district
author: Mimi L.

description:
I recommend North India for anyone looking for a brawl. 

Incredibly poor service. They charge for everything short of water and attempt to cheat you wherever possible. They turn hustle you through the meal even though the restaurant is empty. The food is fine but overpriced and not worth the experience.
author: Luke C.

description: Just wanted to get delicious india food. Great stop in Financial District. Had a great time here for dinner. Food is on point ask for more spices if you enjoy it. Also the staff member are very nice and welcoming. Good service.
author: Dhruv J.

description: The food was absolutely delicious, I highly recommend the onion kulsa and the paneer tikka masala!
author: Kyle W.

description: Large portions, reasonable prices, and great service! Had the spinach lamb, chicken biryani, and the Masala Chai and everything was well seasoned and flavorful. Would definitely come back if I'm the area!
author: Victoria S.

description: I can always count on this place for a solid, filling meal for a reasonable price. The service is always friendly and attentive, and I have not had a bad dish, ever. I assume they get most of their business during lunch - when they have a buffet - because it is rarely full when we go for dinner. We love to hit this place up after a couple of drinks at 111 Minna; it's super close, and hits the spot perfectly!
author: Akemi Y.

description: My friends and I went here for a birthday. And we liked it a lot! The food was great and it was affordable. Downside is parking. We were lucky to find one on the street. But there are so many restrictions. If I'm in the area, I will come here again. Plus you get a free entree!
author: Kristine D.

description:
I was here last week for a weeknight meal and while I had fairly high hopes, I was pretty disappointed with my experience.

We were promptly seated and the atmosphere was pleasant and relaxed since it was a Monday night and the restaurant was less than half empty.  We ordered a few different items and it took a really long time for our food to arrive (about 40 minutes).  The first item that arrived was an entrée dish, but it arrived by itself and the other items (an additional entrée dish, bread, rice) did not arrive until we asked for them, which was 10 minutes later.  It really seemed as if our order got lost in the shuffle, but there was no apology made.

Overall, I actually thought the food was good and I would be open to going back, but it was extremely disappointing to experience such slow service and absolutely no explanation or apology.
author: Ken G.

description: This place is okay... I ordered take out. The food is a bit overpriced.... $5 for garlic nan... I also ordered the rice with the peas but they got it wrong and just gave me regular rice which was $4 and I ordered two... The curry was decent but overall the food was not worth the price.
author: Elaine F.

description: Very decent lunch buffet. Flavors weren't as bold as I would've hoped yet the buffet was fresh and very tasty. Mango Lassi was delicious. Get it.
author: Alex P.

description: So delicious-- love finding a place so close to home. Great service! The best paneer we've had.
author: Mai G.

description: Lovely place and people! Went in for some chai and conversation with a friend, and when we got up to pay the manager told us the tea was on the house, since that was the only thing we got. Such a sweet and generous gesture. The tea was delicious, too.
author: Belén A.

description: Excellent authentic North Indian food; good service and ambience. Garlic naan was outstanding.
author: Siddarth K.

description: The best vegetable samosas in town! Really enjoyed the friendly service and comfortable ambiance.
author: Courtney H.

description:
Superb food! Very nice staff. We ordered bhindi masala and paneer makhni and OMG!! Both the items were superb. I will come back here again anytime.

Excellent food
Excellent ambience 
Excellent Punjabi music playing in the background 
Excellent service 

The host was so nice to give us a complimentary dessert.
author: S S.

description: The north India dinner (thali) for two is just amazing!! Come hungry. Food is incredible and dishes are generous! Every appetizer and entree   was excellent and well made.
author: Ido K.

description: Delicious mahkani and naan sampler. Chicken tikka looked amazing sizzling at our neighbors table.
author: Erin W.

description: We found this place on Yelp and weren't disappointed. Great Samosas and Aloo Gobi, decent butter chicken. Good prices, too. Satisfied. And with a 50% off yelp coupon, you can't go wrong.
author: Meg S.

description:
Not very hygienic. Had fabric string in my naan. The spoon next to my table had dried onion stuck on it. 

Food was mediocre. Garlic naan was good, but everything was not delicious. Wasn't bad though. Mango lassi was too thick and not enough mangos. 

 I rather go somewhere else for Indian food.
author: Dan K.

description: Phenomenal food, friendly staff. Chana masala is amazing. Everything is extremely flavorful.
author: Nick M.

description:
Excellent service we just came for pick up but they offered complimentary tea :)

we got dinner really quick too
author: Shubhi J.

description:
I have been here twice, this is a decent lunch place. Their lunch is buffet style but they don't have a big selection. A few vegetable dishes and 3-4 meat dishes. They also have a lunch box for for 5-6 $ ( dont remember the exact amount but very cheap) they serve it from the door in the alley next to it. 

My major issue is the seating inside the restaurant, its so cramped and it makes it very difficult to talk / move around ( this is a buffet place , so we do have to move around to get food).
author: Sundeep K.

description: Great spot!  Ordering online was super easy.  It took a couple minutes for the order to come up so they gave me a free beer while I waited.  Tandoori chicken, saag paneer, naan.  New favorite spot.  Well done!
author: David K.

description:
If you find yourself in the financial district stop in.  They will not disappoint. 5 stars in food, service and atmosphere.  

Try the Bombay chicken, kind of a spicy curry chicken masala.  Also the lamb was excellent and California raised which was a plus!
author: Chad R.

description: Time and again North Indian Oven doesn't disappoint. The food is exquisite and traditional. The staff is so attentive and polight. Will definitely continue coming..
author: Maria O.

description: Great food, chicken masala was really tender. The lamb had a really good taste as well.
author: Markus A.

description:
I hit up this Indian restaurant twice while staying in a hotel downtown on a business trip. It sure beats the hell out of most other quick delivery options, and the variety of flavors you can choose from are very welcome to someone like me who travels all the time and sees the same boring options time and time again. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is because I have been spoiled by ridiculously delicious home cooking, and nothing beats the home made small batches people make for their own families.

While everything from the curries to the side of assorted pickles was delicious, the item I'd like to call out is the naan. I loved the garlic naan, and the naan stuffed with lamb meat hit the spot so well!

Very kind employees as well, in my experience. That's always greatly appreciated!
Cheers & you'll have my business again next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Elliott S.

description: Excellent food! Great service. We got the chicken tikka marsala and saag aloo, with peshwari naan and samosa. The food tasted great and the staff were super friendly! The peshwari naan is the best man in SF!
author: Steven B.

description: Amazing food best Indian food i ever had and I eat lots of Indian food . Classy and cozy place
author: Iman A.

description: Had their food with some colleagues today. I asked for a hot vindaloo and received a watery bland dish doused in coriander. Everyone else I dined with had much the same experience. Bland and disappointing food. A real let down.
author: Peter R.

description:
I had a sudden craving for Indian food so I decided to pop into this restaurant with a friend. We arrived at 7 PM on a Thursday and there was no wait!  First thing I observed was that this was a pretty versatile ambiance. Indoor tables were elegant and great for business dinners/first dates, but you can opt to sit outside for a more casual environment! There was a Buy One Entree Get Second for 50% off coupon after we checked in so my friend and I feasted like hungry hippos. We ordered Garlic Naan, Baingan Bharta (Eggplant), Chicken Tikka Masala and Karahi Gosht (Lamb) and ended up with a sizeable amount of leftovers. 

One aspect that stood out tremendously was the service. Water glasses were always filled and waiters constantly asked us if we needed anything. My friend and I had dinner for 3.5 hours and did not feel rushed at all by the staff even though the restaurant was about to close. Our waiter even provided us complimentary coconut ice cream! (Thanks Cooldeep!!!) 

I definitely want to try the lunch buffet if I'm ever in the City for lunch!
author: Erika L.

description: Extremely friendly, responsive and fast staff (especially Sean).  Food is AMAZING and beers are only $3.  Best Indian I've found in San Francisco.
author: Zack B.

description:
Came in on a Sunday first time. Seems like only two of the people that work here can speak English. We kept asking for some service to actually start our order and most of the servers didn't know what to do. They either couldn't speak or had no experience whatsoever. Finally someone was free to help us get our order.

Here's a tip... If you're going to open a business especially a restaurant in America please please please have all your waiters speak English.
author: Avery K.

description: Great lunch buffet! The food is fresh, plentiful and there was a lot of variety. I also found out that they do quick pickup on the side window! Since my office is near here I will definitely be stopping by.
author: Connie W.

description:
Food was ok. Ambiance good. Service wasn't.

Just a regular Indian restaurant.. nothing really special. Price isn't bad.
author: S K.

description:
Reviewing for the take away lunch and the great customer service. I've come for the take away lunch a number of times and have never been disappointed with the quality of food and the amount you're given. (The price is amazing!) I've never been to the in-restaurant lunch buffet because I have a rather short lunch break, but to the side of North India is the door to their take-away option. There's almost never a line and if there is, it's short and moves swiftly. 

Huge servings of delicious food! A large to-go box of rice, chicken tikka, and a side of naan for about $8? Yes please. I've only tried their chicken dishes, but I'm a big fan of them. Their staff is friendly, professional, and accommodating! (Cooldeep's the man!) North India's by far one of my favorite lunch spots in the Financial District.
author: Kathryn B.

description: Friendly staff! Our group of 8 had a reservation and we were seated very quickly for a Friday night. I ordered the chicken vindaloo, and the chicken portion was very generous, flavors were good. I got it at medium spice level, but probably could have gone with the spicy level too. Complimentary ice cream afterwards was nice!
author: Connie C.

description: Came here for an impromptu dinner Christmas Day without a reservation. Was absolutely JAM-PACKED!! Luckily got one of the last seats but that was where luck ended. From the moment we sat down their doorway was never empty of people jostling for a seat or waiting on their takeaway order. Now I could write a really nasty review about the 2 hour wait for our meal (I wish that was an exaggeration) BUT it was Christmas Day, a lot of people like us turned up without a reservation and the food was quite delish - we ordered half tandoori chicken, garlic naan, lamb rogan josh and rice. The poor staff were run off their feet, there were a couple of tiffs in the kitchen and it was overall chaos but when we walked past again the following night it was a lot quieter and I have no doubt the service would have been more tentative.
author: Jenny R.

description: Ordered delivery, the prawn korma is very good especially the texture of the prawns and nuts. Also ordered murgh masala, which is also good. Order came early I was worried the driver GTA drived through the rain. 5 stars for the creamy sauce and fast delivery.
author: Ron A.

description: Food was delicious and the service was excellent. This is a good place for families and for taking friends out for dinner.
author: Ajinkya D.

description:
We (myself, the husband and the overtired baby) decided to walk into the restaurant only because it was the only one open at the time and it was pretty close to where we got off ( we meant to go to another popular fast food joint to take dinner to go and it was closed ) and we were lucky! 
 First off the waiters were very courteous and offered to put our stroller away for us. We were super tired and that was a nice gesture. We were given a nice little corner table with views of the street. We ordered veggie pakoras, veggie jalfrazie (I don't know how to spell it), Dal makhni,chapathis and onion kulcha. Everything tasted so good  it felt like it was made back home!

All in all a great place to eat!
author: Sowmya S.

description:
I have been here multiple times and I took plenty of friends. I am big fan of their whole wheat parathas and chapathi/roti(you can get these in ).  Their customer service is exceptional(compare any indian/chinese/american restaurants around). 

I love their vegetable sabzi, samosas(feel the freshness of potato), pakodas.

Also, kuldeep, is awesome waiter and always helpful - 5 star service.

I will come back.

Kalyan.
author: Kalyan A.

description: Good food, nice ambiance. Chai is delish, we got the spinach lamb, chicken tikka, garlic naan, veggie and fish pokhoras, et al. I would go here again and recommend it to people in the area. They are generous and the food is filling. Nice servers too!
author: Morgan J.

description: Dinner was soooo great & the service was super fast, we had chicken Tikka masala & chicken vandal ooh & both had great flavor, it was my friends birthday & they even offered dessert on the house, we will definitely be back !
author: Jennie W.

description: The food here was pretty good. I love lamb vindaloo so I ordered it. Not sure if lamb is pricey but there wasn't much in there, more potatoes than anything. If you're looking for a tangy vindaloo, this place isn't it. I also ordered the raita as a side, though tasty, it was a watery mess. Isn't it supposed to have chunks of cucumber? The two stars stem from the person I ordered my take with. He was unfriendly and not courteous. I went to go pick up and there were almost no words exchanged. He was on his phone for some reason, maybe playing Pokemon Go? Every other restaurant I have been to in SF has had great service except this one =(
author: Will C.

description: dirty plates, dirty silverware, just ok service and food is average, not recommnded, won't come back.
author: Michal V.

description: First time here. The service was excellent. They were very kind and always checked in to see how we were doing. The food was nothing short of spectacular. The lamb was cooked well and the aloogobi was one of the best I've ever tasted. Definitely recommend!
author: Marianne B.

description: Really good place. We got the dinner for two and it's totally worth it. All of the food is delicious. Make sure to check in for 50% off for the second entree. We also got chai on the house.
author: Sasha T.

description: A little expensive but I would say worth the money. Definitely recommend the naan (plain or garlic or whatever they're all delicious)
author: Andy Z.

description: Beer on the house wohoo :) love north India. Get the fish masala, love the taste. The biriyani are yum-o! Great for parties, I highly recommend. Request for Cooldeep as your server.
author: Rosaline C.

description: We ordered the chicken korma and the lamb vindaloo. Everything was great! Thank you! We'll be back.
author: Sharmila J.

description: Just tried their delivery for the first time and I thought it was excellent. Fresh, great spices, good selection. The aloo gobi was delicious and the kashmiri chicken. Will order from here again!
author: Jemma L.

description:
- We ordered food first 
- than they served us dishes and silverware which was extremely dirty. We could see food stains on the plates and silverware
- we asked for new dishes but they did not give us new silverware 
- the paneer was overly salty so i had to add tamarind sauce to it 
- the naan was not cooked properly 
- wont be going back again.  Over-priced for the service and food and uncleanliness
author: B P.

description:
What a great experience! Our company was in town for a conference and we were craving Indian Food.  Everything was awesome. We started with vegetable samosa, which was great and the entrees were even better. You will not be disappointed. 

We will be coming back here again before we leave!
author: Chad E.

description: The service was really good. They never hesitate to throw in a free desert or some free chai on the house and the food is really good.
author: Li-Anne D.

description: Good portions, spicy, fast service, nice spot close to market street! (And I got ice cream on the house )
author: Tata L.

description: Everything here is what you'd expect good (slightly Americanized, but gooood) indian food to be. However, I just want to note that this place has by far the best fresh PLAIN naan I've ever eaten. It's not poofy and thick like a traditional naan, but more like crispy and chewy and layery, like the Chinese scallion pancakes (minus the scallions). I just ate 3 plain naans by themselves. No sauce needed...
author: Betty T.

description: The owner reached out to apologize for my experience and asked to give them another chance, which I really appreciated. These kinds of small gestures illustrate great customer service and contribute to people wanting to come back. Will probably give this place another shot.
author: David F.

description: In love with their Paneer bhurji and Dal Makhani! I have ordered food from here twice so far. Both times the food was delivered on time and hot.
author: Bhavya K.

description: Great service and delicious food! Nice ambiance for dinner time. Dim lighting inside with large windows to see the outside. Food arrived very promptly!
author: Christine E.

description:
I visited this place today after seeing a long line for buffet. first impression was not great, most of the plates were chipped and it was hard to find a perfect one. Second they asked us to go to the buffet line straight instead of showing us seat so after getting the food in our plates, we were looking for place to sit. 

The food was average. I tried few variety and they are OK.
author: R G.

description:
The buffet is OK. It was cheap (then they raised the price a bit), but they don't change the food often (or at all?) so it's pretty repetitive. 

It's pretty crawded too, so long lines and kind of a mess sometimes. 

I prefer Amber, but to be fair Amber costs twice more...
author: Lionel F.

description: I'm not sure how this place has 4 stars. I am new to the Bay Area and was expecting some glorious Indian food. The paneer makhani sauce was super watery as opposed to creamy and thick. The paneer was squishy and I highly doubt it came out of the tandoori oven as advertised. The gobhi was unimpressive and there was cilantro caked all over the top as well as throughout which should have been disclosed in the description, especially for those of us with the OR6A2 gene. Lastly, the menu is a la carte, rice and naan are not included (which you would think otherwise considering the price) and this would have been helpful to know before I ordered delivery.
author: L D.

description: Cooldeep our waiter was the MAN. We stumbled on this gem of an Indian restaurant the other night and were pleasantly surprised!! Awesome food, amazing service, free wine?? We'll be back!
author: J M.

description:
$9.95 all you can eat lunch buffet.... I don't eat THAT much, but it's nice to have the option 

pros:
attentive waiters (took plates and refilled waters w/o asking)
decent buffet selection
clean
fresh food

cons: 
popular food items run out way too fast
author: Angelica C.

description: Awesome Indian restaurant! We got the dinner for 2 and it was so delicious, lots of food. Service was great! Also, the corner table has the best view.
author: Julie P.

description: The best Indian food in SF with great service. Loved biryani and garlic naan is very good here. Make sure to order Indian beer Kingfisher here
author: Prashant B.

description: I ordered the chicken curry and garlic naan, which was both pretty good. Medium spice was the perfect heat, not too spicy, but spicy enough. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend eating here.
author: Christine L.

description: Awesome place. Called them because of a previous bad order with another restaurant and they gave me free tea
author: Haider K.

description: Love this lunch buffet- Great food and the price is reasonable for SF- Only $9.95 for all you can eat lunch. I loved the mango lassi as well
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Update -- Owner called me after the bad experience to apologize. He offered to send me another meal to make up for the bad experience. I thought this was good customer service.

I've tried my fair share of Indian restaurants, and this experience was one of the worst. I ordered take out through an app and the service was timely. However, the food experience was really disappointing. The $14 chicken entree we ordered was a small portion and didn't come with rice. It's a dish served in a sauce which always comes with rice in a restaurant. It was never explicitly stated anywhere that it needed to be ordered separately. My mango lassi was half full to the top, and my soup was a cup rather than bowl portion. The food was pretty good but I would not recommend.
author: Kristen W.

description: Food was amazing. Service was better. Kuldeep was the fucking man. I would absolutely recommend and I will absolutely come back.
author: Nico L.

description: Great selection and preparation of solid Indian food. I enjoyed the saag aloo, chicken dalawala, and garlic naan. The service was excellent and nice atmosphere, chill but busy. A good choice if you're craving Indian in SoMA.
author: Ann W.

description:
I ordered for delivery and the food was delicious and perfectly spiced.

No napkins or utensils came with the delivery, nor any rice with my chicken tiki masala. 

For $13 it should include rice. End of story. Or at least make it super clear that you have to get it separately, since it's not. I have never ordered from somewhere, where a main dish did not come with the expects rice. It makes the restaurant seem cheap.

In terms of how the food tastes, it would be 5 stars alone. But it's almost mandatory in my opinion that delivery should come with utensils. If I didn't work by a restaurant, I would be stuck and unable to eat it.
author: Shira S.

description: Arrived very late on Wednesday night, right before restaurant was about to close. The restaurant owner was gracious to entertain us so late, after the  kitchen was almost closing. Served amazing food, great taste, quality and portions. Definitely recommend!
author: Triveni K.

description:
I have recently been introduced to Indian food over the last year or two and am pretty selective when it comes to it. I actually like North India and find that their food is well seasoned, authentic (perhaps not? food isn't spicy), but a little bit pricy. Dinner came out to be about $50 including tax, tip, and $5 off with restaurant.com voucher. Appetizer, 2 dishes and naan. 

This is really close to my office, and I've heard their buffet is quite nice. We came here for dinner one night and between my bf and I we shared a couple of dishes. The samosas were very good, crispy on the outside and the spicy cilantro chutney had a good amount of heat. How can you fail on samosas though? We also had a sea bass curry masala and an eggplant dish which both were good.

Overall, this place is pretty solid. Food and service are all pretty good. Would recommend if you are in the area and need an Indian fix.
author: Stine H.

description: We ordered online delivery and were impressed by the service. The ice cream we ordered was somehow not included in the first delivery, so they delivered again for us with an extra portion even though we only ask credit back. Also, they gave us extra naan and rice. Overall, even though we didnt visit the restaurant in person, we felt really accommodated and welcomed!
author: Yan L.

description:
They need more room. The buffet line seems to offer a nice opportunity to rub your buttocks on somebody's shoulder as the hoards of waiters and customers work they way into oncoming traffic. The food is good, however, which makes this review hard to write. There were also three waiters who said they were going to bring us some spoons for dessert, after we could not find them by the food bar. It took them five minutes to get back to us with the spoons (no exaggeration).

The water glass that was served to me was chipped, and there was razor sharp edges near where I might have my hands. I immediately asked for another glass and the guy looked at me like I was crazy. I literally had to point to the chip in the glass and look at him, like, 'Dude!?'

My company is what made this meal nice. I had a nice conversation. But the service was horrible and the super busy chaotic environment was less than serving. Two thumbs down.
author: Juan M.

description: Excellent dinner!  I am new to Indian food and never know what to order, luckily on this night I had people with me who ordered some excellent dishes.  The garlic naan was excellent, wasn't too garlicky and full of flavor.  The chicken Tikka was excellent and the lamb vindaloo had a great spice/flavor associated with it.  Excellent food, I only gave it 4 stars because I thought the service could have been better.
author: MichaelAnthony C.

description: Ok, nothing special, am English so used to very good curries, service was very patchy, had to ask to order drink, then again to order food, then again to see where the food was as it took a while. Felt like they were understaffed. Food was Indian style but lacked the depth and richness of a flavor of a good Indian prepared meal. Combined with the fact they have failed their food and hygiene safety probably means it would be a firm NO in terms of re visiting.
author: Scott R.

description: We stumbled on this restaurant looking for something else and we are so happy we stopped in! Not only was the food delicious but everyone that works here was really nice and accommodating. We started with the samosas and a cup of soup, from there we knew we were going to love this place! Then I had the butter chicken, my husband had the chicken vindaloo with garlic naans and enough rice to feed us take some home and share with the table next to us, lol.  We left full and happy! Definitely do yourself a favor and pop in! Next time we will have to try the buffet.
author: Theresa R.

description:
Plenty of friendly servers, although the kitchen seemed a bit slow on our order.

Tasty food!  Reasonably priced.
The CTM (Chicken Tikka Masala) was the favorite of our 3 dishes.
The Lamb naan made a great appetiser as we waited for our friends to arrive.

White table clothes with a single red rose in vase create an elegant room.
Big windows to watch the city pass by.
I'll be back!
author: Chere F.

description: What a delight! Classy restaurant with great food and service, and with fair and reasonable prices. Try the meat sampler appetizer, which comes with chicken and lamb over veggies. Enough for a meal. Also had amazing chicken tikka Marsala and a vegetable dish. Wonderful flavors. I am diabetic and they even agreed the dish to reduce salt. Very accommodating. Would definitely come back.
author: Alan S.

description: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. What a sham. Ordered for delivery. The Chicken Tikka Masala was clearly frozen and reheated ...probably several times and every piece was inedible!! Rubbery chewy garbage masked in bland watery sauce . The Green Peas and Paneer dish was on par with the chicken to balance the disgusting offering. How in the world could a Green Peas and Paneer dish taste bitter? Awful simply awful . The only item we ate was the Samosa. Perhaps we will let you know if that has afterburner effects later.
author: Roger B.

description: Came for a Sunday dinner. Pretty and fancy-ish intimate interior. Chicken Madras (sp?) was so delicious but OMG the onion naan bread. I could eat plate after plate of this bread. Nice servers, fun music, really good food
author: E F.

description: Rogan josh dish was terrible.  It was westernized and made with a tomato-based sauce that seemed to be poured over the meat.  Bhindi massala was good.  We found it ridiculous that they did not provide basmati rice nor naan with our take-out orders.
author: Extremus S.

description: Great food, had the Mushroom Mattar, Vegetable Jalfrezi, Paratha, Dal soup, jasmine rice and Spinach Paratha with Lagunitas IPA! All for a fair price.
author: John F.

description: Food is really good and the service was very personal and touching. One of the best places I have ate Indian food from. We had the seafood biriyani and it was delicious. Can't wait to try the curry
author: Nyoka B.

description:
Tried this place for some biryani while I was staying in the area. The meat and rice seemed to be prepared independently. It was more like a meat pulao. Quantity of meat was very generous though. The raita had a very thin consistency.
So go here only if you have no other choice. There are plenty of restaurants in the area.
author: E G.

description: They really hit the spot here, classic. Here by myself on a business trip. Vegetarian options are awesome and I decided on Chana masala which was one of the best I've ever had, with garlic naan, rice, and wine. Medium spicy was the right amount spicy. I want to come back for baigan bharta and veggie pakoras. Nice and chill atmosphere + Bhangra music - really glad I came here!
author: Kate R.

description:
The service here is great.

I called in my order for delivery and the food came pretty fast(about 30 minutes)

Raita, it was so good I ate it really fast.  It was a yogurty and cucumber, and shredded carrot mix, that was more on the liquidy side, but like I said so tasty.

dal soup: not good at all, it smelled funky and came with a lemon in it, I ended up eating the whole thing because I was hungry , but I would never order this again, the soup almost looked like porridge and smelled not tantalizing .

Aloo paratha: It was okay, I usually order naan, but I decided to try something different.  It was a little over cooked( a little bit burnt and blackened, still good enough to eat though)very filling, I would probably just order a naan next time.

Pulao (rice) very good I almost ate the whole thing, it is a little on the dry side, but it has just enough cardamom and peas though.

mango chutney: I barely ate it, not because it wasn't good but rather because I didn't know how to incorporate it with the rest of my food.  I just ordered it because it sounded good, but I will not be ordering this again.

kulfi: very good, came in a small container with some kind of nuts on top.

Lassi drink: mango: Super good!   I drank the whole thing with my meal, I will definitely order this a gain, it was super sweet(great cause I like sweet things) so super good!

When I called the guy on the phone was super friendly and really easy to communicate with and understand and he mentioned that next time I should come into the restaurant so I would definitely come back to this restaurant and next time eat inside the restaurant because I guess it seems like a nice place to have a nice dinner.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Chicken tikka Masala recommend and vegetarian options ! Very kind welcoming people love it! 10/10 recommend my friends and I work around the corner. Great service.
author: Maria Elena A.

description: Nice folks and decent indian food, the highlight being the plain naan.  The chicken tikka masala is bland so I will have the kick up the spices a little.
author: Ken H.

description: I'm in san fran for a work . i found at north Indian restaurant is incredible . The staff is nice and clean . Friendly staff Service is fast too ! Restaurant is clean and bigger than other restaurants! But Owner is so rude . He never had smile on his face !
author: Carlo S.

description:
Great service from a friendly staff. 
They even gave me some chai tea while I waited for my takeout. 
The lamb is highly recommended.
author: Shane S.

description: Excellent establishment. The mixed breads provided a great accompaniment to the chicken madras and the veg curry. Definitely get it hot!
author: Curt F.

description: Great value for downtown SF dining. Staff is very professional and friendly. Definitely will come back again and again!
author: Robert B.

description:
Kuldeep and Norman went above and beyond in helping me to plan a company event at North India! Even though I changed the date, size of the party and menu budget, they always remained helpful and positive - much appreciated.

The night of the event, Kuldeep was super helpful in making sure that everyone in our group was happy at all times. Thank you so much!!!
author: Ashley M.

description: Solid Indian restaurant, and great service! My friends and I got an assortment of entrees and naans, all very delicious. Try the goat cheese naan and lamb korma!
author: Celine H.

description:
Food and service were fantastic
I'd highly recommend this place 
My wife and I were given a perfect window seat
Great for friends or a date night and offered free desserts for her birthday
author: Bob T.

description: Came here for dinner + drinks with a special friend in town. Couldn't think of a better choice than indian and North India Restaurant did not disappoint. Yummy rogan josh and saag mushroom. Food was delicious and portions were generous. Good spice level. Cooldeep was very attentive. Loved it!
author: V H.

description: I used to love this restaurant when it opened last year. Recently the servers have become very rude. They don't pay attention. Don't know if it's because we were just 4 of us or they just dint care. We had requested for garlic naan. The first time we asked a server got pretty cold ones and served us each a quarter of a naan. Second time we requested they dint bother to get any. The desert had got over n they dint refill it. The bowls kept for desert were so dirty I dint feel like eating it. My friend found pieces of paper in her ice cream. The worst was them giving us a check within 5mins of us sitting at the table. When I confronted the server, he got angry n asked us to talk to manager if we had any problem. I am never ever going back there. Had the most disappointing experience ever.
author: Riya G.

description: Ordered from eat24 and the food was disgusting, no rice served with the chicken dishes. On top of that the driver demanded a tip. Don't waste your money is my recommendation.
author: Erica P.

description:
We came early before the dinner rush and had the best seat in the house, with a view of all SoMa crowd leaving work. 

The tiki masala was some of the best my UK friend has had in the States, and my Tandoori chicken was still sizzling as it came to the table. The naan was fantastic, and plentiful; but maybe skip the papadoms (no onion chutney). 

Well priced beer and wine to round out the meal, or some sweet rice pudding - we'll definitely be back.
author: Ivan F.

description: We ordered butter chicken, daal, plain naan and plain rice. It was awesome! Delicious food and great ambience. Will definitely come back for more.
author: Ankit A.

description: Great food. Great ambiance. Great service! Came here after work and was met by our waiter Cooldeep, he was very nice and shared some stories with us. The food came out really fast and it was super good. Definitely coming back!
author: Fahima B.

description: Had Dal soup, Fish Masala, and a Mango Lassi. The Lassi was standard. The Dal was good with some curry in it. The fish however was a huge disappointment. The texture of the fish was mush and the rest of the plate matched. We chose it because of the reviews, hopefully they just had an off day. With so many great Indian restaurants to choose from, I will not go back.
author: Massimo P.

description: This. Place. Is. AWESOME! haha. super delicious. Me and my boyfriend (who I just adore to the very most bottom of my heart.) have been coming to this place for so long, about 2 times, and we are addicted. our server who has served us both times, is something you would call a funny guy. he is extremely cool. and deep, as a funny guy... and best of all, his name, happens to be CoolDeep.! what's not to love about this place. North India is my go-to spot for masalas and garlic naan and samosas and water.. he hooked us up with a tasty ice cream as well. 50 million stars!
author: Emily G.

description: Veggie samosas were dope, the Lamb madras was good with a nice spiciness, but the chicken tikka masala was dry and not flavorful at all. Waiters are average, kind of rude actually.
author: Rachel O.

description: Good food and okay service. The owner was the nicest. Other severs seemed like they hated their job. I drove 2 hours in the SF traffic to eat there. Would have loved it if they were more pleasant. The food gets my 4 stars honestly.
author: Ola A.

description: My gf and I had the dinner for 2 and it was a TON of food. It was well worth how much we had to pay. We got to try the tandori chicken, saag paneer, and the chicken tikka masala. Unfortunately they ran out of samosas. I also wish we got more naan bread. Saag Paneer is my fave and I was kinda not impressed by the one they had, but everything else was delish,
author: Heather S.

description: Not only is the food great but the staff is too - shout out to Cooldeep for providing such a great experience for us!
author: Ken R.

description:
Its hard to find a $6 lunch that leaves you stuffed in this part of town. But if you are willing to stand in a line at the back door of restaurant on an alley you can find that lunch here.

The chicken tikka masala is buttery and rich with plenty of chicken. The vegetable option is also pretty tasty and rotates from day to day. The portion is large enough that it is difficult to finish all the rice, and if you get a naan as well it is almost impossible.

This place definitely beats out Mehfil as an Indian lunch box option.
author: Michael S.

description: The restaurant had a great atmosphere about it. Incredibly nice staff. The food was very authentic, true to North Indian food. The tiki masala was so tasty, great portions to share with. Definitely will be coming back!!
author: Gabriela D.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant touring from VA and I loved the food. Our waiter was patient and explai ed the menu, offered us different options that we would have not picked. Food was amazing!!!
author: Yerika S.

description: Ordered on seamless at 10:03 had to call twice; food arrived 90 minutes later. No explanation given.
author: Neil S.

description: Excellent food and great service. Really enjoyed the desserts as well. Family loved it!
author: Nick K.

description: The variety on the menu is exceptional. Food is flavorful and everything we had was delicious (Vegetable Samosas, Paneer Bhurji, Tika Masala Chicken, Hydrobodi Chicken and some mystery dessert that the manager just brought us after we had received our check!). Service is remarkably strong, especially considering how busy they were on a Saturday night. Ambience is great and inviting.
author: Michael B.

description: The food was really wonderful! And the service was even better! The portion sizes were perfect. I shared two entrees with a friend and got rice for two. The portion size for the rice was more than plenty! Would definitely recommend! :)
author: Christine M.

description: Great medium-sized Indian restaurant in the FiDi! They have a nice buffet that's quite inexpensive by SF standards and offers a respectably large variety of dishes. The food is quite fresh and authentic as well. I typically get the takeout though from the side of the restaurant which is also quite inexpensive, but can require a 10-20 minute wait. The main thing I think they should improve is the variety in their takeout menu, since they always offer the same chicken dish, (butter chicken), and more or less the same 3-4 vegetable dishes. It would be nice to have some more options once in a while. :P
author: Sahil S.

description: After coming from NY it was nice to find good Indian food that was well portioned, tasty and flavorful! Good to know it is close in the neighborhood.
author: Molly B.

description: The best food that I ever had.Tasted real Punjabi food afta long time.The gentle man Kuldeep is really  gud regarding service he always remember us when we are in restaurant and provides his best!very gud place to have food we can eat feeling relaxed not like other restaurant eating fast and then leaving the place!the service provided by kuldeep is excellent.he treat everyone in very respectful manner.Frankly speaking very good place to have delicious Indian Punjabi food.
author: Raju K.

description: This place has really good Indian food in the financial district. Their garlic naan and curries are cravable.
author: Hans G.

description:
Excellent menu good service and atmosphere. Typical curry offerings and seemed a bit down spiced for American pallets. My lamb vindaloo was flavorful but more in the madras heat zone. Samosa was greasy but tasty but overall very pleasing. Seems to be a very popular lunch spot as the queue was quite long. If you are familiar with London Curry this is not Brick Lane or local curry but more of an American slant but fits the bill if you need a fix. 

The garlic naan was tasty!
author: Brad B.

description: So the owner reached out to me after seeing my review and wanted to make it right. Good to see good customer service. He gave me two free buffets to give it another try. I'm happy to say that the service was much friendlier this time, and the food seemed better as well. I'll go back again some time.
author: Jeff S.

description: This place deserves a review- they take care of me every time (I'm here at least twice a week). One of my favorite spots in SF. The food is amazing and the service has always been awesome. Our waiter Cooldeep has always gone above and beyond, be it a free drink or complimentary dessert. The lunch special is the BEST in and out in less than 5 minutes with some of the best Indian food in SF for a price you can't beat. Go here, eat well, and give the waitstaff some love- they deserve it.
author: Bri S.

description: The worst experience ever I have: service, food. We had to wait for 45 mins to get food, and took my order 2 tym, not because of it was crowded but the priority to serve other people who have come after us. I felt racism. Also food quality was also very bad in fact I can cook well...
author: Swapnil S.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night at 11 pm by myself after an event. 

Vegetable pakora: mixed feelings -- very dry, but had a good crunchiness (fried) that was satisfying. It had a slight heat/slickness on the inside that made it addicting, but the dryness made it hard to taste the rest of the ingredients.

Basmati rice: standard Basmati rice, not super dry or moist

Rogan josh (lamb curry): a few pieces were tender, but many were either really dry and too chewy. Loved the curry though, got the mild and liked the mixture for the rice.

A little bit pricy for the quality of what I normally get. Overall just okay.
author: David C.

description: Solid food. Get there early at lunch time - it's disappointing to be in a long line and the tandoori chicken is out! In fact, it's probably not worth the wait. But all the currys are pretty tasty. Just pass on the fried appetizers.
author: Howe L.

description: I came here for the lunch buffet, and since coming here, I've already made plans with several of my friends to come back. For $12, the lunch buffet is such a good deal! They have every type of curry imaginable and they also have dessert. My favorites were the saag paneer, tadori chicken, chicken tikka masala, and the lamb curry. The service was a little rushed, but since it was on a week day, it's pretty understandable with the FiDi/SoMa lunch rush. If you're looking to get full on delicious indian food, I definitely recommend coming here! There were also a lot of Indian customers when we went and that is always a good sign of authenticity.
author: Hana K.

description: The food was great we had naan, aaloo gobi, and chicken masala extra spicy! I love that the spice sneaks in towards the end and it's a really savory spice. Great meal!
author: Artina L.

description: Came here early on a Saturday night for a quick dinner. We started with the dal soup and then followed up with a bhindi masala and channa masala. The staff were friendly and were able to point to the vegan options on the menu. Unfortunately, as is common in the bay area, most of the breads/naan had milk in them, but they were able to make chapati without butter so it was vegan. Overall a nice place to grab Indian food in SF.
author: Josh B.

description: An easy place for indian take out. The palak paneer, chana, CTM, and garlic naan are all pretty good. Avoid the malai kofta- the kofta are really dense and tough. Not very impressive. I've never eaten in house so can't speak to the service.
author: Vinitha R.

description: We loved the food and service was excellent. Our first time at SFO. Will definitely come back.
author: S P.

description:
What a delightful surprise this quiet, unassuming restaurant turned out to be. Beautiful decor with an understated casual elegance and impeccable service are a winning duo and this place offers both in abundance. Full of mouth watering spice pairings, every dish we sampled was clearly lovingly prepared and full of clean, fresh flavors. The Chicken Tikka Masala runs savory, the onion and cilantro Naan is a must, and the Chai is perfectly sweetened. I look forward to sampling more of their offerings during future visits. Just perfect. 

P.S. 1/2 off your second entree after 3 p.m. with check in!
author: Ta D.

description:
This place was a joy.  Chicken tika nails it. Onion naan is delicious.  Chai comes hot and sweet.  And the kheer is rich and refreshing.  Kuldeep was our server and he was great,  added some sides and included some extra desserts because it was the end of the night.  Would def come again and id like to try the buffet.

UPDATE:  Came back for buffet the next day.  Same amazing service from Kuldeep.  Someone in another review mentioned that the saag paneer wasnt up to par but I disagree.  Fabulous.  Everything was great.  And my fiancee turned me onto using raita and mint as my salad dressing and it tastes great.  Love this place.  Will come back often.

Second Update:  try the tandoori chicken.  Best I've had.
author: Jesse A.

description: Classic dishes, wasn't too busy on a Friday night, server was awesome. Really deadpan humor.
author: Samuel F.

description: It's pretty good! Rice has cumin seeds in it - always a winner with me. The lamb is extremely tender and lovely. Had the chx tikka masala - also pretty darn good. The flavors and spices weren't bad - not spectacular, but definitely solid. I'd order from them again. In fact, that's what I'm planning to do right now.
author: erin s.

description:
Friendly staff, food was amazing and the
Place is nicely decorated. Definitely coming back. Highly recommend chicken masala and lamb korma dishes. I heard lunch buffet is amazing here too so I will definitely check it out soon.
author: Seong K.

description: Nicely spiced, delicious Indian food.  I ordered online for pickup and our meal was ready 5 minutes before the designated time.  They were also great about adding rice to my order, which I forgot to do originally.  Super nice servers and host.  I will be sure to be back!
author: Anne M.

description:
Spinach Paneer... On point. 
Lamb Korma... On point. 
Chicken Tikka Masala... On point. 

Service... Out of this world!!
author: Aaron O.

description: Stopped here to use the 50% off a second entree coupon. They couldn't have been nicer, normally the coupon was dine in only, but it let me use it. Plus complimentary chai tea while I waited for my food. Will be back!
author: Carlynn A.

description: Awesome food with authentic taste. Soft chapatis and authentic daal makhni. Nice ambience. Fast food service
author: Abhishek P.

description: Awesome food... Bhaigan bharta is very special. I ordered daal and bahigan bharta both r nice. Also i got the complimentary ice cream. That was something too good
author: Anshul K.

description:
Amazing food and service! Cooldeep is very attentive and  
Understands the craft of good dining! Food has authentic Indian flavors! You can't go wrong with the curries here!!!
author: Nikki P.

description:
The boyfriend and I were craving Indian food after work, so we stopped by for dinner. We ordered the garlic naan, goat cheese naan, channa masala and saag gosht. Everything was delicious! We ordered the channa masala "medium" spicy and it had a good kick to it. 

The staff was very kind and polite - overall, a great experience.
author: Alyssa W.

description: While i like the food here, the service sucks beyond comprehension. This place should invest in hiring customer friendly staff.
author: Madhweep L.

description:
Ordered delivery on a Sunday night.   Food came in about 45 minutes, utterly devoid of heat and flavor.

The lamb vindaloo (requested medium-hot) reminded me of a bland american stew (i.e. meat + plain boiled potatoes). The sauce was oddly sweet (did they add sugar?).  The saag paneer (requested medium-hot) was barely passable.
 
To top it off, the rice was closer to uncle bens then basmati.  How can an Indian Restaurant fail at making rice?
author: Isaac L.

description:
Passed by this place a couple of times, and thought "Why not? Indian food sounds good right about now." 

Stopped by here with a few coworkers and ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala (CTM), Tandoori Chicken, one more chicken entree, and some Garlic Gnaan.

All of the chicken dishes were tender and juicy. I got the CTM and fell in love with the sauce it came in - a blend of herbs and spices with subtle kick and when dipped with the garlic gnaan is amazing.

Service here was great, checking up on us every now and then, and refilling our water as needed from the subtly spicy dishes.

To top it all off, the manager I believe came over and offered us free ice cream to cool off our taste buds. We were given mango and coconut pineapple ice cream which was a perfect way to end the meal. I normally hate coconut, but this coconut pineapple ice cream is the truth.

Also, if you check in, you can get 50% off your second entree after 3PM which we received as well. They also have specials for lunch/dinner.

Will stop by again sometime!
author: Johnny L.

description: An excellent place to sit down and take a break from your day. The food is superb, very fresh and full of flavor. I often get the buffet which is an excellent option if you're undecided on what to order on the menu. The atmosphere is excellent. Kitchen is super clean, as well as the ding area. The location is perfect for the SOMA crowd. Bathrooms are also clean and tidy. And the service is excellent. I always look forward to eating here when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Faldo R.

description: Really great food, service was iffy. We had to ask for sauces and water and whatnot, but the food was delicious and made up for it. Definitely recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Aloo Gobi!
