author: Audrey H.

description:
I've tried a couple of dishes from these folks and I find myself wholeheartedly unimpressed. The biggest issue with their food is the blend of spices; throwing a ton of turmeric into a dish does not make it 'Indian food.' The best Indian foods are made from a blend of spices that are rarely used in Western cuisine and impart a wonderful blend of flavors to the tongue. Instead I found myself tasting turmeric over and over in each of the dishes I tried - biryani, tikka masala and the channa masala.

Add in the unimpressive price point and some serious price gouging for the food accoutrements and you end up with a place I will not be returning to. After all, who charges $3 for a small container of raita or $5 for a piece of naan?!? I get that the SF price point will always lean on the absurd, but those prices are simply a naked cash grab. If you are on the look out for Indian food you can definitely do better on both price and quality; finding a place that beats here on one of those facets is easier than toasting bread.
author: Balaji V.

description:
Our first Indian food experience after moving from California. It was good. Nice ambience, buzzing place. Service was very slow, food was tasty and on the lighter side. Didn't feel heavy afterwards. 

They offer a membership program as well. Food was a little bit on pricy side.
author: Madhuri G.

description:
Having been to many an Indian restaurant, I expected a great deal from this place, especially since it has four stars on Yelp. I found North India to be slightly overrated as the food was poor to average quality. I came around 7:30 pm with 5 friends, and the place was reasonably full. We ordered the paneer makhani, the vegetable jalfrezi, and the chicken tikka masala. I am vegetarian, so I stuck to the paneer and the jalfrezi. The paneer dish was just passable (most paneer dishes are). The portion was a little on the small side, and the gravy that constituted much of the dish lacked depth of flavor. The jalfrezi was truly miserable--it was just a bunch of mixed vegetables that were cut too large and didn't taste very good/fresh. We ordered garlic naan on the side, which was below average. It looked a lot like garlic bread in that the naan was covered in yellow in the center part of the bread slice. 

Service was decent. Overall, I think North India benefits greatly from its location in the Financial District and does not serve food worth a 4 star rating.
author: Vishnu R.

description: I was in a rush to the airport when I visited this restaurant. They left me a good impression. Will visit again and maybe update my review to 5-star next time.
author: Yow-Bang W.

description: Ordered here for delivery several times.  The food is not greasy and very delicious.   We ordered chicken tikka, lamb Kebabs pakora and the spinach and potatoes dish. Everything was so yummy. Delivery is on time.   This is our favorite Indian food restaurants
author: Marie Erika E.

description: The naan was perfect and the chicken korma was incredible. Fish masala was out of this world. Not enough good things to say about this place. Wasn't pricey and ambiance was great. Definitely will be back.
author: Phil I.

description: Nice food and service. We ordered Murgh Makhani and Lamb Korma, and it's creamy and really good. The Nan is a little crispy on the edge and just perfect. I will come here again.
author: Wanting L.

description:
Excellent customer service and great food.  

A couple friends and I were hungry, ordered thru Eat24 very late in the evening.  When checking out we didn't confirm the correct delivery address and it defaulted to a previous address.  

The folks at North India took our correct address over the phone after already having taken it to the wrong place and delivered it to us out on the completely other side of town.  I want to give a huge thank you to the driver.  It was a crazy distance to drive and it was greatly appreciated.

Thanks North India Restaurant.  You've made a customer for life!!!
author: Tanner O.

description: My new favorite Indian Restaurant in the neighborhood!  I loved the Chicken and the Lamb Vindaloo along with the ambiance and the Indian music.  Excellent service by Kuldeet.
author: Nikki D.

description: Our favorite spot close to home! It's typically pretty quiet with no wait. Great ambiance- candles, roses at each setting, and the best music. The food is good- I always order mild though because I'm sensitive to spicy foods. Chicken Korma is my go to with garlic naan. The prices are not bad - around $15 for dinner. Great wait staff- friendly and attentive. Complimentary chai tea for regulars. :)
author: Kailene C.

description:
Service: called at 10pm Saturday to make sure how long they are open and when is the last call? Man on the phone was very rude and said, "come. Is up to you." Well wife and I went there. We were the only customers. From guy at front desk to servers (except a young guy that serves plates and water) all are rude and have no smile on their faces. May be because its 10pm - well than don't keep longer hours than you have to or greet with a warm welcome and not lamented faces.

Food: food quality is 2.5/5 - average. Yes, i do mean it as a person of indian origin who has not eaten indian food for the first time. Quantities are large but quality is average.

Asked to have rice and naan packed as one of my sons did not eat there and we knew he would eat a bit later. Got all packed together (yes naan slapped on top of rice). I have never seen anything like that before. I guess they were just trying to save money by putting all unpacked foods in one container. Awesome job.

Price: about the same as other indian restaurants. 

Overall: 2 out of 5 stars

Will I return again: absolutely NOT.

Reasons: rude staff, no warm welcome, sad to see customers come at 10pm when claiming to be open till 12am. Food is average and sloppy job packing the left overs. 

PS: thank you that server who gave us water and plates as you were the only one that kept a good smile on and thanked us for being there.

PSS: find a different place to eat, yelpers.
author: Puja H.

description: Was tasty nom.  Food was on time; no mistakes; portions were good sized for SF.  Will order again.
author: John H.

description: This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants. They have great food that's reasonably priced and friendly service. They often give me freebies at the end of my meal, which is just the cherry on top.
author: Bhumika A.

description: Food is delicious, our wait service was beyond phenomenal, and the mango lassis were delicious! (Tart, which was surprising, but very good nonetheless). They made sure we were taken care of and were very attentive but not overly so. Definitely great for a relaxing dinner!
author: Yuki G.

description: Amazing. We get Indian food everywhere we go, it's kind of an obsession, and this is one of my new favorites. Exceptionally delicious, especially for the price. We will be back next time we're in SF!!
author: Wes D.

description: Really fantastic dessert (pineapple ice cream was doooopppe)  and chai was great.  Great servers here and overall good hosts, quick to clean and bring out food.  Food was great all around.  Accommodating to our food wants, asked to get shrimp with my favorite curry and they happily made it, and it was great! Came with my whole family and was seated quickly and taken care of.  Prices were great especially in SF. Do it!
author: CJ K.

description: Probably my 50th time here! This is my go-to place for some yummy Indian food! I probably order take out once a week.. Highly recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Garlic Naan. Some of the best I've ever had.
author: Ashley A.

description:
FYI: The decent reviews are probably for the food - not for the customer service. If you have a lot of time.. like a lot of time.. and don't want to engage in conversation with the wait staff, give this place a try. 

I was led to this place after doing some yelp search and was super disappointed. 

Ambiance: Not bad. Dimly lit, one long stem rose and small candle on the table, cushions for the wall seating. As soon as you walk it, you get hit with the smell of fish..... o_o I don't like fishy smell but hey, maybe you do. 

Cleanliness: Didn't feel too gross but I wouldn't say it's the cleanest place I've dined at. 

Food:  

Veggie samoas - 2 for $4.95. They're a little smaller than tennis balls. You can  taste the different spices but it wasn't freshly made. I could definitely tell they were pre-made a while ago - the fried-ness wasn't fresh. 

Chicken Tikka Masala - not bad but very creamy. Got it with mild spiciness but didn't have a hint of spiciness. 

Chicken Vindaloo - Description said it was spicy but wasn't spicy at all. This was ok but I preferred the tikka masala. 

Garlic Naan: Got two large pieces - put them together and you have a sheet of standard printer paper. Both were smothered with butter and cilantro. Kinda tasted like they've been out for a while too. 

Pualo - basmati rice with peas. Maybe 5 peas? I'm pretty sure the peas are there to add some color. Rice was out for a while - I eat and cook rice quite often and know what old rice tastes like. Rice was kinda hard bc it was a bit dry. Ew. 

Customer service - SUCKED. Made the entire dining experience HORRIBLE. Walked in and no one acknowledges us. Restaurant is maybe 35% full so not sure what the delay was. Stood around for about 5mins and the worker who delivered the food sat us down at a corner table. Sat down, looked at the menu, hung out for 10 minutes... and the water boy came to fill our water cups. Drank some water, sat some more, stared into space, thought about pizza, people watched through the window as the workers just walked right by.. Mind you, there was one table next to us but they had already gotten the check so in our area, we're really the only 'active' customer. Finally asked the water boy if he can take our order. He pointed to a man wearing all white. The man wearing all white came and took our order. No hello, no greeting, no smile.. fine, maybe he's having a bad day. Veggie samoas came out in literally a minute. I was surprised but go figure- they were pre-made. Tikka masala, vindaloo, rice, and naan came out in 5 mins. One plus is the food comes out really fast. I'm used to my waiter coming around and asking how everything is. Didn't get that from the man dressed in white but whatever. Fortunately, everything was fine. Towards the end of our meal, another couple was sat right next to us. The man dressed in white came right away, greeted them with smile, made small talk. Their food also came out fast and though we ordered the same rice, theirs were double the size of ours. The man dressed in white even asked them how everything was as soon as their food came out. What's up with that? Anyways, finished eating and again, waiting around. No one came around so my friend and I tried to figure out the organizational structure of the staff. Man dress in white is clearly someone in charge. He's the only one that really 'interacts' with the customers. There is one guy who always delivers the food from the kitchen. There's another guy who is in charge of filling the water cups. Let me tell you - this guy takes his job VERY seriously. I take a sip and he's right there waiting to fill my cup. There's another guy who is mainly responsible for cleaning the tables and setting them up. They're all very hard workers. Unfortunately, the laziest one is the one who interacts with the customers. After figuring out all of this, we waived down the water boy to get the check. The man dressed in white came and I flashed my coupon from yelp (check-in and you get 50% off a second entree after 3pm). H came back with the check and we were thankfully out of there. 

I think we spent more time waiting for the staff than eating. Wouldn't ever come here again. Food was alright but oh man, the customer service was non-existent. It doesn't hurt to smile, ya know.
author: Esther C.

description: After a long day in San Francisco, my husband and I were looking for a quick food delivery. We were pleasantly surprised with the speediness of North India Restaurant. The food was delivered hot and delicious (chicken tikka masala.) They threw in extra naan and dessert. Their garlic naan was delicious. We will certainly order again next time we are visiting San Francisco!
author: Susan A.

description: This place has great food and great service! Cooldeep is very attentive and the food had a lot of flavor. The chicken tikka masala is very spicy, and goes well with the naan bread!
author: Victor M.

description: We had he lunch buffet for $13. Food was a great value, the chicken tikka equivalent was delicious, great naan, tandoori chicken and raita sauce. The saag paneer I found dulk and didnt like but my husband liked it. Food could be warmer. The service was aloof to put it mildly. No smiles, had to ask extra for menu and track down to ask for coffee. Much later very weak coffee arrived and waiter dropped sugar down on the table causing spoon to catapult out. No reaction from him, no eye contact, turned then walked away.
author: Ingrid L.

description: I've tried Indian food in many large cities, however, this is hands down the best. I had the Tandoori chicken kebabs which were juicy and full of flavor. My husband had the chicken tikka masala and we shared both. The flavor on his was perfect and just enough spice. We also had the garlic naan which was excellent! Perfectly cooked and just the right amount of garlic. This place is a must.
author: Brittany N.

description: This is seriously my favorite Indian restaurant. My fiancé and I love coming here because the service is always so great, the restaurant isn't too loud or crowded, and the food is so flavorful and delicious. Kuldeep (our server) always takes good care of us :)
author: Grace K.

description: Much better than the Indian places around the area - had the dal ghost and biryani, both solid.
author: Sahil J.

description: This place was very tasty and delicious. I loved the dessert even though I was very full of mystery lamb dish.
author: Jonathan A.

description: Delicious lunch buffet - prices have gone up recently- $13 or $14 a person but there's a lot of variety and the food always tastes delicious. Nice to have an option near the fidi when you have that Indian food craving. They also offer a to go option in the alley that also looks good too.
author: Leily P.

description: Had the take out from here - reasonable prices and incredibly friendly staff. Nice spot to stop in to in FiDi.
author: Mac C.

description:
Good food!
I ordered samosas they were crispy.Customer service was good but food took longer than usual time in another indian restaurant.
author: Aj K.

description:
Meh. If you were looking for a one-word review that about sums it up.

It boasts an attractive and impressive venue along with your complete set of water boys and pre-bussers...too bad that illusion of elegance is shattered by the blaring baseball games being played on the television. Like seriously a restaurant with roses on every table is obviously trying to set the mood and of course nothing gets hearts throbbing over dinner like the Giants if you're into that sort of thing.

The food? B-. Nothing at all spectacular and the same stuff I could find at any of the other local clichéd Indian-named restaurants. And sour, jaw-locking mango lassi? That's a crime.

We were checked on very promptly...after we had already finished our meal. I'm sorry if we interrupted your game, employees! Also, when you have to flag down the guy sweeping floors to get your check, it's pretty much game over.

If you're in the mood for okay Indian food but don't want to shell out for an Uber to a place that's actually less talk more walk, this is the place for you.
author: Destini M.

description:
Less variety! Only 1 appetizer, 1 sweet dish. They don't even serve bread basket on the table. They just have plain naan. I asked for plain roti and he said no. 

Food quality was good. Giving two stars for that. 

We ordered samosa on the side and it was full of oil. 

Won't come back again.
author: Mehul M.

description: Everything was delicious. The chicken tandoori was so tender and juicy, while keeping a great char. We also got the chicken saag and an eggplant dish. Fabulous! If you're looking for a restaurant open late in the financial district, which also has a nice ambiance, this is it.
author: Hope M.

description: Surely not as good as the first time I went. Food was not piping hot and I was one of the 1st to arrive for the buffet. Also, it was very standard tasting. The chicken had very little taste and much of the selection was quite spicy (probably to limit one from going back or to drink more water). The service was lousy too. I was alone, and he tried to sit me at the bar when there was ample seating. I declined, so he gave me a table with a chair facing a wall. I declined that too and he was pretty upset. He snatched the other place setting and took off. All I could think of is Whateeeever! You just lost your tip. I went up just twice since I wasn't wild about the food. Normally, at a buffet I will try to get my money's worth. Maybe bad food was part of their tactic.
author: S. G.

description: Not only did this place provide incredible service but the food was DELICIOUS! We got two vegetarian dishes and one chicken dish paired with naan and rice (on the house). We loved it so much we topped it off with a tapioca type desert. Would come here again for sure! Great staff, great atmosphere and great food!
author: Adriana W.

description: I have never been to the restaurant in person.  I always order delivery.  There is a $25 minimum requirement for free delivery.  I live in the same area and their delivery has always been very fast, no matter if I placed an order during busy dinner time.  I love their food.  If you enjoy really hot and spicy food, this place can satisfy your taste bud.  Most places I have been to, no matter what cuisine, when they say "hot", it is usually not spicy enough for me.  I always ask for extra hot when I place online order, the dishes are spicy at the right level for me.  Combine with a warm naan, it is perfect for a rainy day.  I like all the vegetarian dishes that I have tried so far.  The delivery guy to my building is always with a smile. It just lightens up my day when I am tired and hungry after work.
author: Jiayin L.

description: Food was just ok. Rice didn't come with the vindaloo, was an extra charge, which is odd and annoying.
author: Mike M.

description:
Good food. Great service! 

Butter chicken -4/5
Chicken saag -4/5
Rohan josh -4/5

Chilli naan -5/5
Garlic naan -5/5
Cheese naan -5/5
author: Nishant D.

description:
Best Indian restaurant in San Francisco.....
The food was delicious everything thing was very good really loved the food ...Bombay chicken was good.. They gave a free gulab Jamun..
author: Guru S.

description:
Look no further for wholesome and comfortable indian food. This is the place to be!

After reading few good reviews on yelp, a friend and I tried this place out yesterday. We got to the restaurant by 12 40 and were already waiting behind 10 people.  But then, it was worth the time and value for money , and a spread of around 18 different varieties to choose from for around 12 bucks.

We had ordered an Aloo Paratha and a goat cheese naan with Cholay and a Lassi to go with. The Aloo Paratha was very nicely done! The stuffing was so filling and just the right amount spicy. The vegetable pickle that it is served along with it is also quite good. The goat cheese naan was decent in its own way. The cholay was fabulous. And the Lassi to top it off was just wonderful. Not very chilled, not very sweet, but it just ticks all the right boxes.

Cheers!
author: John W.

description: Noticed the restaurant near the hotel, being Indians we thought we would check the food out, did a take-out and was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food, we ordered a chicken tikka, paneer makhani, chicken curry and naan, the food was authentic enough especially the naan, we were also impressed with service, the staff were very friendly and helpful and more than happy to indulge in our conversation, would certainly recommend the place to anyone around downtown San Francisco
author: Errol G.

description:
I went to North India Restaurant with some friends, partially because the wait at the place across the street was too long, but we left feeling very happy that we went. We were greeted at the door by a server, and entered into a well-decorated space, complete with a fresh rose on each table. There was nice Indian music playing in the background, and it was the perfect volume, decently loud, but still quiet enough to carry on a conversation. 

Service was very prompt and our drink and appetizer order was taken as soon as we appeared ready. We ordered a sweet lassi, a chai, samosas, and fish tikka, all of which were very tasty. I love how they served the accompanying samosa chutneys in miniature pitchers; this made them very easy to share and enjoy between three people. The fish tikka was unusual because it was fried, but it was well-seasoned. My chai was sweetened perhaps a bit too much, but the milkiness was lovely.

For our entrees, we ordered navratan korma, lamb jalfrezi, dal, and garlic naan. The food came out fairly quickly after we finished our appetizer, and I appreciated that they took care to space the two courses. The presentation of the food was appetizing as well, and each dish had a sprinkle of garnish on top. The navratan korma had a pleasing gravy, with slivered nuts and an assortment of veggies. The creaminess was just right. We asked for medium spicy, but in the future I would probably request the dish to be hotter, as the gravy was still fairly mild.  While the lamb jalfrezi had a delicious sauce (similar to rogan gosht), the meat was served a bit too chewy for my taste. The dal was flavored with generous amounts of ginger, onions, and garlic, and was our favorite of the dishes that we ordered.

Throughout the meal, the service was very attentive, so much so that I must have drank ten glasses of water! The server also checked on us to inquire how we were enjoying our meal and to ask if we needed any other items. When we were ready to leave, they brought us the check along with three (free) gulab jamun. So tasty! The gulab jamun were bite-sized, cardamon scented, and served piping hot. 

I would definitely return to North Indian restaurant to try out other items and to take in the ambience.
author: Mars W.

description:
5 stars in San Francisco because it is hard to find good Indian food in SF and the lunch buffet is great for downtown SF. Very convenient.
3 stars compared to NYC but good SF option
author: EN K.

description: First time here visiting this restaurant and the food was amazing! Very authentic North Indian food. Highly recommend this place! Service was great as well!
author: Jessie G.

description:
Indian restaurant with white table cloth, great for a candle light dinner. 

This place is almost 100% Gluten-Free (only the Samosa can't be made as Gluten-Free). 
Great service, big portions, good value. 

We will certainly go back.
author: Thomas J.

description: We had the lamb korma and the paneer makhani with the naan sample basket. Loved the garlic naan and enjoyed both of the curries. We got the korma mild and it still had a tiny bit of spice which was perfect. The service was good and it got busier around 7ish. Oh yea, the chai is yummy.
author: starrynight c.

description:
We were searching for a restaurant nearby the club we came to SF for, n our friend just pointed out to this place...... N it was worth every penny....

Great food.. we ordered Punjabi fish, Jhinga (Prawn) Masala, Chicken hyderabadi n Garlic Naan... Each dish had a wonderful, fresh n distinct taste... Naan was soft and best I've had so far... 

Great Ambiance, music was not too loud... 

Food was great but the service was brilliant... the staff was quick to take our order, very courteous... We ordered beer n we were talking among ourselves about sharing one glass... Our waiter bought 2 separate glasses almost full n they charged us for just 1... We got complimentary dessert... coconut pineapple icecream... it was yumm... 

Come for the food, return for the service... Its impeccable... :)
author: Aachhari H.

description: Great food and great sevice. Really authentic experience in the middle of the city. Ordered the meat platter which was delicious but the chunks of chicken might have been too large because some peices were undercooked. Chicken tikka masala is my personal favorite and didn't disappoint. Calamari curry was the only big miss for us.
author: K C.

description: Got the chicken tikka masala and aloo gobi? The tikka masala wasn't creamy enough, but the aloo gobi was good! They gave us samosas and dessert on the house, which was really nice! The naan was good (garlic and plain). Was good but overall nothing amazing.
author: Jane C.

description: Nice indian food. Staff is very friendly. Do try out if you like Indian food. The food is authentic and the ambience is good with nice indian music playing in the background.
author: Pavan M.

description: Lunch buffet is a great deal at $10 buckaroos. Lots of variety. Cool ambiance. Lots of South Asian clientele. Food was pretty good, but great for the price.
author: Andrew K.

description: Chk biriyani very good and was excllent  chicken tika massla my  favourite  good spices we are visiting here out of country very welcome place and very high ceiling and price is very good
author: Abdullah A.

description:
Awesome buffet.  Loved the atmosphere.   I went here with my co-workers for the lunch buffet just before it got crazy. 

It was the first time I had Indian food in the city and it was a great first experience. We had these fried pieces of vegetables and fish which had green spicy sauce and a sweet sauce which went perfect with it. The tandoori chicken was da bomb!!! Fresh, soft, and well spiced! 

Definitely coming back to this spot.  Holla. #bestbelieve
author: Marvin D.

description: Excellent service. Tried Chicken masala and nan. Great taste.
author: Raja T.

description:
Clean, nice ambiance with friendly staff. Food was good, but not outstanding. I ordered medium spicy for my dish, which seemed pretty mild compared to other restaurants I've visited in the past. I was also a bit annoyed that there was an additional charge for rice unlike most places. 

My experience was not ideal, because there was a really loud, drunk guest right next to my table. I would've appreciated if the staff had the courtesy to isolate the rude guest, esp considering other guests kept glancing over as well. Also, I noted that the waiter had just served a bottle of wine shortly after I was seated. As restaurant staff usually go through alcohol service training - I feel that the staff should've refused service.

Overall, I'm not sure I'd be returning anytime soon - I'd suggest checking out other places in town.
author: Helen H.

description:
Love this place...great service and hospitality. Food is delicious in particular the Dallas makhani and malai kofta 

Great to order home as well as eat there!

Love it :)
author: Shikha P.

description:
Friend recommended this place and it turned out to be a great choice. Amazingly convenient location on the edge of SOMA and FiDi so easy access to Bart as well as a ton of bars nearby for after an amazing dinner.

We got the cheese pakora, lamb korma, chicken tikki masala, garlic naan, and jasmine rice and it all turned out amazing with huge portions (taking food home).
author: Emre G.

description: We're in from out of town and wanted some inexpensive Indian food. This place was super close to our hotel so we gave it a try and we were happy we did! It was open late, which was good for us because most places were closed at 9:00. All the dishes were fabulous and at a good price! We had the saag paneer, makhani paneer, chicken tika masala, and the navratan korma. They had lots of vegetarian options too! I would definitely recommend this restaurant, but be advised: rice is extra.
author: CJ W.

description: I think this place does a pretty decent job of having good service and a good ambiance for a financial district joint. Food taste did not blow me away though, which is the most important thing for me when getting Indian food. I'd be the biggest fan if a place like this in this location gets the same taste as what you get around the Jones / tenderloin desi restaurants.
author: Ali H.

description: Great food, super reasonable prices and even better service!! The manager treats us well every time we come in.
author: Mike A.

description: Best Indian food in SF. The quality of the meat is better than any other Indian food spots in town; very tender. The flavor of all the dishes are superb. I specifically love the chicken tikka masala and the chicken korma. Delish! The lamb biryani is excellent as well. Fast and hot delivery!
author: Brooke S.

description:
While the city is blooming with Indian food, this place definitely contributes to bringing down the average on the quality of Indian food offered in the financial district.
1) the setup is way too cliched and of course cramped.
2) the servers seemed totally unenthusiastic and rather bored to be there.
3) the food definitely was sub par, uncooked, not properly spiced. The buffet was not at all upto the mark. Majority of the dishes had less salt in them.
4) the restaurant is definitely over priced.


Reduced the rating to 1 star as the food have me a serious tummy upset. Beware!
Long way to go for this restaurant to get into good books.
author: KC L.

description:
Good food. Tried chicken tika masala and saag
They have good soft naans and decent sitting 

Mostly crowded in lunch time
author: deepa s.

description: The Zagat award in front of "North India" caught our interest. We went to try their $11.99 Lunch Buffet and were very satisfied with good varieties and the decadent taste of food here. The green sauce on the Buffet table is really hot but it perks up the flavor of the food with good kick!  The ambience is modern, clean with nice natural lighting. Service is great. Love the Masala Chai (Indian tea) which is so aromatic and not so sweet. The Kheer dessert is the well-adjust to the modern palette as it is not sweet like other Indian desserts I've tried. A relax and enjoyable time in North India. Great value for money!
author: Jintana C.

description:
Finally, amazing Indian delivery!! 

Firstly, the delivery guy was ridiculously friendly and on time (even though my home address is difficult to find). And secondly- the food is dank. Chili naan, paneer tiki korma, aloo palak and Punjabi stir fry- all perfect. I've found my new Indian restaurant- if you order from here you won't be disappointed!
author: Katherine M.

description:
The most memorable thing about this place is that is has the most boring name of any restaurant in SF. Not some cliche like 'taj palace' , just 'north india restaurant.

And like you would expect, the food is reliable but not memorable. Not a ton of other good Indian options nearby IMO so good if you work in the area.
author: Ash S.

description: Amazing--food is stellar, price is right, can accommodate very large groups as well as couples. Lunch buffets are definitely a deal and so are dinners. Great for special occasions. The only con would be quite small portions for males, but pretty common for SF. Can't recommend more.
author: Steve L.

description: My husband and I were really looking forward to eating Indian food. North India did not disappoint, we had the chicken korma and calamari curry, it was awesome!! If you are in San Francisco I definitely recommend stopping by. Also the samosas were so good we wanted seconds. Thank you for the awesome service! If I'm in SF again, I will make sure to come back.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Costliest beer of my life.. $100
Since no one was interested in serving food, we never got a chance to try it, so no comments on their food quality. I guess the management ate it all so they were figting in the back for who get to use the restroom first.

Anyways, after waiting for about 45 mins we wish to speak to the manager (who never showed up). Might be still using the restroom. 10 mins later we decided to call quit and not wait further. So I walked up to the manager (who by that time was done with his business in restroom) and ask for the check. 
To my surprise, there were no aplogies and the check was for $100. Wow!! This is the costliest beer of my life $100 + 15% tip (which I added because of a good habit. I regret it later though..:))

Worst restaurant at such a good location. They should be ashamed but I saw they were not. It was a very frustrating and disgusting experience. A NO NO NEVER for this place even if this is the last place on the face of this planet. 

There are far better restaurants around.
author: Ankur S.

description: Amazing Indian in San Francisco! First time here but we will be back. Kuldeep was an amazing, and patient server. Food was incredible and the service was top notch and incredible attentive. Couldn't recommend it more!!
author: Greg C.

description: A great lunch buffet with high quality food for a good price. Nice vegetarian dishes. The staff is super friendly and the service is speedy. I eat here all the time - it's one of the better Indian food options in the area.
author: Darius F.

description: We ordered two main entree dishes and they both tasted the same. Nothing special. I wouldn't go back. Dosa up on Filmore is much better.
author: Gulshan L.

description:
Haven't been to the restaurant, but just got delivery food from them via GrubHub.

Very happy with the food.  

Had tandoori chicken, lamb vindaloo, naan, papadums, raita, and rice.  The chicken was great... moist... with a nice char on the outside... the vindaloo had an appropriate amount of heat, and all of the side stuff like mint chutney and pickled onions were done very well.

Good stuff.  Delivered on time.  Very happy with everything I got.
author: Mark B.

description: Can't tell u about the food because when they brought the plates out THEY WERE DIRTY!!!  I was done after that! And not not only were our plates dirty but they also served dirty plates to the couple sitting next to us!!
author: Taylor M.

description:
The office crew decided to check out the buffet here when we couldn't get a table at our usual Indian place. They were only slightly less packed, and were quick to accommodate us.

Unfortunately, the food--aside from the saag paneer--was bland. Which is not a word you normally associate with this cuisine.
author: Brian W.

description: Group of 40. Limited budget. Norman worked with us to make our curry, naan, rice, AND drink dreams come true! We had a tall order and he made it work. It was all MMMMmms and Oooohs from the group. And demands for doggie bags. Everyone blissfully full and lightly tipsy. If you are in need of a delicious dinner or happy hour event locale. Look no further. Few others if any in this area can compete with North India's quality, service, and value.
author: Katie J.

description: Great, large buffet of dishes to choose from and nice staff. Good for a short or long business lunch with one colleague or a group of people. And good for a personal lunch too. Recommended!
author: Jenny F.

description: Great food, fun atmosphere, good music, and wonderful service. Thanks to Kuldeep and the team who served our table.  Friendly and efficient group!
author: Danielle M.

description: Everything was delicious! Would definitely come here again if we come back to San Francisco!
author: Mai N.

description: Very tasty dal entree... Exceptional. Naan was fresh and yummy and great service. Kid friendly!
author: Lech N.

description: Excellent saag paneer, and murgh makhani (butter chicken). Garlic naan is also quite tasty!
author: Amber Lee A.

description: Have you ever fallen in love? I did tonight. With the food, service, or waiter? Unclear. Food was delicious and arrived quickly. Service was on fleek as the people on Vine would say (do they still say that now?). Kuldeep was our waiter, and he made the experience an unforgettable one. PS. The restaurant is easily accessible for an East Bay pal.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Been here for the lunch buffet. Slightly smaller in size than other places but way more upscale. Was about $15. The curries were excellent. Rice and veges were also excellent.
author: Will D.

description:
This place is really pretty and I really love this place. My friends and me came here yesterday. The food is superb, the service is impeccable (mostly) and the ambiance and experience is just amazing, so get there well before you want to eat
   I love the food here . It is really good . I like the Chicken tikka masala , Tandoori Chicken , Fish pakora , Navratan Korma, Channa Masala
author: Hoang V.

description:
Went there for the first time Saturday Evening,everything is great, the ambiance is outstanding for this location, tried the mulliatawny soup for starters and sampled some of the other dishes including the chicken biryani, Punjabi fried rice and Aloo Gobi,I like my Indian Food Spicy, and was not disappointed. the Chai is really good as well. I am sure to return here with some friends and family so they can experiance 
this Gem of a restaurant
author: Winston P.

description:
Updated: 2/2/2015
Owner heard and brought a new chef it seems. Food is much much better now. The place is always crowded. Food is good now. 



======================
I tried lots of Indian places around this area like Amber, Little Delhi, Mehfil etc. This is the worst one. Surprisingly the service and ambiance was good. I can't imagine how any one can make that bad food.

Initially I thought its only me, but each one of us said the same thing. 

Save your money go somewhere else.

Note for North India Restaurant: Change your chef or you will lose your business sooner than you think..
author: Sunt G.

description:
Only a short walk away from Montgomery, I love coming here for dinner! AMAZING food, good portions, and the flavors are never underwhelming or overwhelming -- they're just right. 

Pretty popular joint for lunch, being in the FiDi and also offering a killer lunch buffet, but I've been here for special occassions as well! They've got great ambiance and the service is always great. 

HIGHLY recommend: Saag paneer and dal, in addition to their chicken tikka and tandoori!
author: Varsha R.

description: The Naan was outstanding.  Chicken Tikka masala was great. Ambience was wonderful. I will definitely return on our next SF adventure. Cooldeep did a great job, very attentive and made suggestions on what went well with what dishes.
author: Elias S.

description:
Just opened! The lunch buffet was listed as $10.99 when I got here. Still its a great lunch deal.

Looks like this place does get packed so be sure to get here a little earlier or later to avoid the lunch rush. 

They had a line right next to the buffet line for to go orders only. I guess they do lunch specials to go. Seems like a lot of people were lined up so it must be a good lunch deal. Must be sure to check this out next time.

Your best bet is the lunch buffet since you get a little bit of everything and its the best deal. 

Everything was delish! My fav were the basmati rice with the chicken curry, the coconut milk veggie curry, and the spinach paneer. Oh the fish pakora was really good as well. Also the naan was really fresh!

Be warned though, you will fall into a massive food coma -_- 

I'll be back for sure whenever I want to eat all the curries and want to immediately take a 4 hour nap :)
author: Christine W.

description: Lunch box is super cheap for SF but poor quality. Fatty chicken with bones in it.  My wife says you don't get prime chicken for $6 with rice but it was just poor quality. Raise the price and the quality in a city where rents are high they NYC and my assistant quit for a $165k job. Bubbles should at least have good food.  But maybe with all the layoffs coming people will go for the price. The price is good.
author: Matt H.

description: Great dinner and recommend to anyone in the area! Very good spice, fresh naan, and dessert. Most of all, very attentive and friendly staff!
author: Jackie M.

description: Great food and wonderful service! Got the chicken tikka Marsala, lamb vindaloo, garlic naan, and side of rice. Great atmosphere to bring a date.
author: Jeff T.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant. They have a nice candlelit atmosphere and really good food. I ordered the fish pakora as an appetizer and chai tea to drink. Both were very good. For the main dish I had lamb jalfrezi with garlic naan. The menu is pretty standard for Indian food in America but the service is excellent and the food is well prepared. I definitely recommend
author: Andrew L.

description: Came here for the firs time with my co workers and I must admit that it was a great experience. Not only are the staff hospitable, but very attentive to all your needs. Good variety of species of foods. The selection is not that wide, but it has the basic needs. I would definitely recommend to all my friends. If you're planning on eating buffet I suggest to come on a complete empty stomach.
author: Pj A.

description: We were craving Indian food this weekend and with our go to place closed on the day we wanted it, we decided to try North India.  We had seen it go up and was curious to how it was going to be.  We had a good meal here and enjoyed it.  It wasn't as flavorful as our normal spot but in a pinch I'd be back here again.
author: Blake B.

description:
Great food - great service!
Saag aloo is delicious 
Got free chai waiting for take out!
author: Eugene Y.

description: Try their buffet & you won't regret. Very reasonable price for the buffet spread. Decent Indian food. Located in the heart of sf downtown this place can get really crowded during weekday lunch hour. They also have a small back door carry out option - you get rice 2 curry for just 5 bucks.  Add a naan for a extra dollar.. Comes in handy when your workplace is around.
author: Madhusmita P.

description: The food here is great. I like the dinner here - lamb vindaloo and tandoori chicken are amazing!
author: Xiajie X.

description: I work for a delivery service (won't name) and when picking up a delivery from here the staff is very rude. When I state where I'm from and the customer's name the guy slapped the bag and said here and when I asked for napkins and utensils for the to-go order he said "what? what? napkins no it's extra" Wow I would think that it would be standard practice to give napkins and utensils for a to-go order and don't know what the guys problem is since delivery is helping with giving more business to them
author: Tamara K.

description:
AVOID THIS PLACE FOR DINNER!!
Came here once for lunch buffet, which was quite good, so assumed dinner would also be good and had 
yelp coupon (50% off 2nd entree). But the food was really mediocre, rather tasteless even though ordered medium spicey with very small portions. Couldn't believe they charged $6 for plain rice and very small chai with no free refill. (Didn't tell us 2nd SMALL cup was full price). Service was awful with a very rude and unattentive waiter. Don't recommend!!
author: Julie V.

description:
I must say, the staff is extremely friendly, and the food is pretty good. I typically get Chicken Tikka Masala, but I wanted to try something new so my friend and I shared the Bombay Chicken and Saag Gosht. It was good, but not nearly as spicy as I thought it was going to be. 

Overall, I thought the food was good but not 5 star worthy. I would give the customer service and environment a 5 star though. I loved that they played Indian music!
author: Evan S.

description: Great place for a Friday night wind down, food is delicious and the ambience is great. Fancy feeling restaurant at an affordable price. Take your date here for the candlelight and roses. Mango lassi is pretty bomb. Service is top notch and I left in a food coma.
author: Mary H.

description: Great food!! It was delish! Thanks so much for a great meal! I love the buffet! My sister said it was the best food she ever had! Great service!
author: Melissa M.

description: The food was average, nothing exceptional. The ambience was nice, but the service was very lukewarm. We ordered dal, rice, aloo-gobhi and Kashmiri biryani. The spice level was too high and unwarranted. We wanted the simple dishes for a reason, but they did not deliver.
author: Shravan B.

description: Came here on a Monday night and really enjoyed it!  Had Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tika Masala, Chicken Tandori.  Would come again!  Fast and friendly service and the naan was great.
author: Fast F.

description: The food is OK, but not great I ordered the Mutter Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masala, and Rogan Josh.  The meat is intermediate quality, and the sauces had good spice, but rather pasty.
author: Robin T.

description:
Very good ambience with excellent service
Especially Veg. biriyani was awsome. Must try
author: Sri R.

description: This was my first trip to this restaurant and the lunch buffet was great. The food was fresh and the buffet had a nice variety of dishes. I would recommend this to anyone looking for Indian food in the area!
author: Julia S.

description: This is one of my go to restaurants when I travel to San Francisco for work. It is consistently great, the food is very fresh, waitstaff is attentive and friendly. My favorites are the Chicken Korma, Garlic Naan & Samosas. All very tasty. You can't go wrong if you're looking for some yummy Indian.
author: Heather W.

description:
I was pretty disappointed by my experience. What was described as a salad came with no fresh vegetables. I requested broccoli and cauliflower in my vegetable curry and got nothing. And then the delivery guy showed up to a hotel with no plastic-ware or means by which to eat the food.

Might be better eating there, but delivery was poor. And to add insult to injury, the app makes you add tip before the meal is delivered.
author: Thomas M.

description: Amazing meal, amazing service. Cooldeep was a perfect gentleman and a perfect server, and has the coolest name EVER. The food is hands down the freshest and best Indian I have had in SF, and I've lived here all my life! Had lamb saag and chicken maduras, you won't regret it... go dere!
author: XTA s.

description:
We order lunch sometimes here, no experience with Indian food before, but now we love it! 
The food we tried :Chicken Tikka Masala,Chicken Saagwala -recommend, just make sure you choose how spicy you want your food.
Tandoori Chicken little dry, Calamari Biryani -big portion) Pulao- is just regular rice, you need to be ready for that. 
The food is fast delivered and is hot and clean, it means they have responsible drivers also.
author: Ana R.

description: The food was extremely tasteless,  very blant!! Nothing like indian cuisine!!  Huge dissappointment!!  Plus the service was poor!!
author: Avantika T.

description: The chicken tikka masala was bland, unfortunately -- the chicken hadn't absorbed any of the flavor of the sauce, suggesting very little time together during preparation.  We also had chana masala, which was fairly good.
author: Crista B.

description:
So. Bad.

We ordered delivery from here for some god awful reason. It took almost 2 hours. the food was not labeled (there were 8 different curries, why the fuck wouldn't you label?!) It tasted horrible. It was luke warm. 

Never. Again.
author: Allison L.

description:
Decent food. Nice atmosphere. Courteous service!

One of the few places that's open beyond the customary 3pm closing time!
author: Vighnesh R.

description:
Great new place in FiDi for an Indian buffet. Quite reasonable with their pricing. Quality was overall good, but time will tell. Hopefully other places in close vicinity will improve to match the quick service and food quality of this place.
I would give another star if they improved the selection of their vegetation fare.
author: Rohit N.

description: I eat here for lunch.  Service is prompt but not pushy. Food is, to my tastes, very good, with ample quantities for sharing. My co-diners were huge fans of the buffet. I enjoy the chicken saagwala. Great naan, good beers on tap.
author: Eric H.

description:
After having a great dinner here recently I decided to try the lunch buffet.  It was uninspired and had me looking around to see if I was in the same place.

Don't just phone lunch in - it could lead to other business...
author: George S.

description:
Pretty good food. Good service. We ordered paneer makhni and mushroom matar. Paneer was amazing !!!
Bread basket good and enough for two.
author: Kishy K.

description:
My coworkers and I were trying to find a new place to eat around FiDi, and this place was randomly chosen.  I checked it out on Yelp and thought: 4.5 stars, but only 3 reviews?! Certainly those must have been written by the restaurant owners and staff members!!"  Despite of my doubts inside, we went for it anyways...

Oh boy eggs on my face.  The place was actually very nicely decorated, very clean, and the food items were actually very tasty!  We came during lunch, and was surprised that it was a buffet style restaurant.  "Certainly buffets cannot be good!"  Eggs on my face again. It was actually VERY good.  Things were fresh (mostly), well prepared, and the naan bread was the bomb.  I actually ate FAR MORE than I should have eaten, but I regret nothing!

Pros:
* Great location
* Good ambiance
* Delicious food
* Fair price (for a FiDi spot)
* Good service

Cons:
* Super popular items run out too fast!!  Resupply, guys!
* Tub of ice cream left out in the open to melt into a puddle of yuck
* Horror stories from other Yelpers about the sanitary conditions


I'm definitely coming back again (I never even liked Indian food in the past!)...  I certainly hope that the disgusting stories about the kitchen are not the norm here.
author: James W.

description: Food was tasty (and spicy- beware) and the service was attentive. Their push for us to do a review was a bit overbearing though. We mentioned we were there to celebrate a birthday and they brought out ice cream with candles. Quite sweet. I'd go back.
author: Roia F.

description: Wonderful lunch and great cheap beers. Delicious food and chicken tikka is our favorite. The service was very attentive and kind, and food came out quickly as ordered. While we did the lunch menu, they also have the option for a fantastic lunch Buffett if you're feeling a bit hungrier. Enjoyed or visit and will certainly be back again - highly recommend. They do get busy for lunch so try to come earlier if you can!
author: Claire J.

description: I have ordered online and they didn't even provide utensils, napkin, etc... The menu does not specify that the food is not coming with rice. I've ordered two chicken tikka masala and it came with no rice or bread. Very poor experience ordering online.
author: Bobak S.

description: If you are famished, they have a wonder lunch buffet but I usually opt for the $5 box with my go to selection being the chicken tikka masala. It has never failed to satisfy my craving for Indian food. Their CTM has just the right amount of spice and is always bursting with flavor. But make sure you don't eat it all in one sitting or else you will be left feeling like you need a nap. Also, I am completely addicted to their chai which has a wonderful blend of cardamon and other spices.
author: Christine S.

description:
The food is good. But I waited for 1 hour. The waiters didn't even bother to check the kitchen. Just lie in front of you that it was coming. When I request to talk manager. They refused!! We literally got our food when we were standing up n leave.

Tip, Get to-go. Their service will make your night miserable.
author: Felix H.

description: Came in here for a lunch buffet on a Sunday. The host tried to seat us right next to the door for some reason. The food is mediocre and the servers are quite sullen. Didn't enjoy my experience and I won't be going back.
author: S C.

description:
Went today for a late lunch and had the buffet, which was pretty good. There was nothing stand out, but it was decent food - especially for the price. However the service was awful to the point of being laughable. We were told they were open still for lunch at 2pm and thought we were making it easy on them to just have the buffet. 

Then right after we sat down with our first plate, a waiter came over and told us they were shutting down the buffet and needed to get anything else we might want before they do. We didn't yet know if we wanted anything else, so took about 5 minutes to eat what we had in front of us and they came over again to tell us the buffet was shutting down - which was really annoying for a first experience. 

Also, numerous times we felt like the staff were hovering and trying to rush us out of there. We were literally there for a total of 20-25 minutes from start to finish. This was not a good place to try and have a lunch business meeting, not to mention I went there with an Indian VC who invests in restaurants and real estate. Kind of a bad person to piss off - he too was quite offended.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Needed a place to go for lunch during work that would be quick but quality.  Saw through the window that it was packed so walked in and hit the buffet.

Wow! I will be coming here for lunch every week now for sure, great service, food, and bang for your buck.
author: Paul S.

description: Although there was an initial confusion with grub hub, the concerned person reached out, corrected the order and as a token of service, provided some good extra food. Chicken tikka masala, saag paneer and lamb korma were quite good. Desserts taste great as well. For those who havent tried, try with Kingfisher - great addon with the food!
author: Kartheek S.

description: I've been here quite a few times, and the food is really good. Love their lamb rogan josh, chicken tikka, and saag paneer. The staff is amazing too. One time, I went here with a couple of friends, and they even added some free dessert as well. Even when I ordered food to go, they immediately served me a glass of water while I waited.
author: Katie W.

description: Cooldeep is a great waiter.  The food was great and so was the wine and indian beer. Had the chicken that started with a P. Yummmy. I'll be back and I love that they stay open till 11. Thank you!
author: chanen b.

description: Completely delicious!  Super wide array of North Indian food at reasonable prices. Especially for SF. Large selection of wine and some beers on tap. Lagunitas IPA happens to be one of them. A personally favorite. Staff was awesome, clean restaurant, and the music was spot on.  Highly recommend if you love North Indian cuisine.
author: Eddie S.

description: Reasonable prices for quality of food. Rice was kinda meh. Butter chicken and garlic naan was good. Service was good, except that they tried to take away our plates and clear us out even though the restaurant was not busy at all, and then took forever with the bill.
author: Angela B.

description:
Lunch buffet is great for the price, (like 9.95 i think).

Menu food is a step above the normal Indian delivery I get.
author: Leland G.

description: Came here on a slow Sunday.  The food was great but the service was pretty bad.  Nobody is minding your water.  Items were ordered, forgotten, but still charged.  It's a shame because I enjoyed the food, but when the wait staff expects 20% of your meal's cost but expends 0% effort in providing service it's impossible to take them seriously.  The manager was nice.
author: Jay S.

description:
I've never written a yelp review before. I'm writing this one because North India has the best and most friendly service in San Francisco. They are fast to bring you water, and very courteous. The food is amazing. Try the kebabs or the Half tandoori chicken. I always get teh tikka masala.
Enjoy!
author: Kieran O.

description: Food is amazing, very authentic and always fresh even late at night. The naan choices are great I recommend the garlic naan
author: Lucas T.

description: Amazing dinner and about the greatest staff possible.  My friends and I had a few drinks at 111 minna and decided to try somewhere new.  Best.  Choice.  Ever.
author: Timmy T.

description: I've been looking for an Indian restaurant in San Francisco and this place really hits the spot! Each time we've come the food has been delicious, staff is friendly, and food comes quick! We had the saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, and lamb biryani.  The spices all complement well, and it's a perfect amount of spice! This is now our go to spot for Indian food!
author: Nicole C.

description: Amazing food always even for lunch.  Known for their buffet line out the door for togo but nice to sit down and have a proper lunch if you have time.  The Chicken Tika Masala is consistently good.
author: Smorga L.

description: Delicious food, great service. Waiter was on point. Never an empty glass. Food came out fast. Def recommend!
author: Jason V.

description: This is my new favorite Indian restaurant! When I moved to the city I ate at several restaurants and always seemed to miss this one. I'm so glad I came here. The food is amazing. It's perfectly spiced and so yummy! I ordered the vegetable curry and some samosas and they were great. The service is impeccable. The wait staff is constantly going around to check on you and remove your plates and are always on top of refilling water. The ambiance is really nice. It's very romantic for a date or just a really nice dining experience. I will definitely be coming back to eat here and I can't wait to try other things on the menu!
author: Emmy M.

description: Best Indian food in SF! This is my go to place. I love the aloo mattar. The lamb korma = yum! The owners are attentive and super nice.
author: Ali M.

description: I believe these are the same owners of my beloved India Clay Oven in the Outer Richmond.  Wonderful buffet lunch with ALL my favorites.  Butter chicken, fish pakora, saag paneer (spinach), veggie korma.  YUM.  Can't decide if is a great thing that I discovered that this place is so close to my office, or that I'm totally screwed on my diet.
author: Denise M.

description: Fabulous!! A nice area, lovely restaurant, excellent service and the food was outstanding. Chicken tikka masala and lamb with raisins - very flavorful. Would definitely come back if we lived here!
author: Jenna M.

description: Good joint. Little rustic interior but still. Service is quick and very attentive. The masala is probably the best I've had. The medium spice level is still pretty noticeable.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Yummy food ,great service , everyone who works there has smile on there face and always welcoming ! This was my fifth visit and we enjoyed each one.
author: Kashish A.

description: Great place to get food out of the backdoor for lunch
author: Nick D.

description: Great food, service. My only complaint is that they don't have a full bar.
author: Lee R.

description:
The food was very tasty, chicken tikka masala is more authentic than most places and the garlic naan is super fresh. The coconut prawns is also really good. 

Overall great service, and ambience. And the food is tasty.
author: Craig A.

description:
After a delivery mishap, the owner of the restaurant provided me with an apology and free replacement food. He was helpful, and the food was delicious!

I appreciate this restaurant's quick resolve, and the professionalism of the owner. The great food was what made me want to leave a strong review for a great restaurant!
author: Mitch U.

description: Great indian food. I came with my friends and I loved it. I highly recommend. Go for it!
author: Mike B.

description: Really high quality Indian food at 12.95 a plate great deal. I had the chicken tikka kebab and I'm very picky about my food, it was spectacular. I would definitely suggest to come back. $20 for one person for lunch/dinner but it was very worth it. Great customer service and nice high end atmosphere and quiet inside. A+
author: Tori E.

description: I ordered the Tandoori Chicken, my boyfriend ordered the calamari, soup (he conveniently forgot the name), and the fish salad. Everything was fantastic. We will definitely be back!
author: Christen S.

description: The food was okay, but very poor service.  Rude waitstaff and the owner did nothing to correct the problem after being informed of the situation.
author: Joe R.

description:
I really like North India - the food, the music and the general ambiance is very ethnic. My majority experience with them has been around the lunch buffet time, and that's what this review is about.

My single biggest concern is their hygiene. From the plates to the silverware, everything feels like it's gone through a car wash, rather than a dish wash. You can pick up any plate or spoon, at random, and you'll, without fail, notice spit stains or chipped corners. Even the cola is flat, and perhaps out of a bottle that was opened in the previous century. That's the only piece that makes the experience unsavory.

I know this isn't a fine dining restaurant, as such, but I am surprised that they get by during the inspections. Don't get me wrong - it's not teeming with bacteria - and maybe I am being overly pedantic. But I'd pay you a dollar if you don't notice the stains on your cutlery or the paint off your plates.

Other than that, their lunch buffet is very generous and worth the money. The restaurant is packed to the brim between 1230 and 2 pm, so choose your entrance wisely.

I really wish they paid attention to hygiene. It's not a one off experience - it is a trend.
author: Adi M.

description: Went out with coworkers last night. Had great service and tasty food, but we have all had bad GI problems today.
author: M J.

description: This is a really good lunch spot in Fidi. The line gets long around noon so I suggest you come in at 11:30. They also have 12.99 lunch buffet. Super worth it! Their naan is so delicious!!
author: Claudene F.

description: We walked by this place and grabbed a $5 lunch box which included rice and one or two entree. We got a veggies dish and a chicken dish. Was pretty much amazing. One of the best Indian quick lunch.  The servers were very friendly as well... We will go back for a set down dinner.
author: Adelaide B.

description: Such amazing service, the owner was very sweet and welcoming. I was given complimentary ice cream to go and chai while I was waiting on my to go order!  Nice staff, great atmosphere! Will definitely be coming back
author: Seki S.

description: Came here for dinner on a Sunday night. SoMa tends to be dead on weekends, so glad this restaurant was open. Food was solid (tikka masala, Bombay chicken) really flavorful, especially if you like spicy food! Mild still has a good amount of heat. Service was good, nice ambiance too. Will definitely come back or check out their delivery options.
author: Ervin T.

description: We went for the Lunch Buffet on a weekend and the food was good. The Mutton Gravy and the Veg Gravy were very good. The Roti and snacks were also good, the other dishes were average. Overall we had a good lunch and will visit again if we are around this area. The ambience was ok, cleanliness was ok  and price was reasonable.
author: Sun J.

description: I ordered delivery. From the time my order was place to the time my food was in my hand it took just under an hour. The chicken tikka masala and the tandoori chicken (1/2 chicken) was excellent. I ordered spicy and it was just right. Both the garlic and chili naan was great tasting. It didn't leave too much of a garlic after taste in the mouth. No eating utensils included with the delivery. If I was at home ordering it would be no big issue but since I'm eating at work, a plastic fork, spoon, knife and some napkins would come handy. I would order from them again in the future and hopefully they include some eating utensils.
author: Rome C.

description:
Fresh food, natural ingredients, kind service, what more can you ask for? 

After asking questions about the menu and preparation, the chef made me a dish without charging me so I could learn more about the culture and the palette of India. 

The name may not stand out, but the service is the best in the city. Would gladly make a detour to spend time in this restaurant. 

Also, to compliment the quality of the ingredients, most Indian restaurants taste like de-thawed veggies and basic mixing. There is a complexity that should be noted in the colors they use for flavors and the produce is really something to remember. 

Stop here, tell your friends, come back for lunch and happy hour. 

This is the kind of service that makes me want to tip :)
author: Toni Lane C.

description:
Best Indian food in SF!

I moved from NY and miss good North Indian food. This is what gets me through.
author: Claire H.

description: Love this place! Great for lunch buffet, or a nice dinner. Great food, and nice staff. I always get the chicken Tikka and Naan.
author: Matty K.

description:
Great food and amazing service. I work two blocks away from this place and have lunch here very often! I generally look for three things when I rate a restaurant. Food, service and ambiance. The staff over here is very friendly and the food is delicious! 

Straight 5 star restaurant
author: Jay N.

description:
We ordered from Norman at North India for a large training lunch last week and everyone was impressed! The delivery came on time (two large trays of three different vegetarian dishes), two large trays of naan and two large trays of white rice. It was just barely enough to feed 140 but that's because a) we are a nonprofit and Norman was kind enough to work within our budget and b) the food was so good people probably got seconds ;)

The feedback I keep getting from staff is that they were very impressed by the quality of the food and that we should definitely order from here again. I agree!
author: Emily M.

description: Nice big open space with a pleasant atmosphere and modern Indian music.  The vegetable pakora was tasty and not too heavy, though a tad salty for me.  The spinach dal was spicy (at my request) with a rich flavor, and the onion kulcha was portably one of the better ones I've had.
author: Tom M.

description: This place is great! Nice ambience. Was craving Indian food and this place hit the spot with a good variety of vegetarian dishes.
author: Albert P.

description: They don't serve raita/ yogurt with biryani. Both lamb n chicken biryani do not taste authentic. It tastes like rice ball of spice with inadequate salt. They don't provide lime for taste during delivery.
author: Ayan C.

description: Came in on a Friday for an early dinner and enjoyed the tikka masala and lamb vindaloo! The naan was also great and had a nice flavor & texture. It was also HUGE! The mango lassi is also the perfect amount of sweet and was refreshing on a warm day in the city. The waiters are very friendly and courteous and treated us to complimentary rice pudding to top off our meal. :) Definitely coming back soon!
author: Natalie O.

description: I made an online order from North India Restaurant. Food was delivered on time and all my colleagues enjoyed the food. I'll definitely order from North India again.
author: Tural A.

description: Solid Indian place. Got the rogan josh and chicken tikka masala (really American I know). While not out of this world, it definitely filled my cravings for good Indian. I'm addition the ambiance is nice andservice is timely.
author: Fred W.

description:
Went for a quick dinner the other night. Started with Samosas which were very good-fresh and tasty, not too greasy

Went with the Rogan Josh (over lamb biryani). Added Keema Naan (stuffed with lamb) which was very good as well, along with plain yogurt. 

Skipped dessert as I was stuffed.
author: Chris W.

description: Really tasty buffet and a really nice spread!  All sorts of delicious Indian dishes for everyone.  And the naan was super fresh and tasty!  Definitely will be going back!
author: Raj G.

description: Love the ambience and the quality of food. I have tried a lot of indian restaurants in the city and this one ranks in the top. Service is the best !
author: Kishor K.

description: This is my go-to spot for Indian food. It's absolutely delicious. I'm not a big meat eater, but dipping naan in the chicken tikka masala sauce is amazing. I highly recommend the garlic naan (although all are tasty). Rice doesn't come with your meal, so don't forget to order a side of it!
author: Kristy A.

description: Great authentic North Indian food. Affordable price. Good location and quick service.
author: Ravee K.

description: Love the food! Great ambiance. We had the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, goat cheese naan, vegetable samosas, and rice. Very yummy.
author: Julianna M.

description: My first time eating at a Restaurant in San Francisco , and I'm glad me and my friends pick this place. Excellent service. Excellent food. Excellent Atmosphere ! Will be conning back soon !
author: Sharif H.

description: I was grateful to find this place open on New Year's Day. It was nice to find many families and groups celebrating new year. I was disappointed in the dahl soup. Too soggy and no flavor. Served in a chipped miniscule bowl. The chicken Heyderabadi was flavorful. Had to send it back to be reheated though. You could not go wrong with the while steamed rice. Service was friendly. I appreciated white cloth on the tables.
author: Ali S.

description: pretty bad service - the waiter just doesnt seem to be friendly or attentive and treated us in a rude way. food is not fresh at all and quite mediocre.
author: Shuting Z.

description:
Went there for dinner. A nice alternative to Amber and a fair bit more economical as well. A definite cut above Chaat Cafe, which is also in the same area.

We had the goat cheese and garlic naans, dal makhni and navratan korma. The Navratan korma was flavorful, the dal makhni was more black dal than makhni but still passable and the naans were delicious.  Gulab jamun and mango kulfi rounded off the meal. Would recommend!
author: Chetan G.

description: Really tasty.  Had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Saag Gosht, along with Garlic Naan.  The CTM was rich and flavorful, with a nice tomato and cream balance.  One of the better ones I've had.  The Saag Gosht I could eat all day - so comforting.  Service brisk and attentive.  Definitely going to be a go-to place.
author: Justin L.

description: Great lunch buffet, with tandoori chicken, goat and an awesome garlic naan. The mango lassi was also very good.
author: Grace I.

description: Good food. Onion kulcha is awesome. I tried Murgh masala, Paneer Kurma, kulfi and liked all of them. Though service is good but I didn't like server coming and asking again and again if we are done so that he can clean up. And, I had to call server twice to order additional bread and dessert!
author: Devesh N.

description: Convenient cozy spot near where I work. Friendly staff and food is decent. I'll definitely be back!
author: Roger H.

description: Really good North Indian food, I've had most of their dishes and all good! Their green chutney is my fave, love their sizzlers too!
author: Sapna S.

description: Great restaurant great food and great service! We celebrated our end of finals here at north india restaurant. The owner introduced to lots of delicious cuisines. It was our first indian meal and we really enjoyed all cuisines! We would definitely come visit again!!
author: Yen Yee P.

description: Great service, good food, satisfied customer. Chicken vindaloo with chicken biryani, will be coming back for me.
author: M P.

description: Went for dinner. Both dishes pretty mediocre - aloo ghobi and saag. Super small masala chai - full price for refill. Snooty, inattentive waiter. Water guy was awesome - about the only positive. Place was really crowded, but we couldn't understand why. I heard the lunch buffet is better. Definitely avoid for dinner.
author: Mark T.

description: the food and the service were great! the lamb curry &  chicken tikka masala were delicious. the naan was very fresh as well. the staff were very friendly and welcoming! I'd definitely come back again.
author: Amie R.

description:
I was in town for a conference and met up with 3 other friends to grab dinner. We originally wanted to go to another Indian restaurant but the wait was long and it was pricier. My friend, who is Indian and has tried several places in the city, suggested this place as a good alternative.

We must have been there on an off night. The service was terrible. We could not tell if they were short handed or lazy. The hostess/bartender/waiter did not check in on us ONCE during the hour we were there and he was rather rude...gave us attitude when we didn't want to order appetizers. We had to ask several people for a box for our leftovers before someone acknowledged us. Also at one point, it was someone's birthday and they brought out a cake for them which was nice but then they did something to the sound system to cause it to blare random music for several minutes. Everyone in the restaurant was confused, including some of the staff.

The food itself was quite nice. It's another situation where I would give at least 3/4 stars if not for the service. I docked some points because they charged $3 per person for a bowl of rice...I have never been to an Indian restaurant where this was the norm.
author: Michael N.

description: My go to place for affordable delicious Indian buffet! The staff are friendly and nice. Would recommend!
author: Ting T.

description: Great Place to have some very tasty Indian food. Excellent service and a nice selection on entree's. Convenient location and good prices! Highly recommend!
author: Robert L.

description: Fantastic Indian food. Balanced favors, very good naan and rice. Service is friendly and the place is very clean.
author: Andy C.

description: A very lovely ambiance and service. The food was delicious. We had the chicken tikka masala, which was very tender, with garlic naan and biryani. I will definitely come again when visiting SF again
author: Misty F.

description: Literally the best Indian food I have ever eaten!  We only make it to San Francisco once a year and It's a must that I eat at North India Restaurant while I am in the City.  Last year, I got it to go and took it back to my hotel room while my kids were at Outsidelands.  This year, I was lucky enough to get to sit down and enjoy dinning in with my 16 year old daughter.  My daughter is a picky eater but she said it smelled good and she would try it.  This was her first experience with Indian food and she LOVED it and is now hooked on Indian food.  The service is great, the food is excellent, the atmosphere is relaxing.  I would recommend this restaurant open a location in Irvine, CA.
author: Marne K.

description:
Came here one night while visiting for work. They had a good Yelp deal going on (buy one get one half off). We were very pleasantly surprised. We ordered aloo Gobi,  yogurt marinated kebob, and garlic naan. All were very delicious. They accidentally brought out a wrong dish earlier and was super mice about it. The real dish came out quickly and we got some extra rice and dessert because of the mix up. We had a great experience and would definitely come back
when we are back in the area.
author: Angela J.

description: This is comparatively new on the street but good indian buffet. They have takeout for $7 I guess for 2 curry n rice. Staff is friendly. Their buffet has generally same items repeated so you can't have buffet quite often.
author: Anurag M.

description: Exceptional customer service, lovely, warm and inviting decor, and the food authentic melt in your mouth deliciousness! Thank you Norm for the hospitality and for everyone in San Fran this place is a must!
author: Bel S.

description: The food was amazing and the service was is excellent. We had the chicken korma , lamb Briyani, Garlic naan and Tandoori. All of which exceeded our expectations . The Desserts good too . Thank , Kuldeep for great service .
author: Esther B.

description: In a city offering a lot of good choices for delicious Indian and Pakistani food, North India Restaurant is one of the very best.  The naan is perfect: not too stiff, baked to the right consistency.  Lovely!  Tandoori fare is mouth watering, melt in your mouth fantastic: chicken tikka kebab, prawns, fish, are full of flavor; spiciness at the right hotness, we chose "medium" and that is exactly what we got.  Samosas were great.  Someimes samosas can get soggy, not these.  Chai tea and sweet lassi were also right on point, tasty.  Delivery driver was courteous and friendly.  Fairly fast delivery for a dinner order.  All in all, quite pleased with North India Restaurant.
author: Alex C.

description:
Amazing chicken korma!

Staff was great and made sure we we're taken care of. 

Will be coming back next time I'm in SF and craving some good Indian.
author: Jason J.

description: I had lunch there a few days ago: they offer a buffet at lunchtime. The food was really good, the price was fair, and the waiters were friendly. On top of that, the buffet had a good variety of dishes: it included fish, vegetarian dishes, and different meats. The room was full but we did not have to wait long to get a table. This restaurant was quite a pleasant surprise!
author: Sebastien C.

description: Its really great for lunch. They have a buffet; when one of the dishes ran out they came to the table a bit later and brought a whole platter to our table specially. It was very filling and a decent selection.
author: Sofya T.

description: I'm here with my friends nearly every Friday evening. The food is great - our go to is chicken tikka masala and garlic naan, but everything that the group has tried has been excellent. The staff are very friendly and we love that they know exactly what we're going to order the moment we walk through the door. We'll be there again next Friday!
author: Nicola V.

description: Great food. Loved the chicken tikka masala. Fast and friendly service with great ambiance. I would come back again. Best part was the free ice cream at the end!
author: Henry L.

description: This food totally hit the spot! Delicious, well spiced (neither too hot not too mild) and deeply satisfying at the end of a long night out on the town. The service was fast and excellent. Had the lamb masala, naan, chicken masala, and several other dishes that I can't specifically recall other than I'm sitting back in my chair, eyes half mast, with a dozy smile on my face.
author: Chrissy L.

description: Great place.  Clean.  Friendly staff.  Not a full variety of Indian food as other buffet places, but it has enough for lunch. Reasonably priced and tasty food.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: 5 star for ambiance. 5 star for service. We had chicken tikka masala, with naan and rice. 4.5 stars for that. I had a Chardonnay, which was actually a bit crappy 2 stars for that.
