To make up for that, the waiter gave us a special dessert on the house. So another star for service. Walked out happy :)
author: Dulguun B.

description: Really great, actually the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco. First time here, service was great too highly recommend the fish masala. Plan on coming back soon.
author: Brian L.

description: Solid Indian food!  I'm full Indian, grew up around tons of Indian restaurants, and this one is super yummy!
author: Rupa P.

description: Awesome place that's conveniently close to BART. Dishes have just the right amount of richness and the spiciness can be customized for those who can't take the heat. Service is also quick and attentive, definitely makes this my go-to Indian restaurant in the city.
author: Dominic B.

description: This place is great and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Food is delicious and the portion sizes are huge compared to what you get elsewhere in the city for the same price. Would definitely come here again
author: Elle B.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco so we came here to have dinner. We chose this place because it wasn't as busy as some other Indian restaurants and it seemed to be geared towards a fancier outing. The décor was nice, the silverware and glassware were geared more towards a fine dining atmosphere than the traditionally casual Indian restaurants. 
The food was good, not great, but definitely not bad. I used the Yelp check-in offer of a free entrée, so that was a plus. The issue I had was with the employees. On more than one occasion, there was an individual who would stare directly in your eyes as he walked by. I'm not talking about a glance...it was a full on unwavering stare as he walked about 10 paces either toward us or pass us...very awkward. To make it worse, we were seated directly next to the host's area next to the entrance, and while we were eating, about 4 or 5 of them huddled over the host's podium, speaking in Indian, and would occasionally look at us, then go back to talking. It made for a very awkward dinner, especially since we were the ONLY occupied table in the restaurant. Furthermore, the employees proceeded to eat their own dinner in the walkway of the bathroom, meaning you had to break up their feast and walk inches away from their food and where they were sitting in order to access the bathroom. I understand it was 8pm, empty, on  Friday (what does that tell you?) but they should've eaten elsewhere.
Now the employees were not rude, mind you. I believe they were trying hard to do their job the best they knew how. The issue, I think, is they are simply inexperienced and don't know what is considered acceptable in a restaurant.  I think with some proper training and rules, they can win back some business, but for now I will go somewhere else to eat.
author: McKay W.

description: North India is delicious! Highly recommended. If you don't know what naan to get, I suggest the aloo paratha (with peas and potatoes inside). We ordered the chicken korma and saag paneer. Also, best spicy Indian green sauce I've ever had.
author: Jamir N.

description: Our experience here was great from start to finish. The food was absolutely fabulous, we ordered naan, madras curry, the paneer tikka dish and the chana masala. Our food came out quickly and the atmosphere was very pleasant with white table cloths and perfect lighting. Overall this place is great if you want a delicious, fast meal.
author: Melissa A.

description: Clean, great ambiance, delicious & solid food, good service - can't ask for more on a cold Sunday night in SF. A good change from our other go-to's in the TL and definitely easy to get in & out without the crazy wait time. Finishing off our meal with a couple of chai's on the house, nice touch!
author: Susan L.

description:
Best Indian Food in SF! They are so friendly and have the best Tikka Masala....
Also, their delivery is super fast and they never make a mistake! Love North India, they are a local gem.
author: Kyle M.

description: I had a great dinner at North India tonight. The ambience was nice and intimate, perfect for a date or catch up with a friend. The service was fantastic -attentive but not intruding. We ordered masala chai teas, lamb vindaloo, chicken tiki masala, and garlic nan. The lamb had nice heat and chicken had good flavor. We specified that we like spicy and the waiter even checked to see if we wanted the dishes more spicy! The garlic nan was so-so and dishes did not come with rice so had to order that separately. With the yelp deal of half off our second entree our total bill was about $20 per person. They even offered us complimentary dessert! Will definitely return!
author: Yin L.

description: Great food. Friendly staff. Coupon keeps us coming back regularly. Love the lamb saag and chicken korma. Naan is crispy and buttery. Trying to hit up the lunch buffet
author: Max D.

description:
Really nice waiters. Food tastes good. Best of all is the seating. Loved sitting next to the glass and not stuffed into a room with deep carpets n heavy curtains to eat rich food. Glass on both sides as we had a corner table in the best corner of the restaurant. Great as this gave an open feeling without the chill of outdoors.
My husband and I ordered a thali that says it feeds 2 people. But it really serves 4 people we think. Big portions. Raita could be more though. It had about 4 veggies/curries and rice and bread, along with starters and dessert - all at $44. They changed some of the dishes in the combo to veg for us on request. After eating here we had to walk about quite a bit to work off the amounts we had consumed. Phew...
The people next to us got a sizzler.. hissing, crackling and hot from the kitchen... spewing steam. You might want to ask the waiters about that dramatic dish.
Will be returning here.. with more people to do the eating :) Also will be asking them for some lightly cooked veggie food so that I can cheat on my diet but not cheat that big. One of our dishes - spinach saag had a good amount of cream in it I think.
And yes, if they don't give it to you on their own, ask for the complimentary chutneys - mint and tamarind that really add nice flavors to the food :)
The waiters were really courteous, and sorta chill which I like at Indian restaurants.. not overly enthusiastic which is nice.
On our way out we noticed a sign that said - Lunch Box for $5. I think that may totally be worth a try!
And did I say I loved the balance of this place.. not overly fine dining. But not casual. So.. perfect IMO. Elegant, not hoity-toity and good food :) Even the ethnic women paintings on the walls (a staple at all Indian restaurants) had simple lines and were not making one plunge deep into rural India just because you were out to eat Indian food. Loved the lightning too. Just correct.
My husband and I were thinking that you could do a date night here if you wanted to explore Indian food.. and mainly because it leaves you so satiated and pleased.. it is sure to help the date as well :) The ambiance totally works for a date night too. Soft, glowy, and intimate-ish with a bar. Order the thali n you will feat like you are doing an Asterix feast.
Next time I go.. I'll be looking for lighter cooked veggies.. fresh and seasoned n not creamed n curried much. hope they have that! :)
author: Malvika B.

description: Very good Indian food. I was impressed by the attentive service and really appreciated the free chai. The tandoori chicken was the best I've ever had in my entire life, put that on mama's.
author: Ben Y.

description: Cooldeep is an awesome server. He recommended our chicken biryani- tasty and just the right amount of spice. Add a kingfisher to top it off!
author: John E.

description: Delicious Indian food. What it's all about! I had great service and the chef even prepared my food to my request-- perfectly. Loved the Chicken Tikka Masala, Naan, and Basmati rice. Thankful for such a great experience! The service was incredible was well. I went last Friday, and I'm planning to be back again today for lunch! Woohoo!
author: Angelene S.

description: This is my second time here while visiting SF and i love the chicken tikka masala and the naan is so buttery.... Service is fast and great!
author: Joanna G.

description: Love this place! There is finally a good place in the city for indian food! Had take out today...went to go pick it up...Kuldeep at the front desk is the man...brought us 2 cups of chai to the car while I waited for food and hooked us up with free dessert! And the lamb biryani and chicken saag we had were amazing!! Thanks Kuldeep!
author: N B.

description: Been here a couple of times now for lunch with the team at work. I'm a pretty big fan of Indian but after coming here 2 times I've gotta say that i'm not overly impressed. They've got a small-decent variety of foods for their lunch buffet, as well as a couple of dessert options. Along with their lunch buffets they also to take away (out) boxes as well. All in all, their curries are not bad, and not great. But many other yelpers here really seem to enjoy their food. If you are looking to give this place a try, I'd say go for it.
author: David C.

description:
Went for lunch with a friend on a typical FiDi weekday. Wasn't sure how good or bad this could be, since I'm North Indian and my friend's Irish. Totally different tastes!
The line was out of the door! We got a table right away but there were people waiting right behind us. The line to get to the lunch buffet was literally all the way to the door. This could either mean, the food was super good and fresh ( since they'd have to constantly replenish to feed so many people) or very slow service. Turns out it was the first one! Food was super yum and fresh out of the tandoor! ;)
We heaped as much as possible in the first round only coz there was no way I was standing in a line this long for a second serving!
The naans especially were fresh and steaming hot! The waiters even came to the tables with fresh garlic naans. The kheer  ( rice pudding) was yum too.
As for the flavors, they weren't overpoweringly indian and spicy for my Irish friend and yet as a north indian, i was happy and satisfied! And all this for just 11.99$! A steal, in my humble opinion.

The reason for taking away one star -  The long lines!
author: Twinkle T.

description: Very good food! Ordered delivery and it arrived quicker than the estimated delivery time. Food was hot and delicious!
author: Gabrielle P.

description: The best Indian Buffet! The food was hot and delectable! Really crowded during noon time but Norman always makes it happen to accommodate our party!
author: Rachel E.

description: Great lunch time buffet. Food is bomb. Service is good. Highly recommended.
author: Jonathan A.

description: I had a meetup here back in June 2015.  The group loved the food and nice staff.  I did notice that due to the staff being all men, the women's restroom was lacking seat covers and toilet paper.  Plus the trash was over flowing.  I reported this to a gentleman that worked there when I arrived at 5 pm on 6/23.  When I used the facilities again at 7:15 pm, nothing changed.
author: J H.

description: Great experience at North India. Highly recommend the lamb masala... Cooked perfectly. Another enjoyable dish was the eggplant stew. Creamy goodness!!! Will be back
author: Caitlin L.

description:
Why I give this 5 stars:
-The food is consistently great
-The interior is quite pretty, and the booths and cushions are very well done
- The price is typically just $25/person for a full meal, which is quite cheap for a restaurant of this quality in the city.
author: Martin L.

description: Good food and decent ambience. The biryani was authentic and not too greasy/spicy like most other places. Came on a Monday afternoon after the buffet was over and ended up ordering the vegetarian Biryani.
author: S R.

description: The ambience is great, but the food wasn't very well cooked. The paneer Makhani tasted awful for such a highly rated spot
author: Pranav J.

description: Soooooo good!! Great, GREAT Indian Food. I come here during lunch. They have an excellent buffet. Super friendly workers. Super clean. Highly recommend!!!!
author: Aykut A.

description: The restaurant was very nice, and had a cool atmosphere. The staff was super attentive and nice. The food was really good. I highly recommend the garlic and plain Naan with the yogurt sauce. Really good.
author: Angelina J.

description: Fresh and delicious food for a reasonable price. My girlfriend and I have been here twice now with the groupon deal. We consistently order the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan with keer for desert. I will definitely be back again!
author: Taleb A.

description:
Saag Panner is awesome. Spinach is very well blended in spices and panner was so fresh.  Nothing can go wrong with this item. Food is good. They care about their customers and are courteous. Loved the Coconut Ice-Cream. I order togo, delivery was fast and would order again. 

One of the few restaurant I have experienced that really care about customers.
author: Nitesh J.

description: This is an authentic Indian food  place.. Delicious food great service. Must go place to have Indian food with delicious taste of North India spices. I must attest to the fact that you are gonna love it. Give it a try once.
author: Nitin S.

description: The food was solid and service was great, treated us to free dessert!  I'd definitely come back again!
author: Diana B.

description: We came in for a late night meal/snack. We were seated promptly and the server was very good at helping us navigate the menu. The ambience and decor was great and we really liked the general feel of the place. The food was delicious! We ordered spicy and they did not disappoint. Would definitely come again.
author: Simon C.

description: Authentic  northern Indian cuisine in the middle of downtown with a super nice ambience. Service is great with a personal touch. One of my favorite places to dine in when I visit SF. Don't miss the house Chana dal and try the Kashmiri chicken if you are in mood for something new.
author: P D.

description: This is the first time I've ever eaten at this place. I placed my to-go order through GrubHub and I forgot to add rice to my order. The guy on the phone added one complimentary order of rice. I haven't tried the food yet but the service is good so far.
author: Diana H.

description: This place is great! Good atmosphere and staff. Cooldeep was a wonderful host and I will definitely be coming back again for takeout.
author: Kayla N.

description: The food is delicious, and I love the environment. We ordered the lamb vindaloo and Kashmiri chicken, and both were delicious! The naan was freshly made (still warm mmm ^,^), and the staff is super friendly! We even got free ice cream on the way out!
author: Aurielle P.

description: The food and service were great. The chicken tandoori and chicken tika masala were delicious. We will definitely come again when we are in San Francisco.
author: Shauna B.

description: The food was really delicious, but what made the experience even better was how kind the staff was. The staff was nice and smiling the whole time, and they even gave us a complementary dessert at the end of our meal. A wonderful experience!
author: Cassie B.

description: If you are looking for an authentic India meal then NI is the place to go. We went there during peak office hours and were seated almost immediately. It literally felt like i was back in India. The buffet is the way to go with 4-5 options of gravy. The Chicken Makhani is perfect for those of you who want to be WOW'ed by flavor but not have tears streaming down your face. The Gulaab Jaamun (a traditional Indian desert which is fried and then dunked in sugar syrup... I KNOW!) was one of the best that I have had in any buffet. I did an extra 10 min of cardio to pay the price. I am always skeptical of consuming Indian food outside of India but this place was authentic. They kept refilling the pots and pans so the food was HOT! Only bad thing was I had to study post lunch and JUST COULD NOT KEEP MY EYES OPEN. Other than that, happy tummy :D
author: Shruti D.

description: Food is great!  Chicken Tikka Masala is on point.  Aloo Ghobi complimented it well.  The waiter recommended the assorted naan. All delicious.  Good atmosphere with many people. Nice to have a solid Indian restaurant in Financial District.  I would give it 5 stars but 1 out of the 3 waiters/greeters/bus boy was moody.  The other 2 were really nice, smiling, genuine.  The moody guy asked if we were done right after I told the other waiter we were still working on our food.  In the end we got a yelp discount 50% off a 2nd entree for checking in and then additional % off for us giving a review. Then they gave us free dessert; Gulob Jamun and mango ice cream!
author: Ben T.

description: Delicious tikka masala--tandoori looked great going by too! Great service and ambiance.
author: Andrew P.

description: The place has a good ambience and the service is very prompt. The food tastes amazing as well!
author: Raunaq R.

description: Awesome service, great food.  I am an Indian and this is how real Indian food tastes like.  My new favorite stop in the city.  Thanks kuldip for your hospitality.
author: J K.

description: Decided to try this somewhat new restaurant out as its in our neighbourhood. Had reservations for a Friday night but it was only half full. Food came out super fast (we had ordered & finished eating within 30 mins...great if you are in a hurry!) but the food was just lacking some oomph! Service was patchy, no cuttlery at our table despite there being 3-4 servers wandering around. No server to be found when I was looking for salt & pepper to enhance my meal either. We ordered the chicken tikka marsala & the rogan josh. Two standard indian meals and the rogan josh was really underwhelming for a medium spice level. The chicken tikka had much better flavor but was still just missing some amazing layers of indian spices. Both were 'medium' spice and were not at all spicy...not sure if they have just tamed the spice levels to american standards...but sometimes its better left authentic. The naan was not fluffy and delicious either. A disappointing find.
author: Nicole E.

description: I went for the lunch buffet and the food is mediocre with almost no flavors. The only item worth mentioning is the Veg Pakoras. The rice wasn't fresh, saag paneer didn't have any paneer and Rajma was too thick (possibly due to over warming). Gajar ka halwa as dessert was nothing like what it should be.
author: Mukul B.

description: Best north indian food ever!!! I am from Jersey, the mecca of indian food but this one beats everything out there...Awsome waiters and service..the lunch buffet was authentic and scrumptious. Keep it going guys!!!
author: Rozal S.

description:
Ordered delivery from here today.  Mediocre at best indian food.  Got the Chicken Tikka Masala and Prawn Coconut curry dish.  Chickent Tikka was alright but too tomatoey.  Prawn dish was ok and I did not like the coconut flakes in it.  Gave it a weird texture.  

Very dissapointing Garlic naan, soggy and flavorless.  I wish Little Delhi would've delivered for lunch.  My usual go to and much better than this place.

Overpriced too.
author: Jay H.

description: Authentic food, great tasting and a good ambience. Also try the masala tea (home style).
author: Siddhesh R.

description: Great food and the ambiance was great however it is very hard to find parking on 2nd street and the surrounding streets near the restaurant.
author: Katie Y.

description:
This review is for delivery. I have never been to this place, so can't speak to the sit-down experience.

The food was simply disgusting not to mention that it was delivered over an hour after we ordered. The curries were diluted with water - seemingly to fill the reasonably large containers that the food came in. The okra curry had more than several of the stem-ends that are typically discarded when the curry is prepared (they were inedible). The naans and aloo parata were close to an inch thick and burnt.

Never ordering from this place again.
author: P B.

description: Such good food, nice environment to celebrate the final presentation done, great experience for the first India meal!
author: Steve L.

description: Excellent service! Beautiful ambiance as well. Used the offered Yelp deal with no problem. Sat here for nearly an hour waiting for my friend, wasn't bothered negatively at all or told to move (they came by and asked if I wanted anything, etc). While I was waiting, one of the waiters was very friendly and talked with me while I was alone. When my friend came, they brought the food out immediately and the temperature was just right. Food was excellent, mango lassi was delicious. They even brought us extra sauce for our chicken tikka when they saw we had eaten it all. When we were done we asked for the check though we were still chatting and he said no rush and to take our time. At the end they offered us dessert and ended up bringing us complimentary ice cream. Excellent, highly recommended, and great value!!
author: Sonal P.

description: Best tikka masala I've had in a long time.  The manager is very friendly too. He treated us to free ice cream because we had a short chat with him.  Our waiter smiled alot, gave us speedy service, and joked with us.  Great place for a date - fresh roses on every table
author: Asmara H.

description: The lunch buffet was reasonably priced, but seriously lacking in the selection of meat dishes - one chicken and one lamb option. Watch out for bones in chicken! Overall good flavors in the vegetable dishes and unlimited naan provided for an enjoyable lunch.
author: Tucker K.

description: Great Quality Indian food in the SOMA.   Very Nice Atmosphere, but price is affordable for the quality and location.
author: Taylor M.

description: Great Indian Restaurant for everyone that is not only enjoying good food and drinks but also really nice service! Directly at second street and not more than a 3 minutes walk from Market street!
author: Madeleine B.

description: Ordered delivery. Saag paneer was definitely pretty good.  Samosas also good.  Chicken biryani eh... A little dry and bland.  I'd be willing to try other things next time
author: Riz W.

description: This place is solid Indian food, though I've definitely had better. They do have a minced lamb dish (I forget what it's called but you'll see it on the menu) that is definitely really special and different. The texture of the lamb is like nothing I've ever had before, it's very fluffy. I would only downgrade this place because some of there dishes are over salted.
author: Erin W.

description: Came here after work on a weekday - the saag paneer and the Chana masala were excellent, not too spicy, and the customer service was superb! Will definitely come back one day after work.
author: Larry G.

description: Hands down, the best Indian lunch buffet I've ever had.  They do a ton of business during lunch, so much so that it's hard to find a place to sit down and eat.  Because they're so busy, they're constantly making fresh food that's absolutely delicious.  For lunch, they had a huge assortment of options, and everything was great.  Total cost was around $15 incl. tax.  Took a long time to pay because they were so busy, but that's the only negative I can cite.  Definitely going to be coming back here, and definitely worth you giving them a try too.
author: Zach S.

description: Wonderful service and amazing food. Had a great server who was attentive, kind and quick! I would 100% recommend coming here and will be back soon.
author: Ayan J.

description: If you really like Indian food ,then this is not even right place. Buffet you will find very less no of items and tasteless food. I expect at least 2 sweets and they give you bakwaas keer. I will never visit this place again. It's not worth.
author: Anudeep D.

description: I really enjoyed my dining experience here at North India.  The restaurant is clean with a nice ambience to it.  Love the music in the background.  The servers were very nice, friendly, helpful, and attentive to our needs.  They kept my husband's beer glass full which was a big plus.  The food was amazing.  We had the papadum, naan, garlic naan, and samosas.  All were fabulous!  We ordered the butter chicken and chicken vindaloo extra spicy.   They were spicy and full of flavor.  Chai teas were a nice ending to our night of gluttony.  I wish we have a place like this close to where we live. We will definitely be back next time we visit.
author: Gc L.

description: Great food. Great service. A really nice Indian restaurant in the heart of Soma! The service and staff are particularly friendly. We had the sagg Paneer and cheese pakora and can I just say mmmmmmmmmmmmm so good. Omg. #awesome #Indian #zabardast #kyabaathai #areyvah #mera-no-1
author: Talitha D.

description: Disappointing. The food was cold. The owner kept trying to push us out by telling us to get into the buffet line and the waiters asked every ten minutes if we were done eating! Done with this place.
author: Vici P.

description: Prices are very reasonable, the service is excellent and the food is delicious. Very nice subtle atmosphere with candles and fresh roses. The music is authentic as are the menu choices. They offer options in mild, medium and hot. I am not able to tolerate spicy foods but the mild version of my prawn dish was perfect for me. Highly suggested.
author: Kim D.

description: Consistently great food. One of only a few Indian restaurants who will actually make your food genuinely spicy. Chicken Tikka Masala is perfect, and the Shrimp Tandoori is delightful. Quality place to grab a quick and tasty meal, very authentic, and totally reasonable.
author: Zoe J.

description: Tasty buffet, good value, nice wait staff.  I only knocked off one star because one time the dessert rice pudding was sour, so I dont know how often they make it, but all the other savory food is always great.  Good chai too--I am a sucker for real Indian chai.
author: Kandi K.

description: Lunch box is awesome and they are super friendly. Will customize the lunch box to your taste and preference... I am a regular, as in I go everyday:) very happy.
author: Heena K.

description: While in vacation my friend took me here. Service  is outstanding and the food was amazing. A must stop if you ever in San Francisco.
author: Paperandcharcoal P.

description: This is as close to authentic that I have had in the city. I have spent time in the state of Bihar and in Delhi, this reminds me of my travels. Consistently good with attentive staff. With 2 yelp check-ins you get a discount on your next meal. They're into customer loyalty and thats a good thing.
author: Steve S.

description: This is a second review about how bad the briyani was, but the owner of the North Indian Restaurant called me almost instantly after I have posted the comment. He was sincerely apologetic and offered me a second delivery with no charge. I will give this place a second taste, and will update the previous one star I gave this place to a 4-5 star hopefully. Well, a place that has no doubt in my mind that they care about their customers, deserves a second star for now. :) cheers!
author: Ann Hui Y.

description: I really like this place. The food is tasty and they are always nice to us even though my 3 year old sometimes makes a mess. Also, the rice pudding dessert (kheer) is really yummy!
author: Carmen T.

description: Ordered takeout. The Naan bread was good, but samosas and Saag Aloo (spinach and potatoes) were bland and Paneer Makhani (homemade cheese in tomato sauce) was too salty. There's better vegetarian Indian food out there.
author: S P.

description: one star for timely delivery. We ordered from this place yesterday eve and everything was watered down, flavorless, and entrees absent of tasty spices, served with rice.that tasted days old.We wanted our usual savory, delicious, and well prepared Indian cuisine, gave this place a try due to 4 star rating. So disappointing! We have experienced not so good Indian cuisine, but last night's experience was bad with my husband is sick all day today. No, I don't recommend this place for delivery, possible they do better job for dinning in.
author: Yoo Y.

description: Good food, good service. As I was leaving the waited kept saying I have a gift for you. Turns out I left my CC, thanks for catching me!
author: adam t.

description: Delicious food-- we had the saag paneer and chicken vindaloo and greatly enjoyed both.  Friendly and attentive service (they were happy to ice the bottle of wine we ordered when I thought it was a bit warm when I tasted it, for instance).  A bit on the noisy side because of a birthday party.
author: Amy S.

description: Really great service! We asked for extremely spicy but still want to taste to food and it came out perfect.  I love that they bring out red onions with the meal. The pickle was also very good.
author: Anna H.

description: Very good nan! Also got the chicken tikki masala and the prawn biryani which had a decent amount of prawns. Service was good and had great atmosphere.
author: Justin E.

description: Awesome! Great food, fun service. Easy to get to from BART and not overly noisy/crowded. Ordered four entrees, two types of naan, and the calamari starter for four people and was the perfect amount. Food came out piping hot; we got to choose our spiciness level. We were treated with chai tea AND rice pudding after the meal. The pudding was incredible and perfect for my sweet tooth. Great for a night out with friends or an after work meal. Thanks!!
author: Essie L.

description: Ordered lunch delivery for our office and everything was great! Food came right on time, was very delicious and was even hooked up with free sides by Kuldeep! Highly recommend.
author: Kristina D.

description: Great Indian restaurant. Nice location for those working in the financial district. The service is fast and the servers are always very friendly. Excellent Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan.
author: Doug B.

description: This is an amazing Indian restaurant and if you are looking for authentic North Indian style food then look no further. The service is impeccable, and the atmosphere is straight out of India. The music and the smell of the restaurant just bring so many memories. And as a fellow traveler having traveled all over asia. I can with all confidence say this is one of the best Northern Indian restaurants I've been to and will keep coming to! Thanks again. And for all those Mango Lassi Lovers it is to DIE for!!!!
author: Fweddy T.

description: I am not one to write reviews, I always prefer to read them but North India deserves to be recognized. First off, I am a repeat customer because their food is always fantastic. I am a customer for life because their staff and service is one in a million. One night as I was caring for my niece and nephew, I ordered Tikka Masala, Prawn Biriyani, Garlic Naan, and a Mango Lassi to be delivered to my home. After I made the phone call I realized my 3 year old nephew was acting strange and he then began to have a seizure. I rushed him to the hospital and as you can presume, had forgotten about the food. Norman, the wonderful man who took my order called me to check in (as his driver had arrived to an empty home) and listened to me hysterically cry over the phone. He told me not to worry, family first, and that they would leave the food for when I returned and I could pay later (I was supposed to pay cash upon delivery). Days pass and I had completely forgotten, he never badgered me for money, he never was unkind to me, he was only compassionate and understanding up until the day I called to complete payment. This place is spectacular in more ways than culinary experience and I promise you will never leave dissatisfied. Thank you for your kindness, Norman.
author: Natalie G.

description: The lunch buffet is really good. The paneer bhurji  is very yummy. This is a good place for vegetarians.
author: Brindhaa K.

description: Very good! They definitely understood that "spices" didn't mean "spicy." That's something a lot of Indian restaurants don't understand. Loved the spices they used.
author: Sandy W.

description: So I came to this restaurant today and asked about the lunch to go and they told me to go around the back. I went around the back and waited in the line. I have to say off top that being an African American and being told to go to the back to get my food struck a nerve with me. So here I am waiting in the back like some slave or someone only allowed in the colored section. And of course people of every nationality were in the lines but I still didn't like the feeling. They wouldn't let anyone step in the actual restaurant just had us standing there while a server blocked the entranceway and took orders. I think it is terrible service to serve food through a back entrance and not even let them step foot in the restaurant. Just because we are not spending an exorbitant amount doesn't mean we shouldn't get good service. Anyway the food was not good to top it all off.
author: Jenn G.

description: Absolutely superb food. Most caring and heartfelt waiters I've found in years. Clean and modern facilities, while still boasting traditional Indian design and style. This place definitely deserves many more customers.
author: TJ P.

description: They catered my daughter's first birthday party.  The food was amazingly good and service was excellent!  We highly recommend this restaurant!  All our guests enjoyed the food very much.
author: Elena L.

description: The food was very tasty. We had the butter chicken, chicken corma, the panjabi fish curry and all was very flavorful. Definitely coming back! Our server Cooldeep was super helpful and very friendly.
author: Carinna A.

description: Great food and good service. The staff was very accommodating about my dislike of cilantro and made my dishes without it. Prices are reasonable but dishes do not come with rice or naan so you have to order those items separately.
author: Shay S.

description: Finest quality Indian buffet for lunch that I have ever had.
author: S C.

description: I don't think I'll be eating here ever. I was on my way to work, as I was passing by I thought -NICE! I saw the bar tender well dressed, the server well groomed, the dinning room well set. As I turned the corner, passing by the kitchen's back door, I noticed one of the cooks on the back hallway floor rubbing his bare feet.  no way! ;/ eew!
author: Undress G.

description: This was a great find in the financial district. My wife loved the calamari, beware a little spicy even though she asked for moderate, I had the chicken and devoured it. Ambiance really nice and authentic. You'll be happy if you like Indian food. Comfortable and friendly staff.
author: Tim F.

description: Good service when busy not great. Presentation was ok but no explanation that both orders were put together for naan and desserts. Lamb was very good although too spicy for me at mild. Lol
author: Neal S.

description: This place has the best Indian food and best service. Love their roses on every table too! Pick Cooldeep as your waiter!
author: Kimvy V.

description: The food was authentic this coming from someone who grew up in India and was back there recently, the spices were just right, the Alu paratha was piping hot, the yoghurt was home made delicious. The food made me think of being back in India. Will definitely come back!
author: Jan L.

description: Prompt and polite delivery. Chicken masala, naan,  and rice was very good. Also the sweet lassi was very good dessert/drink. Thank u North India!
author: Erik F.

description:
Nice restaurant. I had my birthday lunch on an Friday afternoon ..the restaurant was very busy ,but the still managed to do a pretty good job at serving all the clients.the sweetest surprise was the owner/ manager got me n my friends a desert dish with candles on and turned the music loud to wish he a happy birthday :).
Will definitely go there again for their yummy food.
author: Manju U.

description: We had the buffet at this place and sadly I have to say that the food was really bad in terms of taste, it was really stale, and the waiters were not ready to accept the fact that the food was not fresh. To anyone who is looking for a good Indian restaurant this would definitely not be your pick.  Ideally I would not give any stars for the place but that the minimum I had to pick.
author: Paresh R.

description: Yay! It's my first yelp review and I'm excited to say this place is more than deserving of the given 5 stars. Admittedly, I was a bit hesitant on ordering bc of other yelp reviews, but hey! big risk, big rewards aye? Anyways, the food was AMAZING! Give this restaurant a fair shot and you won't be disappointed.
author: Rena K.

description:
I went on opening night and was really hoping for a decent experience. 

Why the two stars? 
- The food took over 45 minutes to arrive. 
- There was a piece of plastic in my mattar paneer - to their credit they gave it no charge, but the experience is totally gone at that point. 
- The taste was just okay. For a spicy dish it was quite bland and tad watery. 

I want them to succeed. I'll give them one more try. Hopefully it'll be better next time.
author: Rahul A.

description: This place is delicious!! I am new to Indian food and I loved everything! And Buffett at lunch!
author: Lauren H.

description: This is pretty good indian restaurant in SF.  Great food, not heavy in cream, butter & oil.  We had the samosas (above average), saag panner (very good), vegetable jalfrezi (very good) with the naan and parathas.   Service was ok ( the chutneys came out after our samosa),  restaurant is very nice (white table cloths & clean).  This will be our go-to Indian food place in SF.
author: Sheetal P.

description: Really delicious meal! Highly recommend! We had the chicken tikka masala and it was really well made. The atmosphere is really nice with good lighting.
author: Kayla M.

description: service is excellent. location is great, close to bart station. Ambiance is great. Very friendly staff. Food is also very good but little too greasy. Still good enough that I ll come back.
author: A S.

description: Good indian food with reasonable price in downtown. Service is also good. Waiters are nice and friendly.
author: Hiro I.

description: The lunch buffet is overcrowded. Too long to wait if you want a 2nd serving. They should move the buffet to a different location so people can double load the buffet serving from either side. They lose 2 stars for poor layout and planning. Wait time is bad.
author: T L.

description: Really good food and awesome service. Friendly ambience makes my lunch much better. Taj Mahal beer after work makes my day!
author: Ashu T.

description: The food and service was excellent. We ordered in bulk for an event and they did a tremendous job. Food came right on time! It was a big hit and everyone absolutely loved it. Norman was great to coordinate with, very prompt and we got free side dishes as well as chutneys. I would highly recommend North India, if you're in the mood for some amazing flavorful Indian food! They always exceed our expectations and give us a great price. Again very tasty food, its a must try for everyone.
author: Megha C.

description: Best gulab jamun.  Great lunch buffet.  Walking distance to my office.
author: Nicole L.

description: I came in here for the $9.95 lunch buffet the day after it opened.  It is the old Tara space and I like how it has been opened up to accommodate many more people.  The buffet was great. They had all of the usual North Indian fare.  I had a sampling of the veggie and fish pakora, lamb curry, tandoori chicken, channa masala,  gulab jamun (so GOOD here), and kheer.  The serves even bring over a serving of hot buttery naan (which is included in the price) after you fill up your plate. The service was fantastic- all of the waiters were attentive and seemed to be pleased to be there.  I love that it is next door to my office - I will definitely be dropping by often.
author: Ronita J.

description: dece take out - the chicken tikka masala was on point, vindaloo wasn't very spicy even though we ordered hot, and the garlic naan was on point. took a bit longer than advertised and you should never withhold indian food from starving humans after a night at local edition :)
author: Reyana F.

description: FANTASTIC! Reasonably priced and delicious. Paneer makhani was great as was the hyderbadi chicken. Aloo gobi didn't do much for us. Definitely would return. Prompt, kind service
author: Sam G.

description: Ok food! Was served with Chana dal when asked for yellow Dal. Dirty restaurant as servers were dressed in dirty clothes.
author: Sakshi T.

description: Nice downtown buffet. Nice tablecloth setting. Has a lot of the standard buffet fare with a couple of fresh items daily. Today was a spicy zucchini dish. The naan is always fresh and hot. Amazingly uncrowded at 1pm for lunch. Can't wait to come back for a dinner soon. The menu has some intriguing items on it. Waiters are courteous and prompt to remove your old plate for another round at the buffet.
author: Brian F.

description: Common Desi... cook up a better dish
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: I ordered the chicken tikka masala, lamb korma, and saag paneer. The saag and lamb korma were delicious with the right consistency and heat to it. As for the chicken tikka masala, it was good, but I prefer mines a little thicker and a tinge more on the sweet side. The manager was kind enough to give us complimentary rice! Oh and amazinggggg garlic naan, crispy with great garlic flavor! Overall, great food and good service! Will come back again!
author: Li C.

description: This place is fantastic. My favorite indian restaurant in SF. My boyfriend and I went there when they just opened. We had great indian food and very nice service. I hear they also have a lunch buffet so we'll be back for that!
author: Gwen B.

description: Great food and ambience. Awesome customer service. Definitely my go to place for Indian food!!
author: Imandeep S.

description: Had this food via delivered via GrubHub for myself and my boyfriend. The food was cold and pricey especially for the amount of food you get. This is hands down the most bland Indian food I have ever eaten. Two stars because maybe it's hot food if you get it in the restaurant? I'm probably not ever going to go so I'll never know for sure.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Tasty Indian food, really attentive service. Looks upscale but prices are what you'd expect from any other Indian place in the city. Also one of the few restaurants open during the weekend in the area.
author: Joffrey F.

description: This place is solid. Great prices, food,  and the service is excellent. We live right around the block from here and come here frequently. Definitely my go-to spot for Indian food in SoMa.
author: Jamie E.

description: Soooooo yummy!! Kuldeep was great and extremely friendly. Food was delicious too. I don't usually write reviews but the pineapple ice cream told me I had to.
author: Ari M.

description: This is the best Indian food I've ever had in my life.  It's quick, inexpensive ($10 for the buffet), with great service, and a great atmosphere (white table cloths).  Perfect for a nice, quick lunch during the week.  I will be back again and again and again and again.....
author: Sara H.

description: Soulless and bland food. One of the dishes the Rogan Ghost  seemed to have gone bad. It had a funky smell about it. Wonder if it was leftover dish from the buffet lunch or maybe a few days ago.. Nothing tasted fresh. I am sorry but I don't understand how yelpers have gotten it so wrong..
author: Sangeet R.

description: Great people placed a take out order 5 min before closing ! .... and they did it with a smile. side note rice portions are enough for two people don't believe each person needs one.
author: Matthew B.

description:
We stumbled upon this restaurant during a day in the city. It was quiet for a weekend evening, but I guess most of their business would be during the weekdays from businesses nearby.

The place was nicely decorated with soft music playing, plenty of choices on the menu for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. We ordered one of each. Portions were big (for the price), service was fast and friendly and the food quality was good. We even got a complementary dessert at the end ... haha.

I liked the place, and will surely consider going there again when I am in the area.
author: Manish P.

description: Solid lamb biryani and chicken saagwala. Cooldeep, our waiter, was very attentive. Garlic naan was tasty without being too buttery.
author: Bianca C.

description: I ordered delivery and it showed up an hour late. When it arrived, my pakoras were soggy. My naan tasted like it had been dipped in water and then microwaved. My Rogan Josh was edible, but lukewarm. It might actually have been decent if it was hot.
author: Max K.

description: We stumbled upon this place while wandering around the city. What a gem!  The food was delicious, the service was fast and friendly. Very authentic and not at all pretentious. My new favorite!
author: Paige L.

description:
The food is good here. The problem is the service. My wife and I came in around 1 pm and ordered the buffet - sort of pricey for a buffet, but okay. At that point in the day, they were low on several things in the buffet. We figured they would replenish for our second trip back. Our second trip - there was no rice. and the sauces and a few of the dishes were very low. As well, they were still inviting people to order the buffet as they came in. My wife asked for more rice, so a waiter gave her a dish of white rice (rather than just replenish the buffet supply, which is what she meant for him to do) - much more than both of us needed. 

We finished up, and since there was so much rice left over, my wife asked for a to-go box, which the waiter brought. That elicited a visit from the manager/owner. My wife explained that the rice was just going to be thrown away, but he jabbered 'If I did this for everyone, I would be out of business.' He went away, and I thought all was over. I paid a tip that was too much for what we got in return, and left. The bill that went to the credit card company included an extra buck, I suppose 'for their trouble.' This was after I signed the form. We could fight, but it is not worth the time, and we threw out the receipt anyway. 

We will not be going to this place again - there are others that might not sell buffet lunches when there are only remnants left in the dishes.
author: Steve D.

description: They were very accommodating and gave me the check in offer for takeout! The food here is top notch as well. Highly recommended.
author: Kevin L.

description: Had dinner there last night with 2 companions. Samosas were an excellent appetizer. Shared chicken tikka masala, goat curry, palak paneer, chicken biryani, and the naan sampler basket. Everything was simply delicious! Staff were super courteous, and the ambiance quite nice. Highly recommended!
author: Roslyn B.

description: Ok - so they were super kind to me when I ordered a whole chicken and an order of naan to go. They even brought me a cup of delicious tea and a papadum with sauces while I was waiting! Minus 1 maybe  minus 2 stars for the fact that I ordered a whole chicken (as was written on the menu), and when I got home I opened the bag to discover about 12 chicken legs! Unless this was a mutant cartwheeling chicken, I'd say I was duped. I'd be more angry about it, but man we were hungry and it was still delicious. Maybe they should change the description on the menu to "as much chicken as a whole chicken" or "the weight of 1 whole chicken in legs only" or "Durga Chicken with the many legs."
author: Soy P.

description: Really tasty, I love that I left satisfied and still feeling light! Had the saag paneer and Bombay chicken with nan. Great service and ambiance. Will be back soon to try the butter chicken !
author: Monica R.

description:
The closest thing to real punjabi food I can get in sf! Love this place!! 

Lunch buffet service sucks, but I don't care because the the good is so good. They also kinda rush you but I take my time. 

Waiters and waitresses barely speak English- by I don't care about that rather because the food is so good! Lol
author: Tarveen V.

description: The food there is amazing with decent price and the waiters are very polite. I really enjoyed my dinner there!
author: Yizhen J.

description: Gristly meat in one (out of two) chicken dishes. Floor greasy and slippery. Potential, but not there yet.
author: James W.

description: Delish!  Came here for lunch buffet and was not disappointed.
author: Kelly W.

description: Great food... Typical Delhi taste. We love it..i recommend to those who really want to enjoy North Indian food
author: Pawan S.

description: Went here for the buffet with a friend, but missed it by a few minutes.  Decided to stay and eat lunch off the dinner menu anyways, and it turned out to be a great decision.  These guys provided some of the best service I have ever had (and thus prompted me to write my first yelp review).  First off, they discounted our meals to equal buffet prices.  They brought out all of the food really fast, and gave us free dessert (rice pudding) at the end.  Overall, a really awesome experience...highly recommended.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Very little in non-meat entries on the buffet.  Food was good, but bummed we had to order from the menu when they had a buffet.  Cost was considerably more for lunch.
author: Richard R.

description: Food was very good. Service was courteous and quick. So why two stars, you say? After eating here at 5pm, I was back and forth from the bed to the toilet until 11 the next day (sorry if that's TMI). It was a basic meal, nothing I haven't had before, but I won't be going back.
author: David H.

description: Great spot!  Onion naan and saag pannier where great dishes. Fun and easy place to take kids.
author: George C.

description: The chicken korma was delicious! There was a bit of crunch, a little sweet, and lots of spice. It wasn't that mild but I have a low tolerance so should probably not be relied on as a judge of spicyness. They were good about water refills so it was good :) My friend really loved his mixed seafood curry.
author: Sophie Z.

description: Just ordered for delivery through the Yelp app. The food is tasty, but the portions are tiny. The tandoori was chicken was the smallest I've ever had. It is a poor value compared to other Indian restaurants and definitely disappointing. To top it off, they shorted me a garlic naan. I'd give one and a half stars if I could. I wouldn't order again, unfortunately.
author: Matt T.

description: Delicious food. The buffet for lunch is a great deal, especially since it's all you can eat! Friendly staff. The one recommendation I want to make is that they should turn the music down a little bit. Would make the place a little cozier!
author: D C.

description: Great place for Indian food! And cheap beer during happy hour! The lamb was so flavorful and spicy. There was meat in every bite! This place is worth coming back to!
author: Laurie M.

description: I went there for the buffet lunch with coworkers, great food and the ambiance was really nice. I would definitely go back. Staff was very friendly, place was clean, only thing that could have been better is more options for dessert. They had plenty of options for food though.
author: Kal T.

description: Best Indian food I have found in San Francisco. The food is so fresh, the flavors are on point and the sauces are thick and delicious, not watered down like other places I've tried. The staff is very friendly and attentive. On my recent visit they even gave me some of their yummy garlic naan to snack on while I waited for my to-go order to finish. Very convenient downtown location and great ambience - roses on tables are a nice touch.
author: Heather S.

description: If you like spice make sure to ask for extra hot, otherwise it is pretty mild. Over all, pleasant experience.
author: Bennito R.

description: We just walked in because it looked quite nice from the outside but when we got our food, there was a black hair in the chicken! They didn't really seem to know what to do and just watched us walk out.  I would not go back.
author: Jenna P.

description: I love the tandoori chicken which comes on the sizzling iron plate. Chicken curry is great as well.
author: Katy I.

description: Awesome place I love it! The food is great and I like the atmosphere. Servers are friendly. I ordered a lamb dish and it was delicious. I recommend other people to try it out!
author: Elaine C.

description:
I have been here many times but only for the take-out lunchbox special. Never eaten inside so cannot be a judge of that. 

The lunchbox special is good. I am vegetarian and most of the curries have been pretty good. The Malai Kofta is slightly too sweet for me though. But the paneer dishes have been nice.

The thing I like about their lunchbox is, you can choose any curry from their buffet (hidden secret, your welcome). It is not just a fixed 1-2 options like Mehfil has down the street. 

My friend came with me and had Chicken Makhani once though and he hated it. He felt sick from it immediately and threw it away. I have never encountered anything of that sort. It was probably the meat that was bad that day.
author: Saumya B.

description: Stopped by to end our thanksgiving trip. Perfect hospitality and service as expected by North Indians :).  Food was excellent and our servers were amazing. If you are a lover of Punjabi music that's icing on the cake. While enjoying the amazing food you get to listen to typical "thaith" Punjabi music. Bottom line- go and try it out for yourself!
author: Aman S.

description: I've had a lot of Indian food but this is def one of the better ones! Great ambiance too
author: Jen W.

description: Had their dal and garlic naan- average food. Yet to try out their non-veg options
author: Gvn G.

description: I'm upgrading the review for customer service. The owner was nice enough to call and remake the Tikka Masala free of charge to try again. Although I did not get the opportunity to try it again, next time I am in SF I will definitely be giving them a call! Thanks North India
author: Emily B.

description: Just flew into San Fran and I got a takeout from here; the food tastes just like home, it was like eating from my mothers kitchen. Pure proper North Indian food, definitely lives up to its name.
author: Sush M.

description: The food was very good and the prices reasonable with the exception that it was TOTALLY a la carte -- a main course came with NOTHING at all, not a condiment, not a rice ,not a bread ,not a vegetable.  Not so much of a problem if you have a bunch of people sharing but a problem if you're a single diner.  A bigger problem was the incompetent service -- we ordered 5 things and the waiter totally forgot two of them, first the wine and then one of two main dishes -- which by the time we realized that he might have just forgotten it, we had to rush through eating and were still slightly late for our meeting to attend following the meal.  Further, no real apology let alone an offer of some courtesy compensation such as an appetizer or dessert or even something to nibble while we sat and waited.   They were also reluctant also to turn down the loud TV, let alone off, though, at the time we asked, the four of us were the only customers -- presumably because the staff wanted to watch  !  Still the food was good enough that I'd go back again and, as I'm a Professor of Management, it makes a great story to tell my class about poor management.
author: Lee R.

description: Only restaurant in the area that was still open in the afternoon and it was a great place to try. The food was awesome, authentic and overall just a great atmosphere.
author: Gabriel B.

description: We found this restaurant on Yelp and right down from our hotel. Great atmosphere we got the corner booth w a great view and the food was wonderful and we eat Indian food regularly. The staff was really nice. We would definitely come back!
author: Jon C.

description: Have tried only the lunch buffet here twice, Both situations polar opposite to each other. The first time I tried was on a sunday and there were only 3 ppl including me in the restaurant. The next time was on a Friday and there was no place even to stand inside the restaurant. Had to do some tricky things to secure a table for 2. Focusing on food, there is a lot of options here for veg and non-veg. Decent enough Indian food. Veg Pakoras and Alu Mattar was good. You might enjoy the place more on a Weekend than on a week day.
author: Sudharshan M.

description: Wonderful staff! Very kind and generous. Food was delicious. We had the seabass and loved it! The chicken and rice dishes were good as well...finished up with some ice cream on the house. Loved the romantic ambiance. We will definitely be going back!
author: Pascale F.

description: This restaurant has great service and exceptional food. The staff recognizes me and my friends every time we go in and the food is always great. One of my favorite Indian restaurants in San Francisco!
author: Anika J.

description: chicken vindaloo was pretty good. the meat platter starter was wonderful!
author: Ankur O.

description: Dropped in here after happy hour with a friend of mine, probably around 9 pm on a Wednesday. Say down in a corner booth, ordered some beer and some food. Excellent service, very attentive without being smothering. The food was that perfect balance between spicy and hurting. I really enjoyed the cauliflower. The server made some great recommendations and despite being close to closing time, was happy to bring out a couple of end of the night beverages. Overall very good experience. Will likely be back.
author: Nate C.

description: Excellent service!!!! Very cute waiters. Came close to closing and they were very sweet and welcoming. Excellent food, we order the tikka masala and the sag paneer, delicious!
author: Leah R.

description: average indian food, delivery wasn't quick. not cheap. (that's just about it).
author: Gilad P.

description: So far, North India Restaurant is one of the best Indian restaurants in San Fran I've ever tried. Seriously.  The food is so delicious and service is awesome.
author: moki m.

description: I've only come here for the lunch buffet with my co-workers, and for that purpose, this place is a pretty good choice. Unlike all the hipster Indian food joints in the city, North India Restaurant is a more typical fare (as it's lackluster name clearly suggests) - north indian curries, assorted varieties of Naans and a white-tablecloth, Indian paintings on the wall decor etc etc. I liked the variety and quality of the food. Not oh-my-god-this-is-so-delicious but also not this-is-awful. Just good enough for me to want to come to this place again. In terms of specific menu items, I thought that the veggie pakoras were fantastic, the Garlic Naan was spot-on (complimentary offerings with the buffet) and the Coconut Ice-cream was a nice little icing on the cake. One thing I really liked was  the fact that none of the veggie curries were too rich. They were neither dripping in oil nor smothered with butter nor exaggerated with spices. That's a good thing, because you don't want the rest of your working afternoon be spent day-dreaming in a food coma.
author: Srivatsan S.

description: Such a great restaurant! One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at in a while. I would definitely recommend the chicken madras with an aloo paratha. Servers were really friendly too!
author: Naomi B.

description: Great service! The chicken saagwala and the aloo gobhi were absolutely delicious. We ordered a garlic Naan and pulao to share between the two of us and had leftovers for another meal. Their chutney on the side added a unique taste to our dishes.
author: Darrin Y.

description: So good!! Fully authentic North Indian food. Perfect level of spice. And service is incredible. It's a family of brothers from Punjab - so nice. Some of the best Indian food in the city - they deserve your business. Try the fish tikka masala!
author: Dave V.

description: This place is great for the lunch buffet.  The selection is pretty much the same every time, but everything is good, especially the chicken tikka which is great.  This is one of the better deals I have found in downtown.
author: Andrew L.

description: Delicious curry. Nice decor. Great service! Skip the fish curry, go for the chicken tikka and aloo gobi
author: Lily L.

description: ive ordered here so many times, and i've never had a bad experience. food is super flavorful and fresh, delivery is fast and problem free. would highly recommend the tikka masala
author: Nicole S.

description: The food here is great and very reasonably priced, and the staff is super friendly. I'd highly recommend the paneer makhani - very creamy and delicious! They were very accommodating for our group of 7 (including a toddler) with a last-minute reservation. I would definitely come back again!
author: David W.

description: Fantastic food, great service! Very attentive, will definitely be back! Garlic naan was very tasty!
author: Nisha S.

description: Wow. This was unexpected. I went in for a quick bite on a Saturday night. Not much open past 10pm in FiDi... I yelped it and saw the good reviews.  Had the lamb naan, tandoori and tika masala chicken. Everything was outstanding. Probably one of the best Indian restaurant I've eaten and I've been to a few... Now I'll be going back for more!
author: Rob L.

description: The chicken makhani was perfectly spiced and the garlic naan was flaky. The service was polite and attentive. We will be back--eager to try the buffet!
author: Katerina D.

description: Tremendously good Indian food - family run, friendly, and authentic.  Best Indian food I've ever had.  Perfect naan, sauces are spot on... A feast for the palette.
author: Jason K.

description: We liked the food and ambience ..it's clean too.Kashmiri chicken is worth trying .my husband liked paneer jalfrezi too .
author: Prem M.

description: Delicious food. Great service, everyone very friendly. Nice decor with a rose on each table. Easy parking on Sunday night. They gave us free desserts :)
author: Jennifer S.

description: Not deserving of 4 stars. The food was inoffensive. Vegetable pakoras were almost entirely potatoes, and so dense. Chicken jalfrezi was heavy on the sauce. The meat itself was good quality but the boring sauce did it no favors. Probably a decent lunch buffet spot if you just want some curry flavor. Service was average.
author: Jason S.

description: Had the Kashmiri chicken and it was the best dish I have ever had in an Indian establishment.  Service was excellent.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone.  Extremely good!
author: Jeff G.

description: It is the best Indian food I have tasted in San Francisco. During my 30 day stay I went almost every day.
author: Srinivasa Pavana Kumar G.

description: Great food and super fast delivery! In the time I could have walked over to pick up my order...my food arrived! that's 20 minutes! Fastest food delivery ive ever gotten. I dont live that far but i was too lazy to walk..obviously.  But I've ordered from other Indian restaurants much closer to me and it would take over an hour. But i dunno ...maybe i should question  why it was such a quick delivery. Hmmm. Either way...food arrived earlier than expected and tasted really good = happy tummy, happy girl.
author: Mila B.

description: Amazing food and service!  A hidden gem in SOMA close to 2nd and Market in an area that is sorely in need of more restaurant and late night dining options.  I came in 2 minutes before closing (when no other restaurants were open), and the folks were super accommodating. Overall, North India bends over backwards to make you feel at home! Will definitely be back.
author: kimberly h.

description: Great place for a late night meal. They have great service and the staff is super friendly. The food is also very good.
author: Michael L.

description: Lunch boxes are a great deal. You walk up to the side and can choose between a couple different vegetable and meat dishes for $5-7. However, one time I got the chicken and there were lots of bones in it. Now I stick to the veggies.
author: Gina T.

description: I am from the UK, famous for great Indian food, and this is the best Indian food I've had in the USA.
author: J T.

description: Hmm, the food was certainly tasty and I like that when asking for spicy I actually got spicy. The service was overly attentive for my taste.  I could hardly take two sips out of my water without someone constantly refilling it.  I was actually trying to drink it down so I wouldn't have to be so careful about shaking the table while cutting stuff.  One of the waiters came by to light the candle at my table and thought it appropriate to rearrange the setting of condiments and my water glass that I'd already placed out of my way and had to then move again. While I was spooning the last bit of navratan korma from the serving dish onto my plate I could see the waiter in the corner of my eye hovering just beyond my table, waiting to come grab the serving dish the moment I finished.  When I finished and the waiter asked if I wanted any dessert I said, "No thanks, just the check." A moment later another young woman came by and asked if I wanted any dessert.  "No thanks, just the check".  Then before she returned with the check a third person came by and deposited a small bowl of rice pudding saying it was complimentary. Hmm, I thought I'd made it pretty clear I didn't want any dessert and I just left it there.  It really bothers me to waste food too so I didn't appreciate that they apparently thought they knew better than I did what I wanted and didn't want.
author: Mark G.

description: I went for snacks - samosa was too oily and tea was awful...doesn't deserve a star.. Holy cow this is crook Indian food
author: Chetan M.

description: We enjoyed the Lamb Korma and Saag Paneer! The mango Lassi is a favorite treat :-) The atmosphere is pleasant, company was great, and the music is very fun!!!!!! The portions are generous. I want to dance. Great for an intimate dinner or group of friends.
author: Mckenzie E.

description: Food decent. Ordered medium spicy. Asked for extra spice. Brought free ice cream at end. Would come back
author: K F.

description: Came here on a Tuesday. Great service, great food! I especially recommend the Kirahi gosht and the masala chai - best in the city! Our waiter even threw in a complementary dessert/rice pudding and was very friendly, checking on us through the meal. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. Can't wait to try this place for lunch in the future. :)
author: Kelsey B.

description: the service sucks! they didn't want to give me the discount even i have a coupon code, after that, even charged me more than the full price withouth notification!!! i just realize it when i saw my bank bill.
author: L L.

description: Came here with my colleagues and I must say I'm very happy with there food and service. Food quality and quantity is so good.Will come back again and this time with more people.
author: Kiranjit K.

description: I can't say enough about this restaurant. The food is so delicious and the guys are very funny. Don't miss me the weird pictures on the walls lol I cant explain you just have to see it.
author: Delroy H.

description: Great Indian meal.   Sauces were well balanced and not drowning in oil/ghee.   Very friendly and the staff seems genuine and gracious.   The mattar paneer was a stand out.
author: Joe G.

description: Excellent! After too many mediocre to below average Indian restaurant experiences in the S.F. area we finally found this place.  The Mulligatawny soup was not the puréed version instead it was packed with small chunks fresh ingredients seasoned perfectly.  Saag Paneer was full of tasty cubes of cheese in a smooth purée of fresh bright spinach.  The chicken Vindaloo had a fresh, homemade tomato based sauce with just the right blend of spice and heat.  Not too hot and no unusual bottled red color.  It was also packed with boneless chicken and just a few potatoes.  Unlike lesser places that offer just the opposite.  Even the simple Basmati rice was cooked with great care and attention.  It's nice to eat in a place were the kitchen take pride in their work as evident by everything we were served. The prices may be a dollar or two above the competition but well worth it.
author: Mike A.

description: One of thr very good indian restaurants in the city. The waiters here are so nice and welcoming. They engage you and recommend their specialities. I strongly recommend this place to people who love indian and are looking for a serene place for a delicious dinner.
author: Sasanka K.

description: Ordered twice from here. The dal, paneer and saag meat are awful.
author: Jack S.

description: I'm giving North India 5 stars because you should eat here!  We went for dinner last night and were impressed with the food quality, the friendly waiters, and the lovely atmosphere.  We ordered butter chicken with spinach in a clay pot, Navratan Korma, naan, rice and a mango lassi.  Prices are reasonable, food is very very good, and portions are generous!  (Oh, and a tip -- "medium" is spicy with a nice heat, not too crazy.  Perfect for our taste.) We had enough to bring home to our grateful daughters.  Used the Yelp coupon -- thanks North India!  And thanks for the complimentary rice pudding (the best I've had).  We can't wait to come back and try the lunch buffet.  Our new go-to Indian restaurant.
author: Karen L.

description: I was really disappointed with the chicken tika masala. It was so salty and didn't come with white meat like other Indian restaurants served.
author: DC D.

description: great deal for the lunch buffet. the chicken drums were delicious, nans were good too.
author: Danielle A.

description: great food and ambiance. this place is wonderful. i love the chicken tikka masala with garlic nan. service is impeccable and amazingly attentive. i will go back soon with my friends.
author: Omar A.
